loans.name: Fatoumata Sidi

texts.fr:
Madame Fatoumata Sidi est âgée de 42 ans, mariée  et mère  de 5 enfants. Elle vit dans une famille nucléaire au quartier Hamdallaye de Ségou.
Ayant abandonnée l’école au secondaire (système éducatif Malien), tôt elle embrassa le commerce auprès de sa mère qui vendait des condiments et de l’encense. Après plusieurs années d’apprentissage à son côté, elle  évolua seule  pour faire le même  commerce. Elle mène son activité depuis maintenant 7 ans et jouit d’une grande expérience. Sa force de vente est due à la qualité de son produit. Elle  vend sa marchandise au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. 
 Dans le souci de faire face à la demande clientèle et de faire plus de bénéfice, elle  sollicite ce nouveau prêt. elle  est en relation avec Soro Yiriwaso depuis 24 mois, avec 2 prêts individuels bien remboursés. 
Elle sollicite ce 3ème prêt pour acheter 50 kg de kéni et 20 bouteilles d’eaux de Cologne.  Elle  s’approvisionne sur place à Ségou.
Madame Fatoumata Sidi envisage de réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 45 000FCFA. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de rembourser son prêt, de mener d’autres activités génératrices de revenus.
 Son ambition est   de pérenniser son activité.
texts.en:
Fatoumata Sidi is 42 years old, married and the mother of 5 children. She lives with her nuclear family in the Hamdallayein district of the town of Ségou.

She left school during secondary level (in the Malian education system) and started working with her mother at a young age, selling condiments and incense. Having worked for several years as her mother´s apprentice, Fatoumata Sidi struck out on her own, continuing in the same line of work. She has now been in this business for 7 years and is very experienced. The strength of her sales is due to the high quality of her product. She sells her merchandise for cash or credit to a clientele mostly composed of women.

Fatoumata Sidi is requesting a new loan so that she can better respond to customer demand and make more profits. She has been with Soro Yiriwaso for of 24 months and has already fully repaid 2 previous individual loans. She is requesting this third loan so that she can buy 50g of guéni (natural incense) and 20 bottles of Eau de Cologne. She gets her supplies locally, in Ségou.

Fatoumata Sidi anticipates earning a monthly profit of 45 000 francs. The profits will enable her to repay her loan and pursue other revenue-generating activities. Her goal is to make her business sustainable.

loans.use: to buy ingredients needed to make incense.

loans.name: Dieu Est Grand Group

texts.fr: Le groupe DIEU EST GRAND est composé de trois  personnes qui sont dans le même quartier. C'est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Solange est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Solange a arrêté l’école au niveau secondaire. Solange est âgée de 54 ans. Solange est mariée à un menuisier du nom de Rémi. Le couple à deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Solange vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Solange vend depuis vingt ans du maïs et de la farine de manioc. Parallèlement à l’activité principale, Solange vend aussi des mèches. Solange s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Solange ensemble avec les membres du groupe DIEU EST GRAND, sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter du maïs et de la farine de manioc.

loans.name: Yanaptasiñani Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “YANAPTASIÑANI” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Nancy es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de empanadas, venta de ropa, venta de sillones, venta de papas y plátano frito, venta de tapices para sillones, venta de cordones.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Nancy es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de carbón; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace doce años al observar las amplias ganancias que generaba este producto decide implementarlo como negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de carbón por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es soltera y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud  y las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.

En la imagen se identifica que una de las clientas no esta presente, la misma se marcho con urgencia a su negocio para la entrega de una mercadería pendiente.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Yanaptasiñani” will begin its second cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal of Los Andes. It is made up of eight members and is directed by an executive board of which Nancy is the president. The businesses that the members of the communal bank carry out are varied. Among them exist: empanada sales, clothing sales, armchair sales, potato and fried plantain sales, armchair upholstery sales, and cord sales.

The loan that they will take out will benefit small business entrepreneurs of which Nancy is a member. She indicates that she joined Pro Mujer a year ago, joining because of the invitation from a friend who is a client of the institution. Currently, she has a business selling charcoal. She makes it known that she launched this business twelve years ago when she observed the ample profits that this product generated, and so she decided to implement it as a business.

The loan that she will now take out is for the increase of capital (to purchase charcoal wholesale) that she will acquire from the wholesale sellers of the city of La Paz and subsequently she will sell it in her sale space. This form of work allows her to generate resources to support her family economically since she is single and has three children.

When she is consulted about what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the area of health and the training that the institution offers.

In the image, it is identified that one of the clients is not present because she departed with urgency to her business for the delivery of some pending merchandise.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal wholesale.

loans.name: Edgardo

texts.en: Edgardo is 47 years old and married. He lives in Molave, Zamboanga del Sur. For the past twenty years, Edgardo has been a farmer. He earns 20,000 PHP each month and is a new member of PMPC. Edgardo is requesting a 25,000 PHP loan to pay for land and seedbed preparations. In the future, he hopes to expand and improve his business.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparations

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Victor R. has 25 years of experience selling shoes, clothes, and he started working in Bahia, Ecuador. He worked for a boss who had the idea to work on foot and sell shoes in the local pueblos. After breaking off from this small business, Victor and his wife decided they would go into business together, and they followed a similar model from Victor’s previous job. They had success early on because they knew exactly whichi towns were the most lucrative, and they offered promotions to the best buyers, whom they knew personally. Each day they work from 5am until 10pm. They have recently been so focused on sales that they have not had the time to replenish their inventory with new stock, so they sell goods in the morning and then use the proceeds from those sales to buy just enough shoes to still sell in the afternoon. Victor’s wife is a great salesperson, and she typically goes to the small towns and local festivals which occur fairly often. They have two grown children who help sell their goods, and the family unit has maintained strong over the years. Their house is their greatest collateral. 

Victor needs this loan so that he can increase the volume of shoes and clothing  in stock to sell when the Riveras go to market.  He is a 48 year-old with four children, who of whom work for the family business. His wife is his right hand, and he could not do anything without her. She is responsible for the finances, taking care of the house, and looking after the children. They saved enough money to move out of Victor’s mother-in-law’s house, which was putting pressure on everyone. Their new home was made of cane and they slept on the floor. Now, after working hard, they enjoy a house that is made of concrete, and each child has a room of his own. The Riveras are proud to have gotten out of their previouos situation, which was dire poverty. Although they are still poor, they enjoy a standard of living that most do not have in Ecuador. Their wish is to continue growing the business and open a store located next to their house.

loans.use: Victor needs this loan so that he can increase the volume of shoes and clothing  in stock to sell when the Riveras go to market.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invertirá el crédito en la compra de materiles y en la remodelación de su negocio para crear una sala donde pueda mostrar sus productos terminados.

loans.name: Avaz

texts.en: Avaz G. lives in Beylagan. He is 44 years old. He engages in selling whole fruits at the Beylagan city bazaar. He has been a client of Normicro Beylagan Branch since 2004. The first time, he needed money for buying products to sell. Then he expanded his business and wanted to increase the kinds of goods he sold. Normicro was very helpful in this job. So he has borrowed loans from Normicro every year since 2004. In 2005 his loan was in the amount of $800. In 2006 he borrowed $1000. The last time he borrowed $1100. Avaz thinks that microcredit is the best way to improve business.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Juana Pax

texts.en:
Juana Pax T. G. is 34, but her family already has a thriving business sewing jeans for the local market. They buy denim, cut it, and sew it into various children's sizes, then sell wholesale in the weekly market in nearby San Francisco El Alto. The jeans have a professional, polished look, with a good cut and a nice label.

Juana is married and has four children, all of whom are in school. The oldest, 13, works half days in the shop and can turn out 4 pairs of jeans himself. The whole shop hums with activity, and can produce 15 pairs per day, which increases to 25 with the purchase of an additional electric sewing machine to replace the old treadle-style machine that one of the workers had to use. They can sell the jeans for about US$3.30 each; material for each costs about US$.90, so they make a tidy profit of over $2.00 on each pair.

Someday Juana would like to have her own store in San Francisco El Alto and sell at retail, with the higher markup that would provide.

Women's group: "De la Cruz" in Paxixil, San Francisco El Alto, Totonicapán

Written by Nancy Lewis and Randy Fay, Kiva Fellows

loans.use: Purchase electric sewing machine

loans.name: Ilgar

texts.en:
Ilgar is a Beylagan district inhabitant. He is married and has 3 children. He sells men's and women's shoes in the market. He works without family support, but he owns his place of business. He buys his inventory at Baku Airport wholesale market, making purchasing trips 2-3 times a month.

Ilgar is requesting a loan of US$ 700 to expand his inventory and thus increase his shoe sales.

loans.use: to increase volume of shoe sales

loans.name: Sesilia

texts.en: Sesilia  is 22 years old, married, with two children. She works very hard in her vegetable garden, since she is the only bread-winner for the family. Sesilia sells vegetables at a market three days per week and makes a net profit of 160 Tala (US$64) a day. She has applied for a loan of US$300 to buy chemicals and tools needed for the business. Sesilia plans to borrow more in the future to further expand her plantation business.

loans.use: Purchase of chemicals and tools for a vegetable garden

loans.name: Munavvar

texts.en: Munavvar Z. lives in B.Gafurov, Tajikistan.She is married and has 3 children. She has been a very active client of MicroInvest since 2004. She recommended herself as a serious and strongly motivated client. She engages in commercial services and trade. Munavvar  works in the Kistakuz bazaar where she trades in coffee, chewing gum, sweets and other small things. Now she requests a loan in to expand her assortment of products.

loans.use: To increase her product assortment

loans.name: Thong

texts.en: Mrs. Thong S., 28, is married with two young children and lives in the Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She works selling clothes at an open air-market and earns on average around $6 each day in revenue. Her husband works as a motorcycle-driver, generally carrying people to and from the market. He typically earns around $4.80 every day for this activity. Mrs. Thong S. intends to use this loan to purchase more fashionable clothes so that she can meet her existing clients demand, as well as expanding her customer base.

loans.use: To purchase more fashionable clothes to sell in order to meet her clients' needs.

loans.name: Donald José

texts.es:
From a young age, Mr. Donald B. has devoted himself to the business of breeding cattle and agriculture, which supports his modest family. They live in the municipality of Obraje, which is in the city of Chinandega in Nicaragua.

A problem that Donald encounters is the lack of electric energy in his area since it is very far from the city. For this reason, he uses candles in the evenings but they only light up a small part of his home. To fix this situation, Donald has borrowed loans from Ceprodel to buy a solar panel. In this way, he can light up his home and have access to television for his family.

His greatest need is to pay off the debt used to buy a solar panel so he can continue to sustain his home and improve the standard of living for him and his family.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Translator.

El caballero Donald B. desde muy niño se dedica al negocio de la ganaderia agricultura siendo este su negocio con el que mantiene a su humilde familia que habita en el municipio el Obraje de la ciudad de Chinandega en Nicaragua.

Una problemática que atraviesa Donald es que en su localidad no existe energía eléctrica por estar muy lejos de la ciudad y por tal razón debe de alumbrarse por las noches con candelas que solamente iluminan una pequeña parte del hogar. Para erradicar esta situación, el señor Donald ha adquirido préstamos en Ceprodel para la adquisición de un panel solar y de esta manera poder alumbrar su hogar y tener acceso a un televisor para la familia.

Su mayor necesidad hoy en día es la urgencia de cancelar la deuda de este panel solar para así poder continuar manteniendo su hogar y mejorando su nivel de vida y el de los suyos.

loans.use: buy a solar panel

loans.name: Loun

texts.en: Mrs. Loun S., 58, (her husband is pictured) is a housewife with two children, one who is married and living away from home and another who is a construction laborer earning $2 a day and living at home.  Her husband works as a carpenter and earns $2.50 a day.  In order to reduce costs, this couple is asking for a loan of $600 from Kiva to purchase a motorbike for commuting to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting to work.

loans.name: Ami

texts.en: Ms. Ami K. is a young woman of 22 years who is recently married and does not yet have children.  She owns a small boutique in the central market of Adéta, a small village located about 150 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo.  She buys and resells plastic containers such as trash cans, jugs and other such items which are widely used here for a variety of purposes.  With this loan, Ami would like to diversify and grow her new business to increase the quality of life for herself and her husband.

loans.use: To diversify and expand her business by buying more plastic containers

loans.name: Siti

texts.id:
This would be second loan for Siti A.. After repaying her first loan properly, Siti A. wishes to expand her business further. Siti A. sells food in her simple kiosk. Her family is quite healthy, but her husband has impaired vision, which makes him unable to work. Siti A. is highly motivated to meet her family's financial need. Each day, she goes shopping in Abianbase market and sells her food from the morning to the evening.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

Pinjaman kali ini merupakan pinjaman yang kedua bagi Ibu Siti A.. Setelah menyelesaikan pinjaman pertama dengan baik, Siti A. berkeinginan untuk menambah modal usaha lagi. Saat ini usaha yang ditekuni Ibu Siti A. adalah sebagai penjual makanan dengan membuka warung makan sendiri.Keadaan keluarganya cukup sehat, tapi saat ini suaminya mengalami rabun, yang mengakibatkan dia tidak bisa bekerja. Seorang diri berusaha tidak menjadikan Siti A. patah semangat. Setiap harinya, untuk keperluan warungnya, dia berbelanja di Pasar Abianbase dan mulai berjualan mulai dari pagi hingga sore hari.

loans.use: Increase business capial

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en:
Adjoa A. sells beer and other drinks and foodstuffs. She is a single mother of three children, and her income is insufficient to support her family's daily living expenses.

However, there is high demand for her goods, so she is now looking to capitalize on such demand by expanding her business in order to increase her profits. As such, she is requested additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: To capitalize on high demand for her goods by expanding her business.

loans.name: Matalena

texts.en: Matalena V., 36, is married with five children. She has three years of experience in the vegetable garden business. She sells her vegetables in the village five days per week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 550 Tala (~220 USD).  This is her first loan through SPBD; these loans are Matalena’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan through the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for her vegetable farming business.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en: Mrs. Lina P. is a villager in Preak Daung Village in Kandal Province. She is employed in a garment factory while her husband, Mr. Sokhuy Doeurn, is a motorbike taxi driver. This couple can generate a small income to support their family. Mr. Sokhuy Doeurn's business now faces a small problem because his motorbike is too old, and he also uses a lot of money on petroleum. Thus, he now wants to exchange the old motorbike, so his wife, Mrs. Lina P., decided to ask for a loan to buy a new one for her husband's business.  Mrs. Lina P. is 27 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is attending school while the youngest is too young to work or enroll school. Mrs. Lina P. and her husband are shown in the picture.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy a new motorbike for her husband business.

loans.name: Chim

texts.en: Chim S., 37, sells fish at the local food market with her husband, Chhorn Soa Yorn, in Kampong Chhnang. She and her husband make a net income of $5 per day to support their young child in school as well as Chim S.'s elderly mother. Chim S. has asked for a loan of $1200 to purchase a motorbike for her family's business. They need to transport the fish to the market each day and the current public transportation costs are very high because of rising gas prices. Any leftover money that the family has will be used in to invest in the fish business, to increase inventory and profits. In the future, Chim S. hopes to open a grocery store in the market. However, for now, she will focus on expanding her current business.

loans.use: Purchase a motorbike for business transportation needs

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena J. ić is a modern young girl who comes from Doboj. She is 21 and lives alone. She works in a popular cafe in the town. Working there, she meets many people her age and that gives her an opportunity to earn somewhat more. She sells cosmetics and ornaments.

Magdalena goes, from time to time, to a big marketplace to purchase her reserves of products. She doesn't earn much but enough to live on. Taking a loan through WWI in the amount of 600 KM will allow her to buy somewhat bigger reserves of the products that she sells.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics for re-sale

loans.name: Mary's Group

texts.en:
Mary B. has been renting out a Play Station video game console in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for three years. She allows people to pay to play the games from 9:00am to 3:00pm every day and earns a profit of approximately $340 each month. She has previously taken out one loan from BRAC Tanzania which she repaid successfully and on time. She is requesting her second loan so that she can buy an additional game for the Play Station game console.

Mary is 36 years old, married, and has one 12-year-old child. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Rukia, who also has her own small business in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy a new game for the Play Station game console that she rents to customers.

loans.name: Anonymous Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sroeun H., the group leader of five members living in Svay Chrum Thmey Village in Kampong Chhnang Province, is a fish seller in the local market. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it and so is requesting a loan to buy more fish for her customers. She hopes to increase income and improve her living conditions with this loan.

Her husband, Mr. Mao Moeun, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land upon which he cultivates rice. They have two children, both enrolled in the local school.

Mrs.Bunthoeun N. is represented by her husband in the picture.

loans.use: To buy more fish for her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Start selling clothing in her community.

loans.name: Sem's Group

texts.en: This group of borrowers consists of three people. Its leader, Mrs. Sem P., 50, makes a living selling fish in the local Takmao Market. She sells the  fish that her son catches in and around Tunle Sap Lake. She also purchase fish from local fisherman to sell. She currently earns an average of $4 a day. She is a widow and has seven children who are all single. Two of her sons are employed.  One son is a chef who caters wedding parties and another one is a fisherman. Because her business depends on her son fishing, she is requesting a loan to purchase more fishing equipment like nets and traps for her son to use for fishing. The other two borrowers include; Roeun N., 56, a Khmer cake seller and also needs a loan to build a bathroom, and Yem T., 48, who sells fish in the market and needs money to build a hedge around her house. The borrowers live in Deum Mean Commune, in Kandal Province.

loans.use: to purchase more fishing equipment

loans.name: Saiya

texts.en:
Saiya D. is currently in the business of selling beans and soya beans at the market and is requesting a loan to expand the business.  Saiya is 40 years old and is married with a husband who is a soldier. She has 3 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To expand her business.  The profit will be used to pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Jambo Nia Group

texts.en:
Wanu is 40 years old, married, and has five children, ages 15, 13, 9, 6 and 3. She sells bites (chapati) and porridge in the Milinne neighborhood of Zanzibar. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $25, working every day. She is requesting her second loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more flour and cooking oil for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.  

Wanu will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Chausiku and Kazija. Each woman has her own small business in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more flour and cooking oil for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Enlarge his farming business.

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia and David L. are blessed with five children: Wilson - 27 years old, a farmer; Wilma - 26 years old, a factory worker; Lilibeth - 24 years old, a housewife; Ronald - 20 years old, a rice-mill worker and Jomar - 16 years old, just graduated from high school and hoping to start his college education in June. They are living in Tadul Cabatuan, Isabela, a rural area. One of their sources of income is farming from which they harvest twice a year.

Leticia is a fruit and vegetable vendor in their village. With the help of her family, she was able to put up a backyard vegetable operation from which she personally sells. The business is already ten years old now and she wishes to make it grow. For this reason she is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000.00 that she can use as business capital.

loans.use: To provide business capital

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
ELSA S. C., pertenece al Banco Comunal “MUJERES PRODUCTIVAS” vive en el Jr Walter Mz.403 Lt.6, en la ciudad de Pucallpa, tiene 48 años de edad y 2 hijos.

Se inició en el negocio de venta de gaseosas y carbón (combustible), con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, compró víveres para vender, cuenta con clientes frecuentes.

Hoy en día, ella ha progresado junto a su familia y el negocio de la bodega ha mejorado.  Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará 3 paquetes de gaseosas, 1 caja de atún y hará algunos arreglos en el local (mantenimiento).

“Manuela Ramos es una ONG que apoya a una gran cantidad de mujeres, con pequeños préstamos que permite invertir en negocios que podamos vender y así aumentar los ingresos en la casa para apoyar a la familia”.
texts.en:
Elsa S. C. is a member of the Community Bank named "Mujeres Productivas", meaning Productive Women. She livesin Jr. Walter Z. 403 Lt.6, in the city of Pucallpa. She is 48 years old and has 2 children.

She started her business selling soft drinks and coal (fuel). With her first loan of S/.300 nuevos soles, she purchased groceries for resale to her steady clientele.

She and her family have grown and the grocery store business has improved. With this loan of S/1000 nuevos soles she will purchase 3 cartons of soft drinks, 1 box of canned tuna, and in addition she will also make some repairs to her store (maintenance).

"Manuela Ramos (Kiva Field Partner) is Non-Governmenal-Organization that provides support to many women through small loans to invest in our businesses, to sell and increase the household income to support the family."


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase soft drinks and canned tuna. To carry out maintenance to repairs to the store.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Primer préstamo:
http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=86582&_tpos=3&_tpg=1
Juana  es socia del Bancomunal los Viñedos,  estudio un curso de manualidades, y confecciona toallas bordadas con cinta, hace carteras de tela en su casa, se compro una maquina recta y  una  rremalladora.
Desde que está en Finca aprendió a invertir, y ahorrar el dinero  de las ganancias.
Juana necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles, para la compra de materiales para sus trabajos, telas, cintas entre otros.
El sueño de Juana es tener una tienda  para vender  todas las manualidades que hace.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of “Los Viñedos” community bank. She studied a handicrafts course and now embroiders towels with ribbons and makes cloth purses at her house. She purchased a straight stitch sewing machine and an overlock sewing machine (serger).

Since she has been with Finca she has learned to invest and save the money she earns. Juana needs a loan of 1200 soles (Peruvian Currency) to purchase materials for her work such as cloth and ribbons among other things.

Juana’s dream is to have a store to sell all of the handicrafts that she makes.

Juana's first loan: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=86582&_tpos=3&_tpg=1

Translated from Spanish by Mary McKee, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cloth, ribbons and other materials.

loans.name: Carmen Justina

texts.es:
Carmen es socia del Bancomunal Las Flores
Carmen es madre soltera, tiene 43 años, un hijo de 10 años que esta estudiando en la escuela estatal.
Carmen empezó su negocio de bodega  con  los prestamos de Finca le  ayudaron mucho, su negocio fue creciendo poco  apoco, ahora ha aumentado Bodega  bazar librería.  
Desde que esta en Finca, aprendió mucho de las clases de empresa que dan en el Bancomunal. 
Carmen necesita un préstamo de 2400 soles, para arreglo de su bodega y compras de víveres.
El sueño de Carmen es arreglar el piso de su bodega.
texts.en:
Carmen is a member of The Flowers cooperative bank. Carmen is a single mother, 43 years old, and has one 10-year-old son who is studying at the public school. Carmen started her store with Finca loans that have helped her a great deal. Her business grew little by little, and today she has expanded her store into a bazaar/bookstore. Since she has been with Finca she has learned a lot from the business classes given by the cooperative bank. Carmen needs a loan of 2,400 soles to improve her store and buy merchandise. Carmen’s dream is to repair the floor of her store.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Carmen needs a loan of 2,400 soles to improve her store and buy merchandise.

loans.name: Tsagaandolgor

texts.en:
Tsagaandolgor S., 58, lives with her husband Behbat in Uvurhangay, one of the Mongolian central provinces. All her children are living apart with their own families. In 1992 Tsagaandolgor started running a vegetable garden business, planting potatoes and carrots on 10,000 sq. meters. Since then she has expanded and is now gardening on 30,000 sq. meters of land. She also purchases a variety of fruits and vegetables transported by Behbat to retailers to resell at retail prices.

Their working capital is 2.5 million ($1 USD= 1450 MNT) and monthly income from the business is 3.1 million tugrugs, with net monthly profits of 350,000 tugrugs. S. is a very friendly and open person who is requesting this loan to buy fruits and vegetables to increase her business inventory.

loans.use: To buy vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita C. hails from the busy town of Morong, Rizal province, in the Philippines. She is 60 years old and a mother of three. All of her children are of legal age and have their own families. Her husband, Cipriano, is 60 years old and a traffic officer in their town.

As a woman of distinct faith and courage to overcome poverty, she really doesn’t stop searching for a greener pastures. In 2003, she decided to join ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and Kiva partner in the Philippines, with the hope that she would be able to access financial assistance for her business. She invested previous loans in the business of grilling pork, chicken, hot dogs and many other items. The business is in demand, especially during the afternoon when kids really long for grilled hot dogs, and for men who love eating grilled pork and chicken, especially while drinking beer. The business seems to be productive and profits sound. Now on her sixth loan, she seeks the amount of 25,000 pesos as additional capital for her primary business of grilling. Part of the loan will be used to pay for the sidecar of her tricycle as a secondary business.

She is optimistic that with the help of ASHI and Kiva, she can save money to build her own house and stop renting. Also, she is looking forward to having her own space for her grilling business.

loans.use: Additional capital for grilling business and to pay for a sidecar for a tricycle as a secondary business

loans.name: Soeung

texts.en: The woman in the picture is 49-year-old Soeung S.. She resides in Siem Reap Province where she earns a living planting various crops. Soeung S. was married, but her husband died of senility many years ago. She is now a single mother blessed with a son. Her son teaching English at a private school and provides his income for the family's needs. Soeung S. saw that her son finds it hard riding to work or anywhere else, because he doesn’t have his own vehicle. She is, therefore, applying for a $200 loan to purchase an old motorbike for her son to ride to work.

loans.use: To purchase used motorbike

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es:
La señora Felipa  es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Retamas”, en el distrito de Puno, provincia de Puno, en el departamento de Puno, ella tiene 59 años de edad, estado civil casada, tiene 8 hijos (dos independientes), ella estudió educación primaria incompleta (1er grado), vive en el Barrio Chanu Chanu.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 2 años, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que lo utilizo en su negocio de preparación de chicharrón.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 800.00 nuevos soles, y lo invertirá en su actual negocio de venta de chicharrón,  comprara carne de chicharrón, papas, chuño, ocas, camote, etc. también hace huatia de ocas y camote (comidas típicas) y lo vende en el mercado, siempre hay clientes. 

Su deseo es comprar materiales para construir su casa.

A ella le gustan los ahorros, las reuniones y las charlas de capacitación.

loans.use: Para la compra de carne de chicharrón, papas, chuño, ocas, camote, etc.

loans.name: Elizabeth Nilda

texts.es: La señora Elizabeth vive en la zona Escobar Uria junto a sus dos hijos. Ella es viuda, y D. esta forma lleva adelante a su familia como padre y madre D. igual manera. La actividad D. Elizabeth es la venta D. periódicos, ella tiene un puesto D. venta en la San Antonio Alto. Muy temprano en la mañana sale D. su casa a la comprar los periódicos, luego se dirige a su puesto donD. se queda hasta medio día o hasta que termine D. vender los periódicos (aunque algunas veces en que no hay mucha venta, existe la posibilidad D. devolver los que sobraron). Por las tardes ella atienD. un bazar - librería, que también esta en la zona D. San Antonio Alto, pero usualmente es su hija mayor quien colabora con atender esta última actividad. Elizabeth es una persona muy responsable con su familia y dedica su trabajo.
texts.en:
Elizabeth lives in the Escobar Uria region with her two children. She is a widow. She acts as both father and mother to get her family ahead. Elizabeth sells newspapers. She has a sales stall in San Antonio Alto. She leaves her house very early in the morning to buy the newspapers. She then goes to her stall where she stays until midday or until she sells all of the papers (although sometimes, when there are not many sales, the possibility exists to return the left over papers). In the afternoons she works in a bookstore bazaar, which is also in the San Antonio Alto region. However, her eldest daughter usually works with her in the bookstore. Elizabeth is a very responsible person with her family, and she is devoted to her work.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy newspapers

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en:
Adelina is a member of the Khesa borrower group in kihesa, Iringa. She is 26 year old woman, she is single and a mother of 1 child. Her child is 7 years old.

Adelina has owned a clothing business for 6 years, she works 4 hours a day and she earns a monthly profit approximately 200,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Adelina`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more clothes for sale.

With the additional profits she gains from the use of this loan, Adelina hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more used clothes for sale

loans.name: Mike's Group

texts.en: K. Mike is the leader of his lending group in Mityana. He is a hard-working, friendly, and determined man with a produce-selling business that he has been running for a very long time. Mike is well connected among the farmers that provide and supply him with produce, and he is happy that he makes some profits that help him run his family plus pay his children’s school fees. He has a dream of expanding his business by having a second store, so as to increase his income and hence his profits. Mike needs a loan to help restock his business with more produce so that he can make more profit from it.

loans.use: To buy more produce for resale

loans.name: Cristo Redentor 3 & 4 Group

texts.en:
Juana is a 68-year-old borrower who lives near San Pedro de Macorís, Dominican Republic. Juana is the coordinator for her group, Cristo Redentor (Christ the Redeemer), and her story is representative of the other borrowers in the group.

Juana and her husband live in Batey Victorina, a small community north of San Pedro. Bateyes are small communities built by sugar companies for their workers. Juana’s batey is particularly remote and difficult to reach: when visiting the community, our 4x4 truck was barely able to make it all the way there. The batey also lacks electricity, potable water, and any kind of healthcare service.

Despite these difficulties, Juana runs a successful pica pollo, or fried chicken stand. Fried chicken is one of the most popular foods here, and every town has at least one. Juana will use her loan to purchase supplies for her stand. This is Juana’s fifth loan with Esperanza, and she has a perfect repayment record. She has said that Esperanza has provided a new door to the future for her family, and that her dreams for her children have come true because of the support Esperanza has provided. Thank you for lending to Juana and the Cristo Redentor group!

loans.use: Chicken, oil, and flour

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional stock of cereals in bulk for her business.

loans.name: Diagne

texts.fr: Diagne S. est mariée, elle est âgée de 24 ans et a en charge 4 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de MBOUSNAKH dans lequel elle a eu de bonnes expériences avec le crédit. Elle fait le commerce de mil et de tissus teintés. Elle participe à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Diagne S. is married.  She is 24 years old and has four children to support.  She is a member of Banc Villageois de MBOUSNAKH where she has a good loan record.  Diagne does commerce in millet and dyed fabrics.  She takes part in improving her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To advance her revenue-generating work

loans.name: Evah

texts.en:
Evah K. is married to Kennedy Macharia and they are blessed with one daughter, Lilian. Evah is in the business of selling clothes in Mombasa's Mwembe Tayari market. She has been selling clothes for the last three years and she believes her business is doing well.

Evah joined KADET a while ago and she is now accessing her second loan. She managed to service her first loan of Kshs. 30,000 well. With this new loan, Evah intends to boost her business by purchasing more clothing to sell to customers. 

Evah hopes to expand her business further and become a major supplier of all kinds of clothing.

[This photo was taken in the Mombasa KADET office when Evah came to meet with a loan officer.]

loans.use: To buy more clothing to stock her business

loans.name: Mr. Sareth Meng Village Bank Group

texts.en: Twenty-two people who all live in Kampong Svay village in Kandal province make up the village bank loan group. They will all use the loan for different purposes. Mr. S. M. was selected by the members of the group to be the village bank president. He is a farmer who cultivates rice. Aside from his plantation, he is also a fisherman. He is requesting this loan to buy more fish nets for fishing. His wife, Mrs. Chheng Seap Ly, is a housewife. Mr. S. M. is 44 years old and the father of five children. Two of his children are laborers, two of T. are attending the local school, and the youngest child is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy more fish nets for fishing.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La sra. Margarita vive en casa propia, tiene una tienda - Ferreteria ubicado en su domicilio , donD. ella demuestra ser trabajadora y responsable. La Sra Margarita es divorsiada, tras la separacion ella salio adelante sola cuenta que fue dificil para ella la separacion y tambien para sus hijos y no le quedo otra que trabajar duro  para asi poder sacar adelante a sus hijos menores. La Sra.  Margarita es una persona muy responsable y honesta y esta muy agradecida con la institucion por el apoyo brindado al otorgarle el prestamo.						
						
						
						
						
						
						
						
						
						
						
						
						
						
Ii
texts.en:
Margarita lives in her own house, and there she operates her hardware store. She has shown herself to be very responsible and hard-working.

Margarita is divorced and after the separation she struck out on her own. It was difficult for her and her children and she had no choice but to work hard if she was going to advance her minor children. Margarita is a very responsible and honest person and is very thankful to her banking institution for its help in obtaining this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO INCREASE INVESTMENT IN HER HARDWARE STORE

loans.name: Epefania

texts.en: Epefania T. is from the village of Langatian. She is 50 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Epefania owns and operates a business running a food stall, selling variety of fruits in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over twenty-five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Epefania joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. Epefania is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her third from PMPC and her second from Kiva. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Shinoun

texts.en:
Mrs. Shinoun N. is a villager in the Kouk Romiet village in Kandal province. She is 30 years old. and she is a sewer. Her husband, Mr. Kamsen Rom, is a construction laborer. Besides this, he is a farmer who owns a small  piece of land for cultivating rice to support his family. 

The rice field has some problems because it is far from an irrigation system, but they do not have money to improve it. Thus, Mrs. Shinoun N. decided to ask for a loan for digging a well. With the rest of the loan she would like to buy fertilizers and fuel to support their field and increase the rice yield. 

This couple has three children, two of whom are attending the local public school, while the other is too young to work or study. Her husband is on the left in the photo.

loans.use: For digging a well

loans.name: Ma. Luisa

texts.es: La señora María Luisa N. vive con su pareja el señor Gerardo Domínguez el es pensionado de los Estados Unidos y ella labora para una casa como encargada de una persona enferma, viven solos ya que todos sus hijos están casados, están tramitando este crédito para la impermeabilización del techo de su casa; ya que con la temporada de lluvias se deterioro.
texts.en:
María Luisa N. lives with her partner, Gerardo Domínguez. He is retired from a job in the United States and she works in a private home caring for an ill person. They live alone since all their children are married. They are negotiating this loan in order to waterproof their roof because the rainy season deteriorated it.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To waterproof her roof.

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es:
Claudia, de 39 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de sus dos menores hijos, aun estudiando en el colegio.

Desde hace un año  trabaja vendiendo golosinas, snacks, panes y gaseosas  en un kiosco dentro de un colegio de la zona donde vive. Ella atiende sola su negocio, desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde. Le gusta mucho su trabajo porque dice que se necesita paciencia para realizarlo, además le genera buenas ganancias económicas que le permiten sacar adelante a sus hijos. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora que siempre busca maneras de generar dinero honradamente, es por esta razón que paralelamente se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza de una reconocida marca y los ofrece a sus conocidas a través de sus catálogos, luego les trae el pedido y gana una comisión, que dice no es mucho, pero ayuda en los constantes gastos que debe afrontar. Para el futuro tiene planeado ampliar su negocio de venta de comestibles y ofrecer mayor  variedad de productos.

Este es el tercer préstamo que tiene con MFP y está muy agradecida con todas aquellas personas que hacen posible que pueda acceder al crédito que le permitirá continuar trabajando. Claudia tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de mayor cantidad de mercadería para surtir su negocio, además comprará algunos productos de belleza en promoción para venderlos a un poco más de su precio original.
texts.en:
Claudia is 39 years old and lives in her own home with her two young children who attend school. For the past year she’s been selling treats, snacks, breads and soft drinks from a kiosk located in one of the schools in the zone where she lives. She runs her business alone from 8:00 am to 5:00 pm and tells us that likes her work very much because it requires patience. It also brings her a good income which allows her to help her children get ahead. She is a hard working woman who constantly looks for ways to make money honestly. For this reason she also sells a well-known brand of beauty products to her friends through a catalog. She earns commissions from these sales. She tells us that it isn’t much, but it helps pay the bills. In the future she plans to expand her snack business and offer a greater variety of items. This will be her third loan through MFP and she is very grateful to all the people who have made this loan possible, which has allowed her to continue running her business. Claudia will use the money from this loan to large quantities of items to stock her business. She will also buy a few beauty products on sale in order to be able to resell them for slightly more than her cost.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Celia

texts.en:
Celia is part of the Los Diamantes communal bank. This bank, whose name means “The Diamonds” in English, consists of 32 members all hailing from the Cuzco area. Celia is 56 years old, married, and has two adult children (ages 30 and 36) who now have families of their own.

Celia runs a small restaurant out of her house where she sells “menús del día”, or daily set-priced lunches that usually consist of a soup, drink, and main dish. Celia says that she has a good base of clients that regularly come to eat at her restaurant. In addition to her restaurant business, Celia holds a job working in a clinical lab. 

Celia will use the Kiva loan to buy restaurant supplies for her business. She will also use part of the money to meet the monthly rent payments on her house, which she does not own herself. 

Celia is appreciative of and thankful for the loan and promises to pay the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: To purchase restaurant supplies

loans.name: Rouhiya

texts.en: Rouhiya, who has 18 years of experience as a beautician, is a single woman living with her mother and sister. In order to help with her family’s expenses, Rouhiya has opened a beauty salon in her town. With the $1,000 loan she has requested, she plans to expand her business by adding new services and purchasing more equipment. Rouhiya says that her business productivity and income will both increase as a result of this loan because it will satisfy the needs of her business development in addition to attracting more and new clients.

loans.use: To add new services and purchase more equipment

loans.name: Placida

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenece al banco comunal “SACRO”; Nuestra socia es natural de la comunidad de cruz pata en el poblado de chinchero perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba departamento del Cusco.

Nuestra socia es el Sra. PLACIDA,  Nuestra socia tiene 41 años  casada y tiene 2 hijos, de 11 y 9 años de edad, nuestra socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con la agricultura, la socia se dedica a cocinar cuando los varones siembran las tierras, y también deshierban los cultivos cuando la mala hierba va creciendo junto a lo sembrado, Nuestra socia trabaja vendiendo todo lo que su tierra produce, vende papa, maíz, habas y lo que ese año hayan producido. Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para comprar semillas para plantar en sus terrenos.

La socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Sra. Placida is a member of the “Sacro” (Sacred) Communal Bank. She is originally from the community of Cruz Pata in the town of Chinchero, which is part of Urubamba Province, Department of Cusco.

Sra. Placida is 41 years old, married, and has two children (ages 11 and 9). She divides her time between her household activities and farming. Placida prepares food while the men are working in the fields. She also works the land by removing weeds that can impact her crops. Placida sells everything that is produced on her land such as potatoes, corn, and beans that are grown that year. She is requesting a loan to buy seeds to plant.

Placida appreciates and values the support that has been provided. Therefore, she promises to complete her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seeds

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr:
Madame Fatou N. est née en 1952 et elle est à sa deuxième demande de crédit. Elle fait le commerce depuis 3 ans. Elle vend des produits de lessive et pain de singe. Madame N. fait le commerce ambulant. 
Pour ce prêt, elle veut ajouter dans son business la vente de pâte d'arachide et de l'huile de palme comme ça elle pourra diversifiée ses marchandises et gagner plus de bénéfices.
texts.en:
Ms. Fatou N. was born in 1952, and she is on her second loan request. She has been in commerce for three years and sells laundry products and monkey bread (the fruit of the baobab tree). She is an itinerant vendor. For this loan, she wants to include with her business the sale of peanut butter and palm oil. In this way, she will be able to diversify her goods and to earn more profit.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies of merchandise

loans.name: Phidelis

texts.en:
Phidelis is a 30 year-old welder. He primarily does welding of doors and windows. He has been in this business for 2 years. Phidelis is married and has 2 children, 1 boy and 1 girl, aged between 3 and 6 years old. The primary challenges that he faces are competition from other welders and electricity outages. In addition to welding, Phidelis also does farming at home and keeps cattle and sheep. Before welding, he worked at a shop.

Phidelis plans to use the 80,000 KES loan to to purchase welding materials. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 40,000 KES.

In the future, Phidelis hopes to supply welding materials as a wholesaler from his home. In 5 years, he dreams of generating an income of at least 150,000 KES.

Phidelis describes himself as outgoing, friendly, and focused.

loans.use: To purchase welding materials.

loans.name: Tawoprr Group

texts.en: Babah K. (pictured on the left) is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Babah was born in Magburaka town, about 49 years ago. He is married to a businesswoman and he has eight children, all of whom are attending secondary schools. For many years now, Babah has been selling rice, onions, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), tomatoes, toothpaste, toothbrushes, etc. This is the first loan that Babah and his group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. Babah will use his share of the loan (SL 1,500,000) to expand his business. He will buy the above-mentioned items at wholesale to add to his current stock.

loans.use: To buy rice, onions, margi, tomatoes, toothpaste, toothbrushes, etc. at wholesale

loans.name: Purevdorj

texts.en:
Purevdorj is 34 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Hovd province, western Mongolia. His elder son attends a local middle school, and his younger son goes to a kindergarten, while his wife works as a cook in their town. 

Purevdorj owns a successful taxi service. In 2004, he began his business and his daily revenues reach 10,000 to 15,000 MNT. Purevdorj is requesting a 1,200,000 MNT loan to purchase construction and building materials in order to complete his house.

loans.use: To purchase construction and building materials in order to complete his house

loans.name: Vanna

texts.en:
Mr. Vanna K. and his wife, Mrs. Meas Uk, have been married for 20 years and have two children: one son and one daughter. The daughter is a garment factory worker and the son attends school. The family lives in suburb of Phnom Penh, about 25 kilometers away. Vanna was not available for the photo, so his wife is pictured instead.

Vanna is a driver. He drives for the ministry of health. His wife stays at home and does housework. He is applying for his first loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorcycle for his daughter to drive to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for his daughter to drive to work.

loans.name: Nghiêm

texts.en:
Huệ Nghiêm Thị is a 29 year-old woman living in the town of huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh.  She is married and has 2 school-aged children.  To make a living, Huệ owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food.  The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of food products in the local community.  Huệ has been engaged in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month.

In 2009, Huệ joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,152,000 VND from SEDA, which was used to purchase additional products to sell.  She is now requesting a new loan of 8,288,000 VND, which will be used to invest in expanding the business.  This will be Huệ’s 2nd loan from SEDA.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it.

About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Nazia's Group

texts.en:
Nazia is a housewife. She has been living in a historic city of Pakistan called Lahore for the past four years in a two-room brick house. She is thirty years old and married to M. A. who works in a newspaper company named “Dawn” as a newspaper seller. She has two children: a three-year-old son named M. Farooq and a two-year-old daughter named Wajeeha. 

Nazia is very supportive by nature. She owns and operates a clothes-selling business to share the financial burden with her husband. She buys clothes from the famous markets of Lahore called “Ichra & Anarkali” and sells the goods to different shops at her nearby market and to her community as well. She earns approximately 8-10 thousand PKRs every month. 
 
She has applied for a loan from Asasah for her clothes business. With the loan amount she will buy clothes of different varieties and designed in large quantity and give expansion to her business. She is a new loan user of Asasah. She is hopeful that it will be a profitable experience for her.

loans.use: Purchase clothes for resale

loans.name: Elma

texts.en: Elma V. is from the village of Guibang, Gamu, Isabela. She is 50 years old. Elma is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Elma makes and sells food. The main source of income for the business comes from making and selling rice cakes for sale in front of the church. Elma has been engaged in her business for over 30 years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2008, Elma joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Elma is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Elma from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Houn's Group

texts.en:
Houn K. is a married woman who lives in Preak Ta Kaov village, Kandal province.  She is the village loan bank president, selected by its nineteen members.  Each member will use their portion of the loan to support their own needs.
     
Houn and her husband, a pig breeding and battery charger, do not have enough money to support themselves.  Houn decided to ask for a loan to buy a battery charging machine to support his business.  They have three school age children who help their parents run both businesses.

loans.use: Buy battery charging machine.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a 28-year-old man.  He runs a cafeteria and also does outside catering to earn a living.  He joined Faulu Kenya under Pastures Self Help group and he has developed a good savings plan.  Daniel has been running his business for five years in a very competitive environment.  He hopes to own a chain of cafeterias in the future.  

Daniel has requested 20,000 KES to buy cooking fat, rice and wheat flour.

loans.use: To buy cooking fat, rice and wheat flour

loans.name: Ángela De Los Santos

texts.es:
La Sra. Ángela de los Santos A. M. es originaria del municipio Telica comarca el Ji carito, actualmente se desempeña como maestra de educación primaria en Santa Rosa del Peñón donde tiene 4 años de laborar. Es el primer crédito que solicita en Ceprodel para mejorar su vivienda. El crédito lo solicitó para la compra de, Compra de lote. Con el objetivo de Construir su vivienda.
Esta señora tiene 1 hijos a su cargo.
Esto le permitirá llegar a construir su propia casa de habitación donde mejorara el bien estar de su familia.
texts.en: Ángela de los Santos A. M. is originally from the Hamlet of Ji Carito, in the town of Teloca.  She currently works as an elementary school teacher at the Santa Rosa del Peñón school, where she has worked for four years.  This will be her first loan through CEPRODEL and she will use the money to buy a lot on which she can build her home.  This will allow her to have her own home and improver her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: Land

loans.name: Lecilda

texts.en:
Lecilda A. is from the village of Santiago, Gingoog City. She is 35 years old. Lecilda is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Lecilda owns & operates a food stall. She makes and sells snacks like rice cakes, biko or sweetened rice, and boiled eggs in the local community. She also serves coffee and chocolate drinks to customers. Lecilda has been engaged in her business for over 11 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Lecilda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Lecilda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand product offering. Lecilda is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital for the business. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Lecilda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital for the business.

loans.name: Mex

texts.en: Mex M., 55, is a widow living in Takeo province with her daughter. To earn a living, she has been selling cakes in the local market and is able to make about US$ 3 in profit each day. Her daughter is a hairdresser, typically making US$ 4 per day. Mex M. is asking for a loan of US$ 1000 to purchase hair dressing tools for her daughter to expand the business.

loans.use: To purchase hairdressing equipment for her daughter

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es:
Doña Juana de 54 años de edad, reside en Corinto departamento de Morazán, es comerciante de mercería y cosméticos, ella vive sola ya que sus hijos ya formaron sus respectivas familias, desde hace 20 años se dedica al comercio de adornos, cosméticos y ropa, ella proviene de una familia laboriosa ya que tanto sus padres como sus hermanos son comerciantes, trabaja todo el día toda la semana.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para invertirlo en el negocio específicamente en mercería, con el apoyo de este préstamo diversificara su mercadería y así ofrecer mejores productos a los clientes. Su principal propósito es seguir trabajando en el comercio, poder ofrecer mejores productos de calidad para los clientes y así tener mejore sus utilidades para mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Juana, 54, lives in Corinto, Morazán department.  She is a general merchandise and cosmetics merchant.  She lives alone because her children have formed their own families.  For 20 years she has sold decorations, cosmetics and clothes.  She comes from a very hard working family because both her parents and siblings are merchants.  She works all day every day of the week.

She is asking for funds to invest in the business, specifically in merchandise.  Support from the loan will allow her to diversify her merchandise thus offering better products to her customers.  Her main goal is to stay in business and to be able to offer better quality products to her customers so that profits will be better thus improving her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es:
Francisco, tiene 21 años de edad, posee una peluquería, reside en Lolotiquillo departamento de Morazán, donde vive con su esposa y su hijo, él realiza cortes de cabello en un local que tiene alquilado en Lolotiquillo,  aprendió  la peluquería por necesidad de contar con una fuente de ingreso para su hogar.
Él está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de una máquina para cortar el cabello, con esta compra estar mejorando su trabajo y brindar un mejor servicio para con los clientes.
Su objetivo es que la peluquería sea reconocida y mejorar sus instalaciones, así mismo tener estabilidad a largo plazo para que sus ingresos sean mejores y  pueda dar una vida más confortable a su familia.
texts.en:
Francisco is 21 years old and has a barber shop. He lives in the Lolotiquillo department of Morazán with his wife and their son. He cuts hair in a rented space in Lolotiquillo. He learned how to be a barber because he needed a source of income to support his household. 

He is requesting a loan to buy an electric trimmer. This purchase will help him improve his work and offer better service to his clients. 

His goals are for his barber shop to be well-known, to improve his facilities, and to achieve long-term stability in order to boost his income and offer a more comfortable life to his family.

loans.use: Buy an electric trimmer

loans.name: Janneth Del Rocio

texts.es:
Janneth de 47 años, ha trabajado vendiendo ropa para poder ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos familiares. Viviendo en una casa de ladrillos y cemento con su esposo ubicado en la Primavera de Duran (zona periurbana, con una ecología en disolución a las afuera de Guayaquil). Vende ropa a sus vecinos y conocidos hace tiempo para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos familiares.  Para tener más ingresos también los fines de semana trabaja en una camaronera.     

Uno de sus objetivos es tener su casa bien construida por eso quiere el préstamo para comprar cemento, arena. En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Janneth is 47 years old and has worked selling clothing to be able to help her husband with the household expenses. She lives in a brick and cement house with her husband in the Primavera de Duran area (a suburban area, with a deteriorating environment on the outskirts of Guayaquil). She has sold clothing to her neighbors and acquaintances for a while in order to help her husband with the family expenses. In order to have greater income, on the weekends she also works in shrimp plant.

One of her goals is to have a well-built house so she would like a loan to buy cement and sand. In the future she wants to finish building her home.

loans.use: Cement and sand

loans.name: Cefferino Gustavo

texts.es:
Cefferino Gustavo C. S. tiene 41 años de edad. Vive en Unión Libre, vive con la compañera y con los hijos en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. Tiene 2 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. 26 DE NOVIEMBRE  se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Las blancas Perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas Esta Ventanilla se dedica a labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Cefferino Gustavo se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz desde hace 5 años. Compra sus productos en Agripac, y  vende en la feria en Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz, arroz. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar carro.

Le gusta escuchar música.
texts.en:
Cefferino Gustavo C. S. is 41. He is in a common-law marriage and lives with his partner and children in the Ventanas Canton, Los Rios Province. He has two children.

The members of the V.R.C. 26 de Noviembre ["November 26th"] are located in the Las Blancas neighbourhood belonging to the Ventanas Canton. The members of this bank have long worked in short-cycle agricultural labour, sowing corn and rice.

Cefferino Gustavo has worked in agriculture, sowing corn and rice, for five years. He buys his products in Agripac and sells them in the market in Ventanas.

He is requesting this loan to purchase agricultural tools and fertilizers for cultivating corn and rice. In supporting this loan, you will help him economically to supply his needs. He confronts challenges such as plagues, diseases and the varied climate. His dream is to buy a car.

He enjoys listening to music.

loans.use: the purchase of agricultural inputs and fertilizers

loans.name: Medelyn

texts.en:
Medelyn B. is from the village of Sapa Luboc, Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 31 years old and she is married. To make a living, Medelyn owns and operates a business venture, selling bread in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately $137 a month for these activities.

In 2007, Medelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. 

She is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 5th loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Sapa Luboc, Tambulig Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Guadalupe S J Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama Guadalupe SJ. Está ubicado en el Estado de Puebla, en México.  El grupo está conformado por 10 integrantes. Mireya G. R., es la presidente del grupo, tiene 26 años, estudió una carrera técnica y no tiene hijos. La señora Mireya se dedica a la venta de zapato por catálogo, inició hace 1 años. Sus clientes son de la comunidad. Al momento de solicitar este préstamo se siente entusiasmado y con muchas ganas de sobresalir. Solicita este crédito para la compra de zapatos ya que tiene pedidos pendientes por entregar. También espera que con este préstamo obtenga mejores ganancias y mayor clientela, para poder tener una mejor calidad de vida y apoyar a su familia con los gastos.
texts.en:
This group is called “Guadalupe SJ” and located in the State of Puebla in Mexico. The group consists of ten members. Mireya G.R. is the president of the group. She is 26 years old, earned a technical degree, and has no children. Sra. Mireya sells shoes through a catalog and started her business a year ago. Her customers are from the community.

Upon submitting her loan request, Mireya was enthusiastic and eager to excel. She needs this loan to buy shoes since she has outstanding orders that are pending delivery. Mireya also hopes that this loan will improve her earnings and attract more customers so that she can have a better quality of life and support her family with the expenses.

loans.use: Purchase shoes to sell

loans.name: Ma. Magadalena

texts.en:
Ma. Magadalena is a married woman who lives in the municipality of Dalaguete, Cebu. She earns her living by operating two business ventures:  videoke and a general store. Her husband Pedro, who is 40 years old, works as a laborer to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities.  They have 11 children who are between 1 and 21 years old. Ma. Magadalena joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past nine loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Ma. Magadalena has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 14,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 5,600 uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 10th loan, she is borrowing PHP 15,000 to use as additional capital for business and buy stocks for the store so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children. Ma. Magadalena is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines

loans.use: Additional working capital for her business

loans.name: Rosanna

texts.en: Rosanna Z. is from the village of Plaridel, Claveria, Misamis Oriental. She is 34 years old and is married with three school-aged children. To make a living Rosanna owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The shop's main source of income comes primarily from selling daily-use products, such as canned goods, convenience foods, biscuits and beverages, in the local community. Rosanna has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2008 Rosanna joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Rosanna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and increase working capital. Rosanna is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional canned goods and convenience foods to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Rosanna from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from this investment to improve and expand the business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods and junk foods to sell

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 55 years old and married with four children.

Erlinda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to pay for the purchase of additional products to sell.

Erlinda has borrowed and paid back two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for seven years and also earns an income from frozen foods.

Erlinda's aspirations are house renovation and the expansion of her business.

loans.use: To pay for the purchase of additional products to sell

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James A. is 33 years old and married with two children. For the past five years he has operated a grocery store where he has employed three people. James also owns his own business premises. He has used his previous loans from Faulu Kenya to boost his business.

James has requested 40,000 KES to buy tomatoes, potatoes, vegetables and cereals. He hopes to add a butchery in the future.

loans.use: To buy tomatoes, potatoes, vegetables and cereals

loans.name: Helder Fredman

texts.es: Helder Fredman tiene 34 años. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la compra y venta de cerdo hace mas de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio, el inicia este negocio  por la necesidad de trabajar ya que  no tenía un trabajo estable y decide establecer el negocio en su vivienda y empieza con la compra de un cerdo y al tener afluencia de clientes decide invertir más en su negocio, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo destinado para la compra de  mas  cerdos. En futuro le gustaría realizar ciertas remodelaciones a su vivienda.
texts.en: Helder Fredman is 34 years old. His business has been the buying and selling of pigs for the past 5 years. He started the business for the need to work. He didn't have stable employment and so he decided to set up a business at his house. He started with the purchase of one pig and when he had an affluence of clients he decided to invest more in his business. The loan will be used as capital funds to purchase more livestock.
