In the future he would like to carry out some home improvements.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana is married with two grown daughters. She is a small market entrepreneur from Zaporozhye in thesouth-eastern part of Ukraine. She runs a clothing sales business at a local marketplace. Tatyana sells silk and chiffon scarves and wraps. She has been in this business for 13 years. Currently, Tatyana has 36,000 Grivnyas invested in inventory. Her net profit amounts to 7,000 – 8,000 Grivnyas a month. 

Tatyana is seeking a loan of 12,600 Grivnyas to purchase delicate light scarves and swimsuits for the upcoming summer season. She is hoping to diversify her merchandise by adding swimsuits to her inventory. Tatyana’s merchandise is unique at the marketplace and low competition only adds to the success of her growing business.

loans.use: to purchase summer scarves and swimsuits

loans.name: Sainsanaa

texts.en: Sainsanaa is 38 years old and lives with his wife and daughter in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in someone else's backyard. They live in Uvs province, Mongolia. His daughter, who is three years old, goes to a kindergarten. Sainsanaa manages a transportation service business in his town. He started his business in 2004 with a rented truck. He is planning to have his own truck in the future. He says, "I want to have my own truck and a house for my family." He is requesting a 400,000 MNT loan to purchase vegetable seeds to start a vegetable planting business in addition to his transportation business.

loans.use: to purchase vegetable seeds.

loans.name: Leonarda Yamilet

texts.es: Leonarda Yamilet tiene 44 años, su actividad es la venta de mercadería en general. Tiene más de 12 años en su negocio, tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación por lo que se siente muy feliz con los créditos que han sido de gran ayuda para su negocio. Inicio este negocio para generar ingresos a su familia ya que tiene 4 hijos menores de edad a su cargo, ella sale todos los días  a ofrecer sus productos. El financiamiento es para la compra de calzado, cosméticos, ropa en general, cremas, tratamientos, toallas y sabanas.
texts.en:
Leonarda Yamilet, 44, has sold general merchandise for 12 years. She has worked with the Foundation for awhile and is very happy with the loans because they've been a lot of help to her business. She started this business to generate income for her family since she has 4 young children in her care. She goes out every day to sell her products. 

The loan is for the purchase of shoes, cosmetics, clothing, creams, treatments, towels and sheets.

loans.use: to buy shoes, cosmetics, clothing, creams, treatments, towels and sheets.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
La señora Josefina, de 56 años de edad, está casada con el señor Agustín de 69 años de edad, jubilado, la pareja tiene dos hijos adolescentes, el mayor de 28 años  ya cuenta con empleo y la joven de 24 años de edad es estudiante de facultad.
La señora Josefina comenta que desde muy joven se dedica a las confecciones de todo tipo de prendas de vestir como trajecitos, buzos, blusas, vestidos y  además está incursionando la confección de sabanas y cortinas.
Ella se define como una mujer muy creativa a la hora de la confección de sus prendas, piensa que ademas de su creatividad solo necesita un poco de capital para poder seguir con todos sus proyectos.
Ella solicita el credito para poder abastecerse de telas y kits de costura, es decir de todo aquello que ella cree indispensable para el ejercicio de su profesión. Piensa que el crédito le seria realmente de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Josefina is 56 years old and married to 69 year-old Agustín who is retired.  The couple have two children.  Their eldest [son] is 28 years old and already has a job.  Their youngest [daughter] is 24 years old and a university student.

Josefina tells us that she has been making all kinds of clothes such as baby outfits, sports clothes, blouses and dresses since she was very young.  She is also starting to make sheets and curtains.  She describes herself as a very creative woman when it comes to making her clothes.  She believes that, in addition to her creativity, she only needs a little capital in order to be able to continue with all her projects.

Josefina is requesting this loan so that she can stock up with fabric and sewing kits; that is to say everything that she believes to be essential for carrying out her profession.  She believes that the loan will be of great help to her.

loans.use: to buy fabric and sewing kits

loans.name: Eulogio

texts.es: El  señor Eulogio es casado, tiene hijos los cuales ya son mayores y ninguno de ellos esta a  su cargo puesto que son mayores, eulogio se dedica a la reparación y mantenimiento de bicicletas, tambien a soldar cocinas, viene realizando esta actividad casi 6 años,anteriormente eulogio trabajaba como afilador de cuchillo en la calle con un esmeril de mano, los desafíos que enfrenta eulogio es la falta de seguridad en su negocio, ya que el local que  tiene carece de la misma, el préstamo que esta solicitando es para arreglar el portón de negocio y parte del dinero que le sobre comprara repuestos para su taller de bicicletas y reparacion de cosinas,eulogio tiene muchos sueños uno de ellos es hacer crecer mas su negocio para brindar un mejor servicio a sus cliente y así tener una mejor calidad de vida, eulogio esta muy agradecido con la ayuda que se le esta brindado.
texts.en:
Eulogio is married.  He has grown-up children and none of them are dependent upon him any more.  Eulogio repairs and services bicycles.  He also services and repairs stoves.  He has been in this business for almost six years.  Eulogio used to work as a knife sharpener, working in the street with a whetstone.  The challenges that he faces are a lack of security at his business premises.  The loan that he is requesting will be used to fix the front door of his business premises.  He will also use part of the money that is left over to buy spare parts for his bicycle workshop and his business servicing and fixing stoves.

Eulogio has many dreams.  One of them is to grow his business some more so that he can provide a better service to his customers and thereby enjoy a better quality of life.  He is very grateful for the support that he has been given.

loans.use: to fix the main door of his premises and to buy some tools for his business maintaining bicycles and stoves

loans.name: 62 Thieu Do Group

texts.en:
Mrs Xuyen works in agriculture, farming food. She is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizer for vegetables and trees.

Xuyen is 31 years old and is married with 2 children. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a semi-urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with 2 dependents. Xuyen is the group leader of the 62 Thieu Do solidarity group, which consists of 6 members. 

This is Xuyen's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.
Xuyen has been involved in this business for 7 years.
The main hardship that Xuyen L. faces in her business is lack of capital.

With her business profit, Xuyen L. hopes to remodel her house, to be abL. to buy more supplies and equipment for her business and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for vegetable and trees.

loans.name: Ma.lina

texts.en:
Ma.Lina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 13,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell in her food stall. Ma.Lina has been in this business for 10 years. She earns more income from farming vegetables.

Ma.Lina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Aishabubu's Group

texts.en:
Aishabubu, 52, is treasurer of this group. She is divorced and lives in a town of Tokmok. She has two grown sons who live on their own. This entrepreneur has been selling fruits and vegetables in a local food market for the past two years. Her initial capital was 5,000 soms. Aishabubu is happy that her investment paid off, because she now earns 6,000 soms a month. This requested loan will be invested in the purchase of a new house, which Aishabubu desperately needs. Aishabubu hopes to always have fresh wholesale fruits and to be in demand. She thanks all Kiva lenders for the financial assistance. 

         --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Nazia Bibi

texts.en:
Nazia bibi is 26 years old, married with three children: two sons and a daughter. Her son is five years old and is in kindergarten. The others are too young to attend school. Her husband is involved in agriculture. He grows different seasonal crops and earns good from his business. 

Nazia herself is a supportive lady and helps her husband by operating a milk selling business. She gets milk from her buffaloes and sells to her local area clients to earn income. She has been doing this business for the past six years and has a good clientele base due to her good quality milk. 

Nazia has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her milk selling business. With the loan she will buy another buffalo that will increase the milk productivity and sales as well. She is hopeful that the loan investment will bring positive financial changes to her business in result.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for milk selling business.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine Mbithe is 36 years old and married to Kimani Warma. Together they have three children who are 12, 5 and 3 years old. Her primary business is a food kiosk located In Tala. She has been in the business for the past 10 years. This gives her a monthly income of 5,000 KES.

This is her first loan from KADET. She intends to use the loan to buy maize, beans, flour, sugar, salt and firewood, helping her to increase her stock. 

Her anticipated profits will help her improve the living standards of her family. She hopes to have more income-generating businesses and a well-supported family through her hard work.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials such as maize, beans, flour, and firewood

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past three years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbours and passers-by. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transporting goods in her business. Fatuma dreams of establishing a restaurant business in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and washing detergents to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and washing detergents to sell.

loans.name: Leizel

texts.en:
Leizel is 26 years old and married with one child. For the past four years, she has earned a living by raising livestock in the Philippines and she also earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal.

Leizel is requesting a 16,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional livestock to raise. She is working tirelessly toward attaining her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy livestock to raise

loans.name: Domingo

texts.en:
Domingo aims to increase his yields so that he can earn a higher income. However, due to financial difficulty, he is asking for a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy fertilizer, insecticides and to pay labor costs for planting corn.

Domingo is responsible for managing his corn farming business. He is 57 years old, married and blessed with 10 children. Due to the high cost of commodities, he needs to earn more income to satisfy their daily needs and to lift his family from poor living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, insecticides and to pay labor costs for planting corn

loans.name: Dora

texts.es: Dora tiene 28 años, es madre soltera y tiene un hijo de tan solo 2 añitos. Juntos habitan en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad de quisto valle, Pichari. Dora es una joven mujer, que por cosas del destino se separó de su esposo, quedándose ella de la custodia de su hijo. En un inicio le fue muy difícil, pero poco a poco fue de ese trance dedicándose junto a su queridos padres a las labores agrícolas, cultivando cacao, café y frutas cítricas, productos están teniendo buenos precios en la actualidad. Dora en el poco tiempo que lleva dedicándose a esta labor ha sabido valorar su esfuerzo, ella sabe que esta actividad es pesado y se necesita de fuerza y dedicación constante. Ella está contenta con esta labor que realiza, porque gracias a ello puede percibir ganancias. En un futuro piensa abrir una tienda de abarrotes, de esta manera obtener mejores ingresos de la que ahora tiene. Este será su primer credito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 2,500 soles podrá contratar peones para que la ayuden a limpiar y sacar la malezas de sus plantaciones de café.
texts.en:
Dora is 28 years old and is a single mother of a 2-year-old little boy; they live together in her own house located in the community of Quisto Valle, Pichari.  Dora is a young woman who due to destiny’s capriciousness separated from her husband remaining in sole custody of her son.  At the beginning this was very difficult but she gradually came out of that difficult situation and started farming with her parents growing cocoa beans, coffee and citrus fruit, products that currently are selling for good prices.

In the short period of time that Dora’s been doing this work she’s learned to value her efforts.  She knows that the work is hard and one needs constant strength and dedication.  She’s happy with the work she does because thanks to it she earns profits.  In the future she’d like to open a grocery store to earn better income than presently.

This will be her first MFP loan and she commits to make her installment payments punctually.  She will use the 2500 soles to hire day laborers to help her clear weeds from her coffee fields.

loans.use: to hire day laborers.

loans.name: Melva Esperanza

texts.es:
Melva vive con su hijo, es vendedora de ropa de forma ambulante, se dedica a dicha actividad desde hace cuatro años por ello ya cuenta con experiencia, trabaja todos los días de 6:00 a.m. a 3:00 p.m. 
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de ropa: camisas, blusas, faldas, short y ropa interior demas artículos para su negocio, esta compra le ayudara a surtir su negocio y a obtener mejores utilidades los cuales ayudaran a cubrir los gastos familiares.
El Sueño de Melva es mantener el negocio y ayudar a su familia con los gastos económicos para brindarle a su hijo la educación adecuada.
texts.en:
Melva lives with her son. She is a clothing merchant who sells her wares in the streets. She has devoted herself to this business for four years so she already has experience, and works every day from 6 a.m. until 3 p.m. 

She is seeking a loan to purchase clothing such as shirts, blouses, skirts, shorts, underwear and other items for her business. This purchase will help her stock her business and obtain better earnings which will help her cover the family expenses. 

Melva's dream is to sustain the business and help her family with financial expenses in order to provide her son with the appropriate schooling.

loans.use: to purchase clothing such as shirts, blouses, skirts, shorts and underwear.

loans.name: Redante

texts.en:
Redante is 46 years old, married and blessed with four children.  He is a farmer and this enables him to provide for the needs of his family. 

As he stated, “It is role of a father to raise a family.”  For this reason, he is asking for a loan of P13,000 to purchase needed inputs such as seeds, fertilizers and insecticides.

Through these inputs, he would be able to yield a higher profit during the harvesting season.  By then, he could save for the future of his children.

loans.use: to purchase needed inputs such as seeds, fertilizers and insecticides.

loans.name: Siti

texts.en:
Siti is a 57-year-old lady who is married to Mulyono, 57 years old. They are blessed with three children namely: Rony, 31; Arif, 29, both married; and Surya, 27.

Siti has been running a kiosk for six years using her own capital. She sells daily necessities such as detergent, bath soap, brooms, wheat flour, cigarettes, candies, etc. In addition to running a kiosk, Siti and Mulyono also have a rented room business that enables her to generate more income for her family’s living. 

Siti is planning to improve her kiosk by adding more stock needed. She is requesting a loan of IDR 4,500,000 from TLM. She would like to purchase more stock such as rice, cooking oil, sugar, wheat flour, etc. for her kiosk.

loans.use: to purchase more stock such as rice, cooking oil, sugar, wheat flour, etc.

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has seven children.
 
Annabelle has a vegetable garden that sells vegetables like string beans and eggplants during harvest time. She has had this business for 10 years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy fertilizers for the vegetable garden.

Annabelle has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Annabelle hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for the vegetable garden.

loans.name: Salume

texts.en:
Salume is a resident and a farmer in Kitale, Western Kenya and lives with her family of three children between 12 and 8 years old in their rural home where she carries out dairy and poultry farming and produces milk and eggs for the local market. She has seven years of experience in farming.

Salume has requested a loan of 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to boost her poultry farming by buying more poultry birds at a cost of 10,000 KES and building a bigger and better housing unit for her growing number of birds. She is optimistic her farming business will continue to grow and earn her enough income to educate the children.

Salume is, however, worried about the rising cost of poultry feed, which is hurting the business.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds and build a poultry housing unit

loans.name: Sang

texts.en: Sang, 61, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is a clay pot producer. Her husband is a rice farmer. Additionally, he runs a poultry farm to generate more income. All of her children are employed; one is a weaving tutor and another one is a clay pot tutor. Sang is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase wood to build a new house. In the future, she would like to expand her farming business in order to generate more income to support the family.

loans.use: to purchase wood to build a new house.

loans.name: Hai

texts.en:
Hai is 52 years old.  She is married and has four children.  Her husband is retired.  They live in Ho Chi Minh City.

Hai operates a food stall in front of her house.  She has been in business for 12 years.  She sells meals to people in her community.  She plans to take a loan to repair her stall and purchase good quality food to sell. Hai hopes that this will enable her to attract more customers during the coming holiday season.

She hopes that through this loan she will be able to generate additional income to reinvest in her business and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to repair her stall and purchase good quality food to sell.

loans.name: Love And Unity Group

texts.en:
Binta, (pictured in the middle) is the featured leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Born 37 years ago in Kabala town, Binta is married and has one child.  For many years now, Binta has been selling palm oil (the country’s most popular cooking oil). Binta will use her share of the loan (SLL 800,000) to expand her business; she will buy gallons of palm oil to add to her current stock.  

This is not the first loan that M’Balu and her group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. However, with the help of this new loan, they will be able to further expand their individual businesses, make more sales, and continues to further improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy gallons of palm oil to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Danessa Magdalena

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito San Vicente se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.
En este lugar vive la señora Danessa, tiene 34 años de edad, está casada y  de esta relación tiene un hijo de 16 años de edad el cual estudia en colegio. Su esposo es chofer.
Danessa es una muy buena esposa  que se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, sabanas, edredones, toldos, entre otros artículos,  ella vende en un almacén de un tío y también es sus ratos libres sale a vender  puerta a puerta, la mayoría de sus ventas las realiza los fines de semana que tiene más tiempo para salir, aunque también vende en su casa, le encanta el comercio y lleva más 12 años dedicada a esta actividad  la cual le permite ganarse lo suyo y esto gracias a los créditos que le ayudan a financiar su negocio.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas, sabanas, edredones, almohadas, entre todo lo que vende. Está desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan los créditos. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a su hijo.

loans.use: comprar pantalones, blusas, camisetas, sabanas, edredones, almohadas, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Joyce would like to buy house paints, wood polish, cement, carpets,  brushes, plastic and metal pipes

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina is a renowned General stores operator for the paast 16 years. She has been selling ladies and gents footwear for the past years. She has recently joined the Kraban Support Foundation and has participated in the TEACH lending programs to improve and sharpen and business records keeping skills. She has requested for a loan of $925 from KIVA to strengthen her business capital.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 54 years old, married and has eight children. She is a seamstress and owns a phone booth. She also makes loaves of bread. She started her business in 2003 and has been Hope’s faithful client since 2004.

In order to be able to speed up production and offer a better service to clients, Rose is asking for a loan of $600 which she will use to purchase another sewing machine. Due to the high demand from clients, Rose is planning to expand her business after she buys a new sewing machine.

loans.use: To acquire another sewing machine to meet client demand and buy phone cards in bulk for resale

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina B., 35, and her husband, Carlos, 48, started their business, Mercería San Cayetano, three years ago selling clothing. They have a huge selection of long-sleeve shirts, tank tops, and a variety of panties, bras, and briefs. They purchase their merchandise from Mercado 4 in Asuncion, a large outdoor market that is a two hour bus ride from Carapegua.

Carlos works as a builder, while Mariana looks over their stand in the Mercado Municipal, a small flea market, of Carapegua. Mariana works everyday of the week and at times she also travels around the city to sell their merchandise.

The couple is seeking a loan to buy more female underwear from Asuncion to resell in Carapegua.

loans.use: Purchase female underwear

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
After all the hard labor invested in their rice field for which does not yield enough revenue, the family of Ms Nguyễn Thị Thành cannot escape poverty. So when "Quỹ TYM" fund program got implanted in Quảng Hùng, Ms Thành jumped at the chance and had applied for a loan to help her start a business in a small butcher shop. It wasn't easy at first but with determination, hard work and honesty, her shop had gained a lot of thrust from the customers. The quality of the meat, the cleanness of the shop keep the customers happy. Ms Thành's wish is to expand her butcher shop and to attract more customers. She is requesting a loan of 400 USD to buy more products and a few more pigs to raise in time for the new year sales

Translater from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer

Quanh năm với đồng ruộng, thu nhập chỉ trông vào cây lúa, gia đình chị Nguyễn Thị Thành không thoát khỏi cái nghèo túng. Từ khi Quỹ TYM về với xã Quảng Hùng, chị đã mạnh dạn vay vốn làm ăn chuyển sang kinh doanh buôn bán thịt chó, thịt lợn. Bước đầu gặp không ít khó khăn nhưng với sự chịu khó, đức tính thật thà, hàng của chị đã lấy được lòng người mua với chất lượng thịt bán ra đảm bảo, hợp vệ sinh. Mong muốn của chị là hàng thịt chó, thịt lợn của gia đình mình ngày càng được nhiều ngưòi biết đến. Vòng vốn này chị đăng ký vay 400 USD về để lấy thêm hàng đồng thời mua thêm vài con lợn dự trữ hàng cho dịp Tết.

loans.use: buy pigs and repair pigpen

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is the very cordial and embracing owner of the Mpererwe High School, in the village of the same name. She is married with two children. She has operated her school for three years and currently has 120 children enrolled. It is a private school offering classes in Secondary and Advanced studies. Secondary is 4 years from ages 14 to 18 and advanced is 2 years from 18 to 20. Students pay about $40.00 per term plus the cost of uniforms and books. There are three terms in a year. The school gets no outside funding. Financially it is not easy to run a private school, but the public schools lack a great deal and have only recently offered Secondary and Advanced studies. So the need for private schools is great.

Betty plans to use her loan to install power to her school so that she can buy a computer for her students to use. Her dream is to one day buy a plot of land and build her own school. For now, she rents the space of a school which had closed down. With her energy and enthusiasm for her students,  she hopes to attain her dream. She is a wonderful, strong woman.

loans.use: Betty plans to use her loan to install power to her school so that she can install a computer for her students

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence A. is 60 years old.  She is a widow with 9 children.  She hails from Benin City where she sells pap (akamu).  She has been in this business since 1984.  She is requesting a loan to enable her to buy more corn for the preparation of pap (akamu).

loans.use: To buy more corn for preparation of pap (akamu)

loans.name: Muzaffar

texts.en:
Muzaffar is 37 years old. He is married and has 3 children of school age. His wife is a teacher of secondary school.

Muzaffar produces Tajik cradles. The cradles in Tajikistan are very colorful. They are made of wood. As a rule the national cradle is presented by the grandparents of a child when the baby is 40 days old. The entire family celebrates this event. Muzaffar has been in this business for 15 years. His wife and two children help him. Once the cradles are finished, he sells them from his house. The business provides stability that allows the family to have enough income to ensure the family can improve their living conditions.

Muzaffar has been working with IMON for three years. He has proven himself as a successful client, managing his loans with accuracy and precision. Today Muzaffar requests a loan in the amount of $1,000.00 US Dollars in order to purchase planks and paints for producing more cradles. Muzaffar is planning to repay the loan in 6 months.

loans.use: Purchasing raw material: planks and paints.

loans.name: Delia Luz's Group

texts.en:
Delia and Florenta have been members of the community bank “Imasumac” for thirteen and fourteen years respectively. In that time they have learned how to improve their businesses, save, be responsible, and to see the other associates as sisters.

Delia is 52. She is married and has one adult child. She sells clothing and cosmetics. Delia takes orders and then travels ten hours to the city of Lima to buy them. She has had this business for ten years.

Florenta is 50 years old. She is married and has three children. Florenta sells vegetables as well as auto parts. She works at the vegetable market in the morning and then sells car parts from a different market in the afternoon. She has been selling auto parts for two years, but started selling vegetables with her mom when she as twelve.

Delia and Florenta need loans of 1000 and 600 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in their businesses.

One of the most important aspects of the community bank is the interest earning savings account each associate has Delia and Florenta plant o use their savings to buy a car within the next year, and to open a store this July. Their dreams are to continue growing and improving their lives, as well as to help their children to become professionals

loans.use: Delia and Florenta need loans of 1000 and 600 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in their businesses.

loans.name: Leticia's Furaha. Group

texts.en:
Leticia is 30 years old and is a married woman with 2 children, ages 7 and 4 years old. Leticia is a vegetable seller, a business she started in 2005. Every day, she works from 7am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $60 from her sales.

In the past, Leticia has taken out 2 successful loans from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing in banana selling, alcohol selling, food vending, vegetables, and charcoal selling.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business

loans.name: Juana's Group

texts.en:
Karina, Ana, and Juana are members of the community bank “Los Sauces de Compañia”. “Los Sauces do Compañia has 28 members, all of whom are from the area of Compañia on the outskirts of the city. They joined the bank one and a half years ago and have now completed three loan cycles. Through the community bank they have learned how to manage money and be responsible.

All three women live with their partners. Karina is twenty and has a two-year-old son. Ana is 26 and has a four-year-old daughter and two year old son. Juana is 28 and has two sons who are eight and six.

Karina, Ana, and Juana are members of brick-0making families. For several generations their families have made and fired adobe bricks. However, all of them hope that their children will leave the trade. Their dreams are that their children will receive good educations and find work as professionals.

They need loans of 300, 1200, and 450 soles (2.8 soles = $1) respectively. They will invest their loans by purchasing things such as fore wood, charcoal, and paying employees.

loans.use: Purchase materials for making bricks

loans.name: Sahrah

texts.id:
Sahrah's daily activitiy is to sell toys in Pasar Badung, start from 5 to 7 a.m. She chooses to selli in that time because 5 to 7 a.m is the time when the market is very crowded with many customers. Sahrah always has to walk in the crowd to offer and sell her stuffs. Sometimes when she feels too tired, she sits and sells her stuffs on a piece of cloth.

She lives with her husband in a rented house in Jl.Kartini Denpasar. They have 4 children who all have already got married and live separately.

Sahrah hopes that she could use the loan she expects to earn to purchase more various toys to be sold.

Translated form Indonesian by Hestyana, Kiva volunteer.

Kegiatan sehari-hari Sahrah adalah berjualan di Pasar Badung mulai dari pagi jam 5 sampai jam 7. Sengaja Sharah berjualan di jam tersebut karena merupakan jam sibuk, dimana banyak sekali pengunjung pasar. Sahrah harus berjalan keliling berdesak-desakan dengan pengunjung pasar untuk menjajakan dagangannya. Terkadang kalau dia kelelahan dia harus menggelar tikar atau karpet untuk menjajakan dagangannya. Saat ini bersama suaminya, dia tinggal di Jl.Kartini Denpasar. Mereka berdua tinggal di sebuah rumah kontrakan. Sahrah mempunyai 4 orang anak, tetapi semuanya sudah memiliki keluarga sendiri. Mereka semua sudah menikah. Sahrah beraharap dari pinjaman modal kali ini bisa dipakai untuk memperbanyak jenis jualannya.

loans.use: To increase capital

loans.name: Josefa Elba

texts.es:
Josefa L. is a native of the Sandino City neighborhood in beautiful Managua. She has dedicated her self arduously to her business of making mattresses and pillows, which she then sells out her home. With two children to provide for and the responsibility to tend to all of her home's necessities, Josefa works buying supplies to make her products and once they are made she sells them to customers. It's necessary to point out that she has wisely sought the help of Kiva partner Ceprodel by means of loan, which she used to great benefit for her business. Today she's requesting another loan to purchase materials. She is very confident her request will be granted and her economic condition will improve.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Josefa L. es originaria del municipio de Ciudad Sandino de la bella ciudad de Managua en Nicaragua. Ella se ha dedicado arduamente al negocio de la elaboración y venta de colchones y almohadas los cuales son comercializados en su propia casa de habitación.

Con dos hijos que mantener y con la responsabilidad de atender todas las necesidades de su hogar, ella trabaja en el negocio comprando materiales para elaborar los colchones y las almohadas y una vez que estos son elaborados procede a comercializarlos a los clientes. Es necesario destacar que muy sabiamente ella ha buscado apoyo en Ceprodel por medio de los créditos los cuales le han servido de mucho beneficio para sus compras. Hoy solicita el crédito para la compra de los materiales y está muy confiada de que le será otorgado y así mejorará su condición económica.

loans.use: Purchase materials to make mattresses and pillows / Compra de materiales

loans.name: Pisey

texts.en:
Mr. Pisey M. and his wife, Mrs. Channet Lao, are subsistence farmers in Tumnop Thmey Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Aside from this business activity, Mr. Pisey M. is a firewood seller. He is 28 and the father of two children, both of whom are too young to work or be enrolled in school.

In order to improve his family's living conditions, Mr. Pisey M. now wants to start a rice mill business which can transform or husk rice for a profit. Mr. Pisey M. and his wife are shown in the picture.

loans.use: To start up a rice mill business

loans.name: Yen Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Lê Thị Yên năm nay 42 tuổi. Gia đình chị hiện có 3 con trong đó có 1 người con đã trưởng thành. Khi mới tham gia Quỹ tình thương chị xin vay vòng vốn đầu là 1.000.000đ để sử dụng vào chăn nuôi cho thu nhập 500.000đ/ tháng. Nhận thấy công việc chăn nuôi không mang lại hiệu quả kinh tế cao, gia đình chị đã mạnh dạn đầu tư vốn để buôn bán than. Đến nay qua 8 năm buôn bán than kinh tế gia đình chị đã rất ổn định. Anh chị đã tiết kiệm mua được 1 chiếc xe tải để sử dụng chở than đi bán. Ngoài ra anh chị vấn kết hợp chăn nuôi lợn gà tại gia đình. Với thu nhập ổn định từ chăn nuôi, buôn bán anh chị đã có điều kiện hơn để đầu tư cho việc học hành của con cái và mua sắm trang thiết bị trong gia đình.Vòng vốn tới anh chị mong muốn được vay 19.000.000đ để đầu tư vốn vào buôn bán than

Thu nhập 4.500.000đ/ tháng

Translated from Vietnamese by Duc Tran, Kiva Volunteer.

Mrs. L. Thi Yen, 43 year old, has 3 children, one of whom has stayed independent from the family. Joining TYM, she made the first loan of 1,000,000 Vietnamese Dong to invest in live-stock, whose revenue was 500,000 Vietnamese Dong per month. Noticing the business would not be very successful, she switched and invested in retailing coal. For 8 years selling coal, she and her husband managed to foster the family’s financial situation. They saved enough money to buy a truck to transport more coal. Besides, they still raise pigs and chickens at home. The revenue from businesses allows their children to go to school and them to buy home facilities. They plan to borrow 19,000,000 Vietnamese Dong to invest in coal retailing.

The family’s income is 4,500,000 Vietnamese Dong per month.

loans.use: Coal Sales

loans.name: Xinh Thi's Group

texts.vi:
chị Tô thị Xinh Ms 13050015 năm nay 32 tuổi, vợ chồng chị sinh được 2 con, cả 2 con chị đều nhỏ và đang đi học. Chồng chị là thợ lắp đặt điện thoại, còn chị mở cửa hàng kinh doanh bánh kẹo, nước giải khát tại nhà, nên mức thu nhập của gia đình chị cũng khá ổn định từ 170.000 VND đến 200.000 VND / ngày. chị đã tham gia vay vốn của chương trình qua một C. kỳ và hoàn trả rất tốt, C. kỳ này chị đăng ký vay mức 4.704.000 VND để đầu tư vào kinh doanh .Trong nhóm chị có các thành viên sau :

  • chị N. thị Hạnh Ms 13050014 đăng ký vay mức 3.360.000 VND để đi chợ buôn bán hoa quả
  • chị Tô thị Lan Ms 13050019 đăng ký vay mức 3.808.000 VND để kinh doanh hoa quả
  • chị Bùi thị Thành Ms 13050018 vay mức 4.704.000 VND để mua gỗ làm mộc
  • chị chị Vũ thị Tình Ms 13050013 vay mức 4.704.000 VND để đi chợ buôn bán thịt
  • chị Vũ thị Hiền Ms 13050017 vay mức 4.256.000 VND để làm bánh đa nem
  • chị Bùi thị Lam Ms 13050016 vay mức 4.704.000 VND để làm nghề tráng bánh đa nem
  • chị C. thị Thuỷ Ms 13050025 vay mức 4.704.000 VND để đi chợ và tráng bánh đa nem
texts.en:
Mrs. Xinh Thi T., ID 13050015, is a 32 year old woman. The couple has 2 children who are still small and going T. school. Her husband is a cable guy who works while she operates a small kiosk serving drinks and candies at home. The family’s income is stable, ranging from 170,000 T. 200,000 Vietnamese Dong per day. She joins a group T. make a loan and pays back on time. Later, she plans T. make another loan of 4,704,000 Vietnamese Dong T. further invest in her business. In her group, there are the following individuals: • Ms. Hanh Thi Nghiem, ID 13050019, borrowing 3,808,000 Vietnamese Dong T. sell fruits. • Ms. Lan Thi T., ID 13050019, borrowing 4,704,000 Vietnamese Dong T. sell fruits. • Ms. Thanh Thi B., ID 13050018, borrowing 4,256,000 Vietnamese Don T. sell meat. • Ms. Tinh Thi V., ID 13050017, borrowing 4,704,000 Vietnamese Dong T. operate a “Banh Da” kiosk. • Ms. Thuy Thi C., ID 13050025, borrowing 4,704,000 Vietnamese Dong T. operate a “Banh Da Nem” kiosk.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duc Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Drinking and Candy kiosk

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Greetings from Fatuma from Kigali, Rwanda! Fatuma is 55 years old, a single mother with 1 child.

Fatuma sells fabrics as a wholesalerto different retail shops and tailors who make dresses and shirts out of the fabrics. Many people in her area like her fabrics because they are of good quality. She employs one person to help her run the business. She earns about $110 per month.

Her loan will be used to buy more fabrics before Christmas because she is anticipating a huge market during Christmas celebrations. The loan requested is 500,000 frws and the loan period is 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more fabrics before the Christmas season

loans.name: Nadine

texts.en: Nadine is a 26 year-old woman who lives in a small village near Saida city. She is a hair dresser and a make-up specialist. Nadine wishes to purchase accessories for her salon, such as a hair dryer, mirrors, hair brushes and other essential materials. Therefore, she is requesting a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua. This is the first time that she has requested a loan.

loans.use: To purchase accessoriees for her salon.

loans.name: Phan's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Phan L. is the leader of a group with four members who all live in Poub village in Takeo Province. She is 57 years old and the mother of three children; two are farmers helping their father, and the other attends the local school. She is a grocer who owns a small store in the local market. Her husband, Mr. Chuon Thim, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where he cultivates rice to earn a living. He faces a small problem because his field is insufficiently fertile. In order to solve this problem, they decided to request a loan to buy fertilizer to  make the crop more productive. 

All the members in this village bank loan have end-of-term loans so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. These loans allow borrowers to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to do so. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s client make their payments on time. AMK has an overall delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Maura

texts.en:
Maura is a member of the Bienestar (“Well-being”) Village Bank. She is 50 years old and married. She has six children and a number of grandchildren. Maura sells dry goods like rice, sugar, and flour from a stand in a local market. She has had her stand for the past three years.

Maura is requesting a loan of 1200 soles to buy more rice. Depending on the variety of rice, a sack costs between 112 and 143 soles, so she would be able to buy between seven and nine sacks of rice with her loan. She also sells soaps, cookies, and a variety of other items, so she may buy five or six sacks of rice along with other miscellaneous items.

Maura’s goal for the future is to continue working and improve her business.

loans.use: Buy sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Anasa Group

texts.en:
Anasa is the group leader of the Anasa group. There are four members in this group. All of them would like to receive a loan for his/her business.

Leda and Anasa want to take a loan for their business of tailoring. Zabayda wants to take a loan for a business of her husband’s. Mena wants to take a loan for her business of tailoring. They all want to expand and progress their business.

They would like to thank all the lenders from around the world to Kiva and AFSG in Afghanistan for providing this process for loans to a poor country.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan K. is currently in the business of selling cold drinks such as sodas, milk, and juice, and is requesting a loan to expand her enterprise. Thirty-seven years old and married to a businessman, she has three children, all in school.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To expand the business.

loans.name: Yim

texts.en:
Mr. Yim T., 61, was married in 1970 and has six children: three sons and three daughters. Three of her children are married and live outside the family home, one daughter is a deputy commune leader and other two children live full time in Phnom Penh. The family lives along National Road Number Six, about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Yim has been making mats for four years and sells them at her house. Making mats is a skill she learned from her neighbor. Mats are made from a plant that Cambodian people called Kork (showed in the picture). Her husband farms. He grows bananas and jujubes. She is asking for a loan of $1,000 T. purchase a plot of land for her son T. build his house.

loans.use: To purchase a plot for her son to build a house.

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en: Deborah sells fabrics and has been in this business for the past three years. She is 46 years old and married with a child. Deborah needs the loan amount of N150,000 to purchase more fabrics to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more fabrics to sell

loans.name: Mrs. Sithoeun Dong Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Ten people living in Dei Edth Kaoh Phos village in Kandal province comprise this village bank loan, and they will use the loan for various purposes. Mrs. Sithoeun D. is a 30 year-old village bank president. She is a beautician who has been hired by the people during weddings, birthdays, parties, and so on.

Since she has a lot of customers, she needs many cosmetics to support her business, thus she decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. Her husband, Mr. Haem Vanthuon, is an electric repairer. Mrs. Sithoeun D. has three children, two of whom are attending the local school while the other is too young to work or stuD.. Mr. Vatana D. does not come to take a loan but his wife does, so she is presented in the picture instead him.

loans.use: Needs many cosmetics to support her business.

loans.name: Edith Xiomara

texts.es: Doña Edith Xiomara López, tiene la edad de 43 años de edad, reside en Unidad de Propósito en la ciudad de Managua, tiene cuatro hijos de 5,10,22 y24 años de edad, los dos mayores son independientes y los otros estudian, el negocio de la señora Edith es una pulpería con tres de administrarla, inicio con prestamos en micro financieras. Con este crédito quiere invertir en productos Como granos básicos, carnes, productos de limpiezas y otros. Sus planes es hacerlo crecer y así obtener mejores resultados, a si como hacer mejoras a su vivienda. También quiere apoyar a sus hijas para que estudien y se preparen para un futuro mejor.
texts.en:
Mrs. Edith Xiomara López is 43 years old and lives in Unidad de Propósito in the city of Managua. She has four children, who are 5, 10, 22, and 24 years old. The oldest two are independent, and the other two are students. Mrs. López owns a local store, which she manages with her two children. She began her business with loans from micro-finance companies. With this loan she wants to invest in products such as basic grains, meats, cleaning products and other products. She has made plans to grow and in that way obtain better results, as well as improve her standard of living. She also wants to help her children study and prepare for a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic grains and meats

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret trades in food items such as yams, vegetables, etc. She sells on a tabletop at the local market square. She procures her goods from Kintampo, a nearby market, at effective prices. 
Margaret is 34 years old, married and has three children: one son and two daughters. She says all are currently in primary school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a farming and trading community near Dormaa, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region. Her husband is a farmer. 
Margaret has been in business for one year now and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk. Margaret is hoping to expand her business and give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy yams

loans.name: Judith

texts.es: Judith tiene 28 años, vive en casa de sus padres con su pequeño hijo de 8 años. Desde hace 2 años se dedica a la venta de artículos variados para el arreglo personal y para el hogar, vendía de manera ambulante, pero recientemente adquirió la renta de un local comercial para poder vender de manera más estable, y ahora los riesgos a los que se exponía al vender en la calle se reducen, además que puede estar más tiempo al lado de su hijo. Debido a la dinámica de este trabajo, las ganancias que obtiene son muy buenas, por lo que Judith ha optado por  seguir vendiendo de esta forma y crecentar su mercadería. Es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, ella fue invitada a formar parte de su actual banco comunal y se siente muy contenta por ello, ya que sabe que aprenderá mucho. El dinero que está solicitando es para adquirir más mercadería para implementar su puesto de ventas.
texts.en:
Judith is 28 years old and she lives in her parent’s house with her 8 year-old son. For 2 years she has been selling a variety of items for personal and household use. She was working as a street vendor, but recently she rented a store so she could sell in a more stable manner. Now she is exposed to fewer of the risks she confronted when selling in the street and she can also spend more time with her son. Because of the type of job this is, her earnings are very good, so Judith has decided to continue selling this way and increase her merchandise. This is the first time she has had a loan with MFP. She was invited to join the current communal bank and she is very happy about this because she knows she will learn a lot. The loan she is requesting is to purchase more merchandise for her store.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise

loans.name: Judith

texts.en: Judith M. is a 38-year-old widow with four children and two other child dependents. For three years, she has run a business selling spare parts in Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda. She has requested a loan of 500,000 Rwandan francs (FRW) to help her expand this business. This is Judith's first loan with Vision Finance Company.

loans.use: Business expansion.

loans.name: Ni Made Sarmi

texts.en: Ni Made Sarmi (DNR.M-0576) is a 28-year-old female living in the town of Desa Perancak, Negara. She is married and has an infant child. Ni Made Sarmi owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over six years and earns approximately 200,000 IDR a month. In 2008, Ni Made Sarmi joined DINARI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is now requesting a loan of 4,125,000 IDR which will be used to purchase piglets to raise and sell. The loan will be her first from DINARI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About DINARI: The mission of DINARI is to strive for the preservation of the environment, to empower the poor, and to provide socio-economic development opportunities to small business owners. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. ***************************************************** Ni Made Sarmi - (DNR.M-0576) merupakan 28 tahun wanita. Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Desa Perancak - Negara. Dia (perempuan) menikah dan memiliki 1 anak usia balita. Untuk membiayai hidup, Ni Made Sarmi memiliki & menjalankan usaha. Bisnis beroperasi di sektor pertanian. Tujuan utama bisnis tersebut adalah memelihara ternak. Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual. Ni Made Sarmi sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 6 tahun. Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Ni Made Sarmi menghasilkan sekitar 200,000 IDR sebulan. Dalam 2008, Ni Made Sarmi bergabung DINARI untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis. Ni Made Sarmi telah berhasil melunasi pinjaman sebelumnya dari DINARI. Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 4,125,000 IDR. Pinjaman saat ini akan digunakan untuk untuk membeli bibit ternak untuk dibesarkan & dijual di masa mendatang. Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 2nd pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari DINARI. Ni Made Sarmi berencana untuk menggunakan pendapatan tambahan yang dihasilkan dari bisnis untuk mendukung keuangan anggota keluarga langsung peminjam. Tentang DINARI: Misi DINARI adalah memperjuangkan kelestarian lingkungan, memberdayakan kaum miskin, dan menyediakan kesempatan pembangunan sosial ekonomi bagi pemilik usaha kecil. *Catatan: Untuk memaksimalkan efisiensi & menurunkan biaya, pinjaman ini ditempelkan menggunakan templat sehingga dapat diterjemahkan otomatis oleh Kiva. Mengingat bahwa terjemahan manual atas profil memakan biaya besar, Kiva menciptakan templat ini untuk Mitra Lapangan untuk memungkinkan mereka terus menempelkan pinjaman dalam Bahasa sambil memberikan informasi yang bermutu & akurat kepada para pemberi pinjaman Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise and sell

loans.name: Eplida

texts.en:
Epleda A. is 54 years old and is married to a farmer named Lolito. The two are not blessed with many children. However, they are very happy to have at least one child, who is now ten years old. Epleda does not want anything in life other than to give her only child a better living, by allowing them to reach a higher level of education and to live in a better house someday. The best way Epleda thinks she can achieve her dream for her child and to make herself happy is to have her own business. 

There is land owned by Epleda's family that can be used for agricultural purposes. Epleda joined ASHI to get a loan to enable her to maximize the land by planting rice. With the help of her husband, their business has grown. Her loan amounts have increased since she was able to repay previous loans and maintain very good performance with ASHI.

Recently, Epleda applied for a loan for her new business endeavor, a hog fattening business. However, she will continue her farming business with a portion of her loan. Hog fattening is just Epleda's way of diversifying in case her farming business defaults and she needs capital.

loans.use: buying piglets and fertilizer

loans.name: Aquilina

texts.en:
Aquilina G. is from the town of Aloran. She is 30 years old. Aquilina is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Aquilina owns & operates a hog raising business in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Aquilina has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Aquilina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Aquilina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from PMPC. Aquilina is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the  loan taken out by Aquilina from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Francisco Matilde

texts.es: Francisco Matilde Hernández S. tiene la edad de 37 años. Vive con su compañera de vida y tienen 7 hijos que dependen de él. La actividad económica es la venta de leña. Francisco inicio este negocio por que no tenía un trabajo, y su esposa y su hijo necesitaban el sustento diario, a pesar de lo difícil que es su situación Francisco mantiene la alegría con sus clientes. Hace más de 6 años que se dedica a este negocio y lo más difícil de su trabajo es que tiene que recorrer muchos kilómetros en busca de sus clientes. El financiamiento que solicita es destinado para capital de trabajo para la compra de leña, madera y hacha además proporcionarle ciertas mejoras a su carretón en donde distribuye la leña. Sus deseo es salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Francisco Matilde Hernández S. is 37 years old. He lives with his partner, and they have 7 dependent children. His business is selling firewood. Francisco began this business because he didn't have a job, and his wife and son were needing daily sustenance. In spite of how difficult his situation is, Francisco stays cheerful with his customers. He has made his living with this business for more than 6 years, and the most difficult part of his work is that he has to travel many kilometers to reach his customers. The financing he is requesting is intended for business capital in order to purchase firewood, lumber and an ax. In addition, it would provide for certain improvements for his cart that he uses to distribute the firewood. His wish is to improve his family's situation.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase firewood, lumber and an ax as well as make improvements on his cart.

loans.name: Delma

texts.en:
Delma is a vegetable vendor in her village. Most of the time, the vegetables that she sells were grown in her backyard. Sometimes she purchases additional vegetables from a nearby market, which she sells for a greater profit. Delia is 35 years old and married to Federico, a farmer, with whom she has two young children. She hopes that her business will be able to provide her children with a complete education.

Delma would like to borrow a loan of PHP 4,000 to purchase farming materials, such as fertilizer, pesticide and seeds. Through these efforts, she will be able to expand the variety of vegetables that she can offer and eventually eliminate the need to buy vegetables from the market.

loans.use: To purchase farming materials, such as fertilizer, pesticide.

loans.name: Marles

texts.en: Marles M. is currently in the business of selling foodstuffs at her restaurant and is requesting a loan to purchase more chickens for food in the restaurant. Marles is 26 years old and is married with a husband who is a driver. She has five children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, Marles hopes to be able to extend the floor space of her restaurant. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase more chickens for food in the resturant

loans.name: Kemi

texts.en: Kemi is 45 years old and married with two children. She sells kitchen utensils. She hopes to expand her business. She hopes for the loan amount of N70,000 to purchase more kitchen utensils to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more kitchen utensils to sell

loans.name: Froride

texts.en:
Froride N. is 40 years old and is married with seven children aged between 9 and 26. She and her large family live together in Ngoma district, Kibungo province, Rwanda, where she has had a small shop selling various products for the past six years. Her shop is open from 6 in morning to 9 in evening every day.

Froride is requesting a loan from Vision Finance Company and Kiva lenders for the purpose of expanding her business and buying new products and inventory that she believes her customers will want. This should help her to serve her existing clients better and hopefully attract new ones. If so, she will earn more profit. With this extra profit she will have sufficient money to continue to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise for her shop

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La señora Francisca A. ya ha tenido tres créditos con FVP los cuales ha mejorar su vivienda y los a pagado puntual mente.
A la vivienda la está haciendo falta el portón al frente, pero en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder pagarle a la persona que se encargara de elaborar y colocar el portón. 
Es por eso que está solicitando nueva mente un préstamo para poner el portón y así sus dos hijos estarán  más seguros. 
Doña Francisca es empleada de una compañía de elaboración de alimentos, ella trabaja en el departamento de vendedora. Este ingreso es con el que pagara el préstamo, ya que  su esposo el señor José Guadalupe Hernández se encargara de los  gastos familiares.
texts.en:
Mrs. Francisca A. has already had three loans with Kiva partner FVP, which she has used to improve her home. She has paid those loans timely. Currently, she needs a front gate for her home, but does not have the money necessary to hire the person who makes and installs the gate. This is why she is again asking for a loan: so that she can install the gate and in that way her two children will be safe. Francisca works in a food processing company as a saleswoman. With her income she will pay the loan; her husband, Mr. José Guadalupe Hernández, will take care of the expenses of the home.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Installing a gate in front of her home

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es:
Elvira, es costurera y tiene un taller de costura, donde realiza trabajos de costura de trajes para damas y también arreglos en general.
Vive en la zona de miraflores de la Ciudad de La Paz, en casa como cuidadora.
El crédito será destinado para capital de trabajo (compra tela, forro e hilos)
Es la quinta vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, su historial lo califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de su crédito.
texts.en:
Elvira is a seamstress and she has a shop where she makes women’s suits and does different types of alterations. She lives in the Miraflores area of La Paz, in a house where she is a caretaker. The loan will be used as capital for her work (to buy fabric, lining, and thread). This is the fifth time she has asked for a loan with Impro. Her good payment history qualifies her as a client.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fabric, linings, and thread for her seamstress shop

loans.name: Daher

texts.en: Daher is a fifty-two years old married man living in Bint Jbeil, Southern Lebanon with his wife and their three children. Daher has sold sanitary and construction products since 2000. His clients can be anyone from his region. Daher requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to increase his capital, by purchasing new products. This is the first time that Daher has requested a loan. He hopes to reach a level where he can have his own storage place, so he can start wholesale trading.

loans.use: To purchase new products.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria tiene 43 años, vive con sus hijos en su casa que es propia.Desde su niñez realiza lindos bordados en faldas,todos los días trabaja en su casa y luego vende sus diseños  en el mercado de su ciudad, su trabajo dura varias semanas, además también lleva su mercadería terminada a los vendedores de trajes típicos, este trabajo es de su agrado ya que disfruta realizándolo por eso  quiere seguir  en esta actividad  hasta donde pueda continuar con sus fuerzas.Es la décima vez  que esta solicitando un crédito con  MFP.Con el dinero del préstamo María comprará mayor cantidad de  materiales para sus bordados; como hilos y telas.
texts.en:
Maria is 43 years old and lives with her children in her own home. Since she was young she has made lovely embroidery for traditional skirts from her region. Everyday she works at home and then sells her designs in the artisans market in her city. Her workload lasts various weeks. Furthermore, she also takes her finished merchandise to sellers of traditional suits. This work is pleasurable for her since she enjoys doing it. This is why she wants to continue this activity for as long as she can with her efforts. This is the tenth time she requests a loan with MFP. With the loan Maria will buy a greater quantity of materials for her embroideries such as thread and fabrics.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Garza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a greater quantity of materials for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For food products supplies and to re-stock her store

loans.name: Barinisa`s Aburahmanova Group

texts.ru:
Баринисе 44 года, она замужем и воспитывает 3 детей. Старший сын недавно закончил юридическую академию, в данное помогает родителям в бизнесе, однака его мечта устроится на работу в финансовую полицию. Единственная дочь студентка Юридической академии, а младший сын школьник. У них имеется семейный бизнес. Бариниса вместе с супругом занимаются транспортировкой и оптовой реализацией овощей и фруктов (хурма, персики, картофель, лук) в столице Кыргызстана, в Бишкеке. Наш клиент непосредственно занимается заготовкой продукции, а ее супруг на собственном грузовике доставляет продукцию постоянным клиентам в Бишкеке. Этим бизнесом они занимаются на протяжении 20 лет. За это время смогли обновить свой грузовик, предоставили возможность детям получить хорошее образование и обустроили свой дом. Кредит запрашивается на ремонт кухни.

Мадинабону 21 лет, замужем. У нее есть маленький сын, за которым присматривает ее свекровь. Супруг работает в мясной лавке. у них имеется семейный бизнес по выращиванию живности, также производят молоко и кисломолочные изделия. Продукция реализуется в сельских пунктах общественного питания.На кредит она планирует купить одного бычка и корм. 

Мафтуне 25 лет, пока она не замужем, но собирается в этом году.  Она проживает вместе с родителями. Дома она занимается шитьем мужской и женской одежды, постельных принадлежностей, а также штор. Искусству шитья она научилась у матери, которая по профессии является портнихой. На полученный кредит клиент планирует закупить ткань для производства швейной продукции.

Саёра,19, замужем. Совсем недавно, всего лишь 9 месяцев назад, у нее появился первенец, очаровательная маленькая дочька. Супруг строитель - выполняет отделочные работы по Ошской области. На своем земельном наделе семья клиента выращивает хлопок. Кредит будет использован на весенние полевые работы, а именно для закупа семян хлопка, минеральных удобрений и вспахать землю. 

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Barinisa is forty-four years old. She is married and raising three children. The eldest son recently graduated from the law academy and helps his parents in the business, but his dream is to work for the financial police. The only daughter is a student at the law academy, and the youngest son is attending school. They have a family business. Barinisa along with her husband works in the transportation and wholesale of vegetables and fruits (persimmon, peaches, potatoes, onions) in the Kyrgyz capital, Bishkek. They are directly involved in the procurement of produce, and her husband delivers the produce to regular customers in Bishkek in his truck. They've been in business for twenty years. During this time, they have been able to upgrade his truck, give their children the opportunity to get a good education and renovate their house. They are asking for a loan for the remodel of the kitchen. Madinabona is twenty-one years old and married. She has a young son who is cared for by her mother-in-law. Her husband works in the butcher shop. They have a family business to raise livestock, and produce milk and milk products. The products are sold in the local cafes and restaurants. She asks for loan to buy a calf and feed. Maftuna is twenty-five years and is planning to get married this year. She lives with her parents. She has a home based business of sewing men's and women's clothing, bedding, and curtains. She learned the art of sewing from her mother, who by profession is a dressmaker. She needs a loan to purchase fabric for the production of garments. Sayora is nineteen and married. Just nine months ago, she gave birth to a cute, little daughter. Her husband is in construction and performs finishing work in the Osh region. They also grow cotton on their own piece of land. The loan will be used for spring field work, particularly to purchase cotton seeds and fertilizer and plowing the land. This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Translated from Russian by Susan Savkov, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair kitchen

loans.name: Álvaro

texts.es: Álvaro A. A. de 65 años de edad, reside en Atiquizaya, ubicado en el departamento de Ahuachapán. Vive en casa propia, en compañía de su esposa quien se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar y un hijo el cual trabaja para solventar sus gastos personales y brindarles una pequeña ayuda a sus padres. Álvaro posee una venta de medicinas y algodón, la cual esta ubicada en su casa de habitación. Desde hace 10 años que él posee este negocio, a través del cual se ha ganado la vida, ya que las medicinas le brindan muy buenas ganancias. Álvaro solicita un préstamo a través del cual él pueda comprar mayor cantidad de medicinas, de manera que su negocio pueda crecer y le brinde una esperanza de poder mejorar su estabilidad económica. Álvaro es un señor el cual busca la manera de seguir adelante y poder mejorar en la vida.
texts.en:
Álvaro A. A. is 60 years old and lives in Atiquizaya, located in the department of Ahuachapán. He lives in his own home with his wife, who is dedicated to the household tasks, and a son who works to cover his personal expenses and to provide a small amount of help to his parents. Alvaro has a business selling medicines and cotton wool which is located in the house where he lives. He has had this business for 10 years, and through this business he has made his living, since the sale of medicines provides very good earnings. Alvaro requests a loan that he will use to buy a larger quantity of medicines, so that his business can grow and provide him with the hope of having increased economic stability. Alvaro is a man who is always looking for a way to get ahead and improve his life.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy medicine

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda A. is a 65-year-old married woman who lives in Brgy Pook Hillside, Hinoba-an, Negros Occidental. She earns her living with her general store, farming, food vending and being a videoke operator.

Erlinda’s husband, Tomasito, helps her run her businesses.  They have 10 children. Six of the children have their own families and the other four are still single and help their parents with household needs.

Erlinda joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1994 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life for their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD she has been able to increase their family income by engaging in her general store, farming, food vending and being a videoke operator. Now she earns an average monthly income of PHP 9,000 from her business activities.

Erlinda is a member in good standing. Her previous loan of PHP 14,500 was used to fund operations of her general store, farming, food vending and being a videoke operator, which had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now for her 13th loan, she is borrowing PHP 15,000, which she intends to use on her general store and food vending.  Erlinda is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which are to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: As additional working capital

loans.name: Gloria Catalina

texts.es: Doña Gloria es casada, tiene hijos y se dedica a la crianza de animales, vende güipiles, los cuales vende los dias martes, jueves y domingos. Ella solicita el crédito para comprar mas animales y material para hacer güipiles y asi poder continuar con su venta. El sueño de Doña Gloria es tener una granja.
texts.en:
Ms. Gloria is married with children. She raises animals and sells huipils which she sells on Tuesdays, Thursdays, and Sundays. She is asking for the loan to buy more animals and material to make huipiles and thus continue selling. Ms. Gloria's dream is to have a farm.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of animals and material to make huipiles

loans.name: Nadim

texts.en:
Nadim is a 45-year-old married man with three school-age children. He runs a successful van taxi business and he has over 15 years of experience as a taxi driver. In Lebanon, it is common to use taxi services to go between neighborhoods in a given town as well as to travel between different regions. These services are especially important in areas where the infrastructure is less developed, which is true for most of the towns outside of Beirut and its surrounding suburbs. 

Today, Nadim is asking to borrow $1,200 to perform much needed maintenance work on his taxi’s engine and body to offer comfortable transportation service to his customers.

loans.use: To perform maintenance work on his taxi’s engine and body

loans.name: Ruth Biviana

texts.es:
Ruth es socia del Banco Comunal Triunfo.
Ruth es conviviente, tiene 22 años y 1 hijo, Ruth vende pan que compra del horno y reparte a las diferentes tiendas de su barrio, anteriormente Ruth vendía ropa actividad que dejo de realizar por que su hijo es pequeño y ya no podía viajar.
Ruth necesita un préstamo de 700 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de panes.
Los sueños de Ruth son construir su casa y tener una panadería.
texts.en:
Ruth is a member of the Triunfo Community Bank. Ruth is 22 years old, lives with her partner, and has one child. Ruth sells bread that she buys from the bakery and distributes to various shops in her neighborhood. Previously, Ruth sold clothing, which she stopped because her son is small and can't yet travel. Ruth needs a loan of 700 soles that she will invest in the purchase of bread. Ruth hopes to build a house and own a bakery.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel McRoberts, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of bread

loans.name: Mishack

texts.en:
Mishack is 37 years old and married with three children. He makes metallic grills, doors, windows, cookers and deep fryers and also does plumbing to earn a living.  He has been in this business for three years.  

Since he joined Faulu Kenya under Kuendelea Self Help Group, he has serviced one loan. He used the loan to boost his business and successfully repaid it. He managed to relocate his business from a slum to a permanent house in a different place. His business has improved tremendously and this has helped him provide a better education for his children.  

He has requested a loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings to buy materials such as scrap metals. He hopes to purchase a piece of land in order to construct a home for the family in future.

loans.use: To buy scrap metals

loans.name: Chanthou's Group

texts.en: In Chher Teal I village, in Kandal province consists five people who make up this group loan.  Chanthou M., 23, is its leader.  Members will use a piece of the loan for different purposes.  Chanthou is a farmer who owns a half-hectare plot of land to grow crops to sell to support her family.  Her problem is that her field is far away from an irrigation system.  So to improve production, Chanthou is applying for a loan to buy a water machine.  Her husband is a fisherman who can earn some money by selling fish.  They have two young childR..

loans.use: Buy a water machine.

loans.name: Olena

texts.en:
Olena is married. She has a kiosk in Kherson city selling various items: dishes, pots, cosmetics and some clothing. Olena started this business about 10 years ago. At that time she lost her job and needed a source of income. She knew some friends who were already involved in a sales business. She decided to try and the attempt was successful! 

Today Olena has many customers and always offers them good quality products at affordable prices. Her large variety of items allows Olena to have the same level of income throughout the different seasons.
