Olena has taken out small business loans before and found them to be a good aid for her business. This time Olena would like to borrow 15,000 UAH to purchase more inventory and increase her assortment of goods.

loans.use: to purchase inventory

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is a 39-year old married woman from Talim Island in the province of Rizal, living with her husband and two children. In 1998, she opened her own welding shop business and embarked on selling of Avon products. Her avid customers come from the surrounding areas and nearby town.

Lilia is now requesting a loan of 40,000 PHP in order to purchase additional needed equipment for her welding shop.  The remaining loan funds will be used to support her Avon retailing business. She believes that having new equipment in her welding shop and a larger variety of Avon inventory will help her retain her current customers as well as attract new clients in the neighborhood.

Lilia has been a proud member of Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI), a Kiva microfinance partner in the Philippines, since 1998.  She has been a dedicated member, regularly attending the weekly center meetings and maintaining solid repayment records on previous loans.

Lilia’s dreams are for her two children to complete college, to have winning businesses and to build a comfortable home to live in.  Additionally, she hopes that her businesses can continue to provide a sustainable livelihood to support her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional needed equipment for her welding shop.

loans.name: Noy

texts.en: Noy L., 34, is married and resides with her husband and five children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for Pre-Angkorean Temples. L. sews traditional fabrics at home, earning an income of USD 3.50 per day. Her husband is a farmer growing vegetables and earns an income of USD 3 each per day. L. is requesting a loan of USD 600 to purchase a plot of farmland to improve the farming business. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a plot of farmland.

loans.name: Sip

texts.en:
Sip H. is a 59 year old rice and vegetable grower from Battambang Province. She runs her business on her own farmland, where she grows different kinds of crops like cabbage, rice, and morning glories. She will sell the crops to a buyer when they have matured.

Sip H. is a widowed woman and the mother of three kids. She has another financial earner in her daughter, in the photograph above, who sells a few snack foods to earn a living. Sip H. requests a loan of $600 to be used to buy a used motorcycle to make family transportation easier. She proposes to plant crops by using any remaining cash from the loan.

loans.use: To buy a used motorcycle.

loans.name: Ngone

texts.fr:
Madame Ngoné S. est une jeune femme mariée de 26 ans. Elle habite dans le quartier de Mbenguene à Yoff. Elle est mère de 2 enfants dont l’âge varie entre 3 et 10ans. 
Pour madame S. les conseils de son mari lui ont permis de choisir l’activité de commerce  dans l’espoir de réaliser des bénéfices  afin de pouvoir réaliser son vœu qui est d’aider son mari. Elle s’active depuis plus de 3 mois dans la vente de glace et de jus car elle dispose d’un frigo. Madame S. vend aussi des chaussures.
Elle est membre de la caisse de Yoff depuis mai 2010. Elle sollicite un crédit de 50 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de sucre , de chaussures et de sacs d’oseille destinés a la vente. Elle souhaite renforcer son fond de commerce et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ngoné S. is a young, 26-year-old married woman. She lives in the neighborhood of Mbenguene, in Yoff. She is the mother of two children, ages 3 and 10. Relying on her husband’s advice, Mrs. S. engaged in commerce in hopes of accumulating profits that would allow her to fulfill her goal of helping her husband. For over three months, she has been selling ice and juice, having a refrigerator at her disposal. She also sells shoes. Mrs. S. has been a member of the Yoff credit union since May 2010. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 francs to buy sugar, shoes and bags of sorrel for resale. She wants to strengthen her working capital and improve her family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Nathalie Pelletier, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To strengthen her working capital

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en: Jennifer A. is from the village of Villaluz. She is 30 years old. Jennifer is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Jennifer runs a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Jennifer is just starting this business. In 2010, Jennifer joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jennifer is requesting a new loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP), which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Jennifer from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Zahuran's Group

texts.en:
Zahuran is a resident of Vehari. This is a small city located in Punjab, Pakistan which is famous for its agricultural industry. 

The very talented Zahuran owns & operates a sewing business to generate income for her family. She mainly receives orders from the neighboring region but has now started receiving orders from other areas. This is a result of the high quality of her work which has increased her income. 

Her husband is a tailor and runs a tailoring shop in the market. He has hired a worker who helps him complete his work on time. He pays him on a monthly basis. His shop always get filled with customers and he gets good orders on a regular basis. However, sometimes, the orders list increases and to meet deadlines he and his employee work day and night.
 
Zahuran has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business. With the loan, her husband will buy another sewing machine which will be used by his employee. The new machine will bring a positive change to his business as, presently, they have two machines and one is not in good working order.
  
Zahuran is hopeful that, by making this investment,  her husband will be able to increase his income and accept more orders from his customers.

loans.use: To buy another sewing machine for the tailoring business

loans.name: Simion Komen

texts.en:
Simion Komen C. has been selling cereals in Naivasha town for the last four years. He is 38 years old and married to Agnes Jerop. They have six children.

Simion was introduced to KADET Ltd. by a friend, and this will be his second loan. He paid his first loan well and in good time. He plans to use this loan to buy maize and beans in bulk for sale.

In the future, Simion also wants to venture into real estate and develop his rental houses.

loans.use: To buy maize and beans in bulk for resale

loans.name: Kosar's Group

texts.en:
Kosar lives in a 2-room brick house in Kasur, Pakistan, which is a small city located in Punjab and famous for its leather industry. A talented lady, Kosar owns and operates an embroidery business at her home. She is an expert in her work. She primarily does work for her neighbors. She also sells bangles at her home. Her customers buy the bangles by matching them with their dress colors.
  
Her husband is A. M., a rickshaw driver. He generates an income for their family by providing transportation services to his passengers. Kosar has five children, all of whom are enrolled in a local school and get their education by attending different classes. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her embroidery and bangles business. With the loan, she will buy materials for embroidering, such as beads, colored thread, and clothes. She will also purchase bangles in larger quantities. That will enable her to fulfill the larger orders on time and to earn a good profit.
 
She is a very confident lady. She is very sure that after investing the loan money in her business, she will have more clients and, therefore, more income. She regularly uses Asasah, and this is her fifth loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit record and proved herself a responsible client.

loans.use: To buy embroidery materials and bangles

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Teodora E. is from the village of Villa M Tejero, Liloy, Zamboanga Del Norte. She is 54 years old, married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Teodora owns and operates a business venture in the food sector running a food stall. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling specialty food products in the local community. Teodora has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Teodora joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. As with her previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC which she has successfully repaid, this new loan of 10,000 PHP will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the fifth loan that Teodora has taken out from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in north-western Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Liloy-Villa M Tejero, Liloy Zamboanga Del Norte

loans.name: Myra

texts.en:
Myra S. is from the village of Bangahan, Pangantucan, Bukidnon. She is 36 years old and married with four school-age children. To make a living, Myra has a store selling vegetables  such as squash, chayote, cabbage. She also repackages soy sauce and vinegars in cellophane containers to sell retail. Myra has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Myra joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11000 PHP from HSPFI and is requesting a new loan of 14000 PHP to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Myra from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI: HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Dora

texts.es: La Sra. Dora tiene 21 años de edad, vive con su pareja (concubino) hace  dos años tienen dos hijos uno de dos añitos y otro de seis meses, viven en casa familiar, la Sra. Dora se dedica a la compra de carne de res por cantidad ya que  distribuye a las demás ventas de su zona. El crédito que se le otorgo a la clienta es para la compra de un Freezer. La Sra. Dora quedo muy feliz con la Institución por haberle brindado la oportunidad de seguir creciendo en su trabajo.
texts.en: Dora is 21.  She has lived with her partner for the past two years in their family house.  She has two children, one that is two and the other that is six months old.  Dora buys beef wholesale and distributes it to other sales locations in her area. The loan that she is requesting is to buy a freezer.  Dora is very happy with the institution for offering her the opportunity to continue allowing her business to grow.

loans.use: To buy a freezer

loans.name: Santa Lucia Group

texts.es:
Las mujeres del presente comité son del barrio Santa Elena  de Tobati que dista a 16 km de la oficina regional Caacupé.

Las señoras están muy satisfechas con el apoyo económico que les está brindando la Fundación Paraguaya, con este capital las señoras están aumentando sus pequeños negocios y así también sus ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
Las señoras  están en el ciclo Nº  2º con sus 14 integrantes 

Todas las integrantes del comité están muy agradecidas con la Fundación Paraguaya por el valioso apoyo que les brinda para poder mejorar sus condiciones financieras en la sociedad.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Lilian quien se dedica a la fabricación de flores artesanales y los vende en el centro de Caacupé.
Comenta que cuenta con muchos cliente ya que su producción es de buena calidad y buena terminación y los materiales que utiliza son también de buena calidad.
Desea seguir trabajando en el rubro ya que le ayuda mucho con los gastos de su familia y solicita el préstamo para la compra de materiales que utiliza para la elaboración de flores.
texts.en:
The women of this committee are from the Santa Elena neighborhood of  Tobati, which is 16 km from the Caacupé regional office.

The women are very satisfied with the financial support the Fundación Paraguaya is offering them. With this capital, they are growing their small businesses and their incomes as well, for a better quality of life.

They are in their 2nd cycle with their 14 members. 

All of the members of the committee are grateful to the Fundación Paraguaya for the valuable support it has offered them to inprove their financial condition in society. 

One of the members is Lilian, who makes artisanal flowers and sells them in the center of Caacupé. She remarks that that she has a lot of customers since her production is of good quality and good finishings. The materials she uses are also of good quality. 

She wants to keep working in this area since it really helps with the family expenses. She is asking for the loan to buy materials for making the flowers.

loans.use: To buy materials used to make flowers.

loans.name: Girasoles Group

texts.es:
El Banco comunal GIRASOLES, en su ciclo 12, está conformado por 11 clientes, 10 mujeres y 1 varón, la mayoría D. las socias pertenecen a la Zona D. Villa Salomé, que están ubicados ingresando por Alto Pampahasi. Las socias se dedican a la venta D. diversos productos como ser, venta D. abarrotes y víveres en tienda D. barrio, venta D. comida, venta D. verduras, venta D. cosméticos, venta D. ropa y libros, también se dedican a la costura D. polleras y tejidos D. ropa En la secuencia anterior todas cancelaron muy bien con pequeños problemas D. una socia los cuales fueron solucionados D. inmediato. 
La Sra. Felicidad  Es la líder del banco comunal, actualmente toma el cargo D. presidenta  se dedica a la costura D. polleras en su mismo domicilio y a la  venta D. otros productos en tienda D. barrio, cuenta con esta actividad hace 25 años, el préstamo será destinado a los pedidos D. víveres por mayor como fideos, azucar, arroz, galletas y refrescos. Casada con el señor Félix, que trabaja como mecánico en el mismo domicilio.
En su banco comunal se ha destacado como una persona responsable y puntual en sus pagos, también  dirige D. manera ordenada a su banca pidiendo a sus compañeras responsabilidad con el crédito y puntualidad en los pagos. Asimismo ha sido la presidenta durante varios ciclos.
texts.en:
The GIRASOLES (Sunflowers) community bank is entering its 12th loan cycle.  The group has 11 members: 10 women and 1 man.  Most of the members live in Villa Salomé, in Alto Pampahasi.  The group's members work selling a variety of products such as: groceries and foodstuffs in a neighborhood store, meals, vegetables, cosmetics, clothes and books.  They also work sewing 'polleras' (traditional skirts) and knitting clothes.

During the last loan cycle, all the members of this group paid their loans back on time.  There were a few small problems with one of the members but these were solved immediately.

Felicidad is the leader of this community bank.  She is currently the bank's president.  Her business is sewing 'polleras' (traditional skirts) in her own home.  She also sells products in a neighborhood store.  She has been in this business for 25 years.  Her loan will be used to order foodstuffs wholesale such as noodles, sugar, rice, cookies and soft drinks.  Felicidad is married to Félix who works from home as a mechanic.

Felicidad stands out as a responsible member of her community bank who is always punctual in making her loan repayments.  She leads her bank in an organized way, requesting her fellow members to be responsible with their loans and make their repayments on time.  She has been the bank's president for several loan cycles.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs to stock her neighborhood store

loans.name: Angel David

texts.es:
el señor Angel David S. O. tiene 26 años de edad, vive en la aldea El Obraje de la ciudad de Nacaome.  Angel es comerciante y se dedica a la ganaderia, venta de leche y leña. Se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 5 años.
el cria ganado y de este ganado saca leche para la venta.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de ganado y leña, las crias pequeñas las vende en Nacaome, San Lorenzo y Perpire.
el señor Angel tiene 1 hija y su mayor anhelo es ver crecer a su hija como toda una empresaria.
texts.en:
Mr Angel David S. O. is 26 and lives in the El Obraje hamlet of the Nacaome city. Angel is a merchant and works in livestock. He sells milk and firewood. He has been doing this for five years.
He raises livestock and sells their milk.
He will use this loan for the purchase of livestock and firewood. He sells the small animals in Nacaome, San Lorenzo and Perpire.
Mr Angel has one daughter and his greatest wish is to see her grow into a businesswoman.

loans.use: the purchase of a cow and firewood

loans.name: Samy

texts.en: Mrs. Samy N. is a widow with two children, one of whom is a construction worker while the other is still in school. She lives in Angk Ta Nu village, which is located in Takeo province. She makes a living by running a general store where she generates enough money to support her family. Her business is going well, and Mrs. Samy N. wants to expand it by securing a loan to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to sell to her customers

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is divorced with two children. She sells women's clothing at the Ivano-Frankivsk open market. Irina has been in this business for 15 years. She has two business locations and one employee. This business is the only source of income for Irina and her children.

Irina would like to borrow 10,000 UAH to increase the variety of clothing she stocks. She hopes to increase sales and make additional income. Irina's goal is to save enough money to help her children enroll in college.

loans.use: To increase her variety of stock.

loans.name: Saitia

texts.en:
Age:                            49
Marital Status:             Married
Children:                      3
Business:                    Selling plant seedlings and young crops to local farmers
Loan purpose:              To purchase agricultural equipment to sell
Weekly profit:              300 Samoan talas (WST)

Overall Social Metric Score:*               1.5 out of 3
Level of Education:                             1.75 out of 3
Level of Total Household Income:        1.6 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              1.7 out of 3

Saitia owns and operates a business venture selling plant seedlings and young crops to local farmers.  She has 3 years of experience in this business.    Saitia needs a loan of 2650 WST to purchase agricultural equipment to sell.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 300 WST) to improve and/or expand the business.

Saitia joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is Saitia's 4th loan with SPBD. 

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded South Pacific Business Development to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive, and self esteem.  Please join SPBD's lending team on Kiva to receive updates on SPBD.

*SPBD evaluates the living conditions of each of its borrowers.  Generally, a loan manager evaluates a variety of social metrics on a scale up to 3--the higher the number, the better off the person.  The metrics are averaged for the "overall social metric score."  For example, a 3 out of 3 on "level of education" would mean that the borrower has graduated from university.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural equipment to sell

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence needs a loan to pay school fees.  She is a forty-seven year-old, ambitious lady with four children, living in Fort Portal, Uganda.  She operates a retail shop and has been in business for three years, amidst the challenges of price fluctuations and high rent costs.  Inspite of these challengers, she wishes to become a wholesaler.

loans.use: Pay school fees

loans.name: Tabib

texts.ru:
Tabib S. 28 let, on jenat i imeyet odnoqo rebonka. On yavlyayetsya IDP personom , pereselenec iz Lachin regiona, seychas projivayet v qorode Baku vmeste so svoyey lubimoy semyoy.
Tabib uj 3 qoda kak zanimayetsya etim biznessom prodaji koncelyarskix tovarov( tetradi,ruchki,knigi i t.d). Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi uvelichit pomesheniye svoyeqo magazina dlya toqo chtobi razmestiti bolshe tovarov. Ranshe Tabib rabotal v takom magazine prodavcom seychas uje on imeyet svoy sobstvenniy magazin.
texts.en: Tabib S. is 28 years old.  He is married and has one child.   He is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person).  He is a refugee from the Lachin region who now lives in Baku with his beloved family.  Tabib has been selling office supplies for three years (notebooks, pens, books, etc.).  Now he needs 2000 AZN to increase the size of his shop so he can offer more goods.  Tabib used to work for a shop like this one, but now he owns his own shop.

loans.use: to increase the size of his shop

loans.name: Peter Njoroge

texts.en:
Peter Njoroge W. is 38 years, married to Catherine, and they are blessed with two children. He has had a dairy for eleven years with an income of 7,000 KES per month.

Peter has a good credit history with KADET ,and he is applying for his third loan of 40,000 KES. He has paid his previous loans well and on time. Peter would like to use this loan to buy another dairy cow. With the anticipated income, Peter will pay school fees for his children.

Peter hopes to grow his business and later buy a piece of land upon which to improve his farming.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Lupercia Geltrudis

texts.es:
Lupercia de 51 años, es una mujer muy emprendedora en su trabajo ya que hace 12 años empezo con su tienda vendiendo legumbre y poco a poco lo fue incrementando su capital de trabajo. 

Ha tenido muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso ella labora desde las 6H00am a 10H00pm atendiendo la tienda en ocasiones tambien cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos. Con el prestamo quiere comprar legumbres, arroz, azucar a por mayor para surtir su negocio e incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Lupercia is 51 years old.  She is a very enterprising woman in her work.  Twelve years ago she set up a store selling vegetables and she has gradually increased her working capital.

Lupercia has a lot of aspirations for her business and, for that reason, she serves in her store from 6.00am to 10.00pm.  Sometimes she also has the support of her children.  Lupercia would like to use this loan to buy vegetables, rice and sugar wholesale to stock her business and increase her sales.

loans.use: to buy rice, vegetables and sugar

loans.name: Floriano

texts.en: Floriano is 50 years of age and married with three adult-aged children. He is a farmer working in the Philippines. Floriano's wife is a housekeeper. Floriano is asking for a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy inputs needed for their field such as fertilizers and seeds of corn. He will also use the loan to pay for the laborers who will do the planting on his farm. In the future, Floriano hopes that his business will earn higher income from the yields.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds and to pay the laborers

loans.name: Arturo

texts.en:
Arturo is 56 years old and married with two adult-aged children. Arturo owns a motorcycle that he uses as a source of income. He is in the motorcycle transport business. With the business, he generates PHP 4,000 a month.

Arturo is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy materials for the maintenance of the motorcycle such as tires.

In the future, Arturo hopes that his transportation business will improve further to sustain the needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy tires for his motorcycle

loans.name: Karina

texts.es: La señora Karina  se dedica  al comercio de ropa desde hace cuatro años, tiene su puesto en el mercado la cancha, vive en domicilio en alquiler en compañía de su esposo y sus tres hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar,  solicita el crédito para la compra de mas mercadería  ya que subieron los precios de la ropa  y necesita mas capital para la compra de mercadería de temporada ropa de invierno ya que esta acercándose el frio, y ella varia su mercadería según a la temporada, es un apersona muy amable y trabajadora agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Sra. Karina has been a clothing merchant for four years. She has a vending post at La Cancha Market. Karina lives in a rented house with her husband and their three children who are in school.

She is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise. Since clothing prices have increased, she needs more capital to buy winter clothing as the temperature gets colder. Karina varies her merchandise according to the season. She is a friendly and hardworking person and expresses her appreciation to Emprender for the support that has been provided.

loans.use: to purchase winter clothing.

loans.name: Kuña Pora Group

texts.es:
El comité se denomina “Kuña Pora”. Se encuentran en el Séptimo Ciclo, con 11  integrantes. Es un grupo que se destaca en el barrio por ser muy unido, solidario  y responsable. Cada integrante realiza las actividades de forma responsable y solidaria. Las mismas poseen un gran espíritu emprendedor, ya que están al día con las cuotas y pretenden terminar esta etapa con muy buen cumplimiento de responsabilidad con la institución. 
La Sra. Carmen tiene una despensa, por medio de este trabajo puede proveer a su familia de los medios necesarios para tener una vida digna y decorosa. Se considera una mujer muy responsable y por sobre todo muy trabajadora.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de mas mercaderías como ser comestibles, enlatados y demás para el abastecimiento de su negocio. Tiene fe, de que por medio de este crédito podra atraer mas clientes y así agrandar un poco el margen de sus ingresos.
texts.en:
This committee is called “Kuña Pora”.  There are 11 members in this group and they are currently in their seventh loan cycle.  This is a group which is noted in their neighborhood for being very united, supportive and responsible.  Every member of the group carries out their business activities responsibly and supportively.  They all have a great entrepreneurial spirit.  They are up to date with their repayments and plan to finish this stage having  fulfilled their responsibilities to the institution admirably.

Carmen has a grocery store and, through her work, she is able to provide her family with the resources they need to lead a decent and respectable life.  She considers herself to be a very responsible and, above all, a very hard-working woman.

Carmen is requesting this loan to buy more merchandise such as food, canned goods, etc. so that she can stock her business.  She trusts that, through this loan, she will be able to attract more customers and thereby increase her profit margin a little.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as food, drinks, etc. with which to stock her store

loans.name: Betsy Margarita

texts.es:
Betsy de 37 años, vive en una zona urbana en las Orquídeas (llamado así porque en su originalidad había muchas flores orquídeas) de Guayaquil. Su esposo trabaja en un taller automotriz y tienen hijos de 23, 24 y 18 años.. ella se dedica en su tienda de víveres.

El negocio lo tiene desde que se caso y con eso ha mantenido a su familia, labora de 6H00 am a 111H00 pm todos los días. Con la ayuda del préstamo quiere compras mas víveres como arroz cola aceites a por mayor para vender en su tienda y mejorar sus ingresos. En un futuro se quiere comprar un carro.
texts.en:
Betsy is 37 years old and lives in an urban area of Guayaquil called "las Orquídeas" ["The Orchids"] (so named because there were originally many orchid flowers there). Her husband works in an automobile workshop and they have children who are 24, 23, and 18 years old. Betsy works in her own grocery store.

She has had this business since she got married, and with it, has been able to take care of her family. She works from 6:00 a.m. until 11:00 p.m. every day. With the help of this loan, she will buy more foodstuffs like rice, soft drinks, and oil. She will purchase wholesale to sell in her store and improve her earnings. In the future, she would like to buy a car.

loans.use: to buy groceries for her store, such as candies, drinks, and canned goods

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Teodora is 56 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 6 children. 
Teodora has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 30 years. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy snacks, breads & biscuits.
Teodora has been a member of HSPFI since 2005. In the future, Teodora hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy snacks, breads & biscuits

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en: Maribel is 43, married with four children, and works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional inventory. She has borrowed and repaid 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from selling cosmetics. Maribel aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Amida

texts.en:
Amida is 30 years old and married with three children, all of whom are in school. She has a business selling bread and beans in Kator Branch in South Sudan. She has been in this business for three years. 

Amida requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hopes of expanding her business. She will use the extra income to pay for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase more breads and beans to sell.

loans.name: Adjouavi Nina

texts.fr:
Nina est mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Lesquels enfants sont tous scolarisés. Son époux travaille dans une entreprise de la place. Ensemble, le couple arrive à faire face aux charges du ménage. 
Nina est une commerçante. Elle commercialise des poissons et viandes congelés depuis 11 ans. Son fonds de commerce est installé à son domicile. Elle emploie une jeune fille qui l'aide dans ses activités. Ses produits sont vendus aux restauratrices et aux ménages de sa zone et de ses environs. Elle fait ses approvisionnements au fur et à mesure de l'écoulement de ses produits, dans une société de vente des produits congelés de la place. 
Nina a sollicité et obtenu un micro crédit à FINADEV afin de s'approvisionner en quantité suffisante pour pouvoir combler les attentes de sa clientèle. Le revenu supplémentaire produit par ce crédit permettra de d'accroître sa participation financière au foyer et de contribuer ainsi à l’épanouissement de ses progénitures et de ses proches.
texts.en:
Nina is married and the mother of three children who are all enrolled in school. Her husband works in a local enterprise. Together the couple are managing to cover their household expenses. 

Nina is a businesswoman. She has been selling frozen fish and meat for 11 years. Her sales are made out of her home. She employs a young woman who helps her in her business. Her products are sold to owners of restaurants and to housewives in her area and around her home. She buys her goods from a local business selling frozen foods, little by little as she sells her stock. 

Nina requested and has been granted a small loan from FINADEV in order to stock up on a sufficient quantity of goods to be able to satisfy the demand of her clientele. The supplementary revenue produced by this loan will permit her to make a greater financial contribution to her household and thus contribute to the well-being of her children and those near and dear to her.

loans.use: to buy 20 cartons of frozen fish.

loans.name: Kamel

texts.en: Kamel is 53 years old and married with four children in Iraq. He has owned a workshop since 2008, where he sells spare parts for cars. He has good experience in this field and a deep understanding of local consumers. He also has a good reputation and is well known in his area. He decided to apply for $2,200 loan in order to renovate the ceiling of his workshop. Kamel is aiming to gain more profits so he has the opportunity to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to renovate the ceiling of his workshop.

loans.name: Francisca Matilde

texts.es: Francisca Matilde tiene 45 años,  su actividad es la venta de nacatamales y leña. El tiempo que tiene realizando este negocio es de 2 años. Tiene 2 hijos menores de edad que están bajo su cargo. Ella solicita este crédito con el objetivo de comprar cerdos y leña, para posteriormente realizar los nacatamales. Ella siempre ha sido una persona luchadora y que disfruta de realizar este trabajo constantemente.
texts.en: Francisca Matilde, 45, has been selling nacatamales (typical steamed meat wrapped in banana leaves or corn husks) and firewood.  Francisca Matilde has 2 young children.  She is requesting a loan to buy pigs and firewood so that she can make the nacatamales.  She is a born fighter who always enjoys her work.

loans.use: To buy pigs and firewood

loans.name: Baktigul's Group

texts.en:
Baktigul is the leader of this group. She is 45 and is raising four children: two daughters and two sons. Her husband works in Russia; each month he transfers money to meet the family's needs. The older daughter is married and lives separately with her family, the older son works in Russia, and the other children study at school. In order to earn money Baktigul cultivates agricultural products. She also takes orders and sews Kyrgyz national pillows and blankets. She earns an additional 3000 KGS for the family budget by doing the sewing work. With money received from the loan she wants to purchase more fabrics and materials which are needed for sewing. In the near future Baktigul plans to gather the harvest; with the profits gained she will start house repairs.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics and materials

loans.name: Manuel

texts.pt:
Nasceu na Provincia Tete, norte  de Moçambique, casado e pai de 5 filhos dos quais todos ainda frenquentam a Escola. Fez 5ª classe e naõ continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem. 
Saiu da sua terra natal Tete para Maputo a procura de melhores condições de vida, é comerciante e pensionista no Ministerio da defesa ha mais de 10 anos, tem uma  pensão de 8.500.00mt por mês e um rendimento de cerca de 5.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
Já teve emprestimos em outros bancos (BARCLAYS) no valor de 28.000.00mt, o qual conseguiu pagar sem nenhumas dificuldades. Conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de amigos que tambem saõ clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu setimo emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 25.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar produtos (amendoim, peixe, arroz,sumos,  e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. Os primeiros emprestimos foram de:13.274.00mt, 4.200.00mt,  19.762.00mt, 5.000.00mt, 23.649.00mt e 15.000.00mt para o negocio.
 No futuro pretende ampliar a sua actividade comercial e adquirir uma viatura para facilitar o escoamento dos produtos assim irá solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Manuel was born in the province of Tete in northern Mozambique. He is married and has five children, all of whom attend school. He went to school through the fifth grade but had to drop out because of financial difficulties. He lives with his family in a home they own, and isn't financially responsible for anyone else.
He left Tete for Maputo in search of a better life. He has a business and has been retired from the Ministry of Defense for more than 10 years. He has a pension of 8,500 meticals a month and earns 5,000 meticals a month from his business. He uses his earnings to cover household expenses and is able to save some in his bank account.
He had a loan from another bank (Barclays) in the amount of 28,000 meticals, which he paid off without any problems. He learned about Hluvuku from friends who are also clients of the institution. This is his seventh loan with Hluvuku, in the amount of 25,000 meticals, which he will use to buy products (peanuts, fish, rice, juices, etc.) to increase the quantity of merchandise he carries. His other loans were in the amounts of 13,274, 4,200, 19,762, 5,000, 23,649, and 15,000 meticals, which he also invested in his business.
He hopes to ask for further loans from Hluvuku to expand his business and acquire a vehicle to make transporting his merchandise easier.

loans.use: to buy products (peanuts, fish, rice, juices, etc.).

loans.name: Maria Bernarda

texts.es:
Doña María Bernarda tiene 47 años y vive en la aldea de Naco. Ella es madre soltera  y tiene dos hijas de 22 y 24 años de edad, las cuales aportan económicamente al hogar. La familia de ella es muy unida. 
La señora María Bernarda se convirtió en microempresaria por motivos económicos. Tenía que mantener a su familia y cubrir los gastos de la educación de sus hijas. Anteriormente, Doña María Bernarda se dedicaba a la venta de novedades pero sus ventas eran muy bajas. Viendo, que en Naco no había comedores, ella decidió establecer su propio comedor. 

Comedor León ya está en su quinto año sirviendo a los ciudadanos de Naco.  Empezó vendiendo cocteles de fruta, jugos naturales, licuados y refrescos de su casa.  Fue creciendo la demanda y Doña María Bernarda sacó tres créditos para construir el comedor junto a su casa.  Luego se amplió el menú y empezó a servir una pequeña variedad de comidas. La señora trabaja todos los días, con la meta de siempre atender bien a la gente y servir buena comida. 

Con este préstamo, la señora María Bernarda va a abastecer su comedor con la compra de productos que ella utiliza diariamente en hacer las comidas y  bebidas. Quiere que su comedor siga siendo un éxito y el comedor preferido de la gente de Naco.
texts.en:
María Bernarda, age 47, lives in the Naco village.  She is a single mother, and she has two daughters, ages 22 and 24.  They contribute to the household finances.  Her family is very united.

María Bernarda became a small businesswoman for financial reasons.  She had to support her family and cover her daughters’ educational expenses.  María Bernarda previously sold novelties, but her sales were very low.  Seeing that there were no restaurants in Naco, she decided to establish her own restaurant.

The León Restaurant is now in its fifth year of serving the citizens of Naco.  She started selling fruit cocktails, natural juices, milk shakes, and soft drinks at her house.  The demand was growing, and María Bernarda took three loans in order to build the restaurant next to her house.  She works every day with the goal of always tending to her customers well and serving them good food.

María Bernarda will use this loan to stock her restaurant with the purchase of products that she uses every day in making the food and the drinks.  She wants her restaurant to continue being a success and to continue being the restaurant that the people of Naco prefer.

loans.use: to buy products that she uses to make food and drinks.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco WAYNA CCAPAC; Este banco pertenece a la provincia de Urubamba en el Distrito de Urubamba del Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Isabel; la socia tiene 30 años de edad, la socia es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos de 10, 8, 3 años de edad, la socia tiene en casa en el primer piso su tienda de abarrotes que ella mismo administra y atiende, la socia en esta ocasión desea invertir el credito en la compra de productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azucar, leche, harinas, fideos, aceite, mazamorras entre otros productos que salen a diario, la socia tambien en esta ocasion desea invertir el prestamo en la compra de panetones por cajas, ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y desea dar la mejor calidad de vida a sus pequeños niños, la socia a futuro desearia ampliar su negocio y poner una heladeria anexa a su tienda. La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de productos de primera necesidad como arros, azucar, fideos, aceite, leche, harinas y panetones.

La socia se compromete a cumplir con los pagos en las cuotas establecidad.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank WAYNA CCAPAC, which belongs to the province of Urubamba in the Urubamba District in the department of Cusco.

Mrs. Isabel, 30, has a common-law husband and three children ages 10, 8 and 3.  On the first floor of her home she has a grocery store that she runs and manages.  She is requesting a loan to buy essential goods such as rice, sugar, milk, flour, pasta, oil, boiled corn and other daily consumption items.  She also wants to buy boxes of panettone.  She is a very hard worker who wants to provide the best she can for her small children.  In the future she would like to expand her business and put up an ice cream shop next to her store.  

She is committed to paying back the loan on time.

loans.use: To buy essential goods for her store.

loans.name: Njete Group

texts.en:
Justus is the facilitator of the Njete group. Justus and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Justus takes care of 16 children at home. He joined One Acre Fund to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds. In the recent 2011 season, Justus had an excellent maize yield harvesting 13 bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Justus was only able to harvest three bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Justus and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, Justus will educate his children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Njete group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

In the photograph above, Justus is pictured with his group members and the field officer appears on the far left.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Akmal

texts.ru: Акмал проживает в городе Конибодом. Возраст, 58 лет. Женат. Имеет четверых детей. Акмал вместе с детьми занимается растениеводством. Этим видом деятельности занимается тридцать лет. Кредит берет для приобретения в аренду участка земли и посева озимой пшеницы.
texts.en: Akmal lives in Konibodom. He is 58 years old, married and has four children. Akmal grows produce with all four of his children and has been a farmer for the last 30 years. He is taking out this loan to rent a plot of land for growing winter wheat.

loans.use: to rent a plot of land and plant winter wheat

loans.name: Nyantur

texts.en:
Nyantur is 32 years old, married, and has three children. All of them attend school. She has a food stall in Bor, South Sudan, which she has been running for eight years. 

Nyantur is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beans and onions. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase beans and onions to sell.

loans.name: Roth

texts.en:
Mrs. Roth, age 49 years-old, is engaged in doing farming and making baskets to generate her income. She is a widow living with five children in Prey Chor district. At present, three of her children are already married and live independently while the other two are still dependent on her. 

Roth is seeking for her second loan from Kiva in order to purchase a stock of rice from the villagers who recently have just finished harvesting their rice. She will keep it as daily food within the year. She is very thankful for the funds given to her to solve her living needs.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of rice.

loans.name: Santo Domingo Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama santo Domingo  y se integra de tres señoras quien cada una  se dedica a su respectiva  actividad.
 
Quien se le tomo la entrevista es Araley, ella  vive en unión libre con el señor  Leonardo y con quien procreo dos hijos que aun están  a su responsabilidad.

    Ella solito el préstamo para  invertirlo en la compra  de   ingredientes como son: aceite, carne, pasas, chile ancho, maíz para la elaboración de tamales, ella lleva con éste negocio un año seis meses y comenta que le va bien y que con ello ha mejorado mucho sus  ingresos  en su hogar.

        Inicio por si sola para poyara su esposo con los ingresos de la casa y así sacar adelante a sus  hijos pequeños que a un dependen d ella.
 
        Lo que desea del préstamo es poder  seguir trabajando para así  darle lo mas necesario  a  su familia que es lo más importante para ella.
 Las personas que integran en el grupo  son:   la señora Yolanda  quien invertirá en la compra de ingredientes para la elaboración de tacos y  Karla yesenia  invertirá en la compra de  ingredientes para la elaboración de comidas.
texts.en:
The group is called Santo Domingo and it is made up of three ladies who each do their own job.

Araley was interviewed. She lives with her partner Señor Leonardo, with whom she has two children who are still dependent on them.

She is requesting the loan to invest in the purchase of ingredients such as: oil, meat, raisins, ancho chiles and corn to make tamales. She has been working in this business for a year and a half and she says that it is going very well for her and that it has helped her to improve the family income.

She began by herself in order to help her husband with the household income, thus getting her small, dependent children ahead in life.

Through the loan, she would like to be able to continue working to provide her family with what they need, which is the most important thing for her.

The people who make up the group are: Señora Yolanda who will invest in the purchase of ingredients to make tacos and Karla Yesenia will invest in the purchase of ingredients to make meals.

loans.use: to pay for ingredients to make tamales.

loans.name: Valen

texts.en:
Valen is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Valen is 36 years old and both of her children are in school.

Valen has a frozen food retailing business in the Philippines. Valen requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more frozen foods to sell.

Valen has been in this business for five years. In the future, Valen would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en: Every regional center within Moldova has a specific day when everyone goes to the outdoor market. Traditionally that day is not Monday; an old superstition in Moldova is that if one receives money on Monday one will not make any additional money for the rest of that year.  In Ungheni, a regional center on the Romanian border, the market day is Thursday. On Thursday the merchants have no time off.  From 8:00 - 5:00 they are working non-stop, on their feet without a break, and set up starts even earlier.   Anna B. is one of those merchants, and has been working at her booth for over 5 years. Ana is 56 years old with a husband and a daughter. Her daughter has a nearby stall selling fabrics and yarn and they help each other out, running back and forth through the market to watch over both booths while one of them has a break from the very hectic day.  At Anna\'s stall she sells mostly Moldovan made cloths, but has recently started to sell linens, bedclothes, and blankets which come from a local vendor.  These products are very popular and Anna would like to concentrate on only selling this merchandise. She would like a loan to purchase a larger shipment of these kinds of goods.

loans.use: To purchase a larger shipment of linens, bedclothes, and blankets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Nelly Wambui Kamita intends to buy bananas, potatoes, carrots and other vegetables

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
"I'm asking for your support in building a fence and waterproofing my home. In the rainy season, water comes in through the roof and forms puddles, making it very damp and making my children susceptible to respiratory illness."

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

“Estoy solicitando su apoyo para la construcción de una barda y también para la impermeabilización, en temporada de lluvias el agua entra a mi casa por el techo ya que se forma una laguna y se trasmina el agua debido a eso hay mucha humedad y eso provoca enfermedades respiratorias para mis hijos”. Solicito $ 1,000.00 dlls para la construcción de una barda y la impermeabilización.

loans.use: Building a fence and waterproofing the home

loans.name: Kainat

texts.en: This 26-year-old man has his own orchard. He is single and lives in the Salyan region, Yenikand village. He has 2 years experience in this business. Kainat is applying for a loan of $375 to buy  orchard medicines for improving his orchard.

loans.use: To buy orchard medicines

loans.name: Imila Mamerta

texts.en:
Dona Imila always had an innate talent for sewing and making clothes. This ability resulted in her opening her small artisanal workshop, which initially served only a small circle of friends. However, her unique designs and excellent finishing touches have caused her work to be in the highest demand. She has two children; the oldest girl attends elementary school and, as a good mother and excellent seamstress, Imila has taught her to love her mother's line of work. This has resulted in her girl becoming her best assistant.

Imila's small shop and services are more sought after each day, in large measure because of her philosophy of continuous self improvement. Now, thanks to numerous recommendations, she has been asked to design and manufacture a line of uniforms for a local school. She is requesting a loan of $175 to buy raw materials and tools. Together we can make Imila's talent and initiative result in a better life for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Imila siempre tuvo un talento innato para la confección de prendas de vestir y a consecuencia de este don ella tomó la decisión de abrir su pequeño taller de confección artesanal y sólo para un grupo de amigos; sus diseños únicos y sus excelentes acabados han hecho de sus confecciones las más requeridas ella tiene dos hijos, la mayor estudia en la escuela primaria, y como buena madre y excelente costurera cada día le inculca el amor por este digno oficio y en poco tiempo se ha convertido en su mejor ayudante;su pequeño taller y sus servicios son cada día más cotizados y esto se debe a su mentalidad de mejoramiento continuo. Ahora y gracias al sin número de recomendaciones le han encomendado la fabricación y deseño de uniformes de una escuela primaria de su localidad y para implementar su taller ella solicita un préstamo de 175 dólares con el compromiso de retornarlos en un lapso de 4 meses para poder adquirir más insumos y herramientas. Juntos podremos hacer que esta iniciativa y talento puedan contribuir a incrementar la calidad de vida de su familia.

loans.use: Imila will use this loan to equip her workshop with the necessary raw materials and tools to provide her clients with better service.

loans.name: Amsah

texts.en: Amsah is 42 years old and married. She sells vegetables to people in her village, earning $15 a day. Previously, she sold prepared food, but that business has been declined, so she would like to concentrate on fresh vegetable sales. Her husband is a laborer who earns $7 per week. She would like a loan of $75 (IDR 500,000) to accomplish her goal and is willing to repay this loan within 12 months.

loans.use: To expand sales in her store

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: "LAPO has lifted my business," says Mrs. Margaret A., who sells cooked food and drinks.  She is a LAPO member and she needs a loan of $275 to buy foodstuffs for cooking food to sell.  She is 48 years old, married and has 8 children.  She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for cooking food to sell

loans.name: Kimseng

texts.en:
Mr. Kimseng H. (age 36) and his wife, Mrs. Um Sam Ath have been married since 1993. They have two daughters who are studying in the local school. Kimseng and his family live along National Road number five about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh. He has been growing rice since 1993. His wife sells snacks in a Primary school in the village.

He has borrowed money from MAXIMA two times already. Now he is requesting another loan in the amount of $300. He will use this money for purchasing rice seed, fertilizer, pesticide, and to pay for a plowing fee.

loans.use: To buy rice seed, fertilizer, pesticide, and pay for a plowing fee.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in raw materials

loans.name: Joesph

texts.en:
Joseph is 26 years old and is employed by a large maize mealing factory, which allows him to rent their equipment and conduct his own business outside of regular factory hours.

Joseph is married with a nine-month old boy and also supports his eight-year old brother. Joseph’s wife sells charcoal from their family home and some of the loan amount will help to fund her business.

His dream is to buy a plot of land on which to build his family home and eventually have a small poultry farm and wholesale business.

loans.use: Joseph is looking for a loan to buy more maize to meal for his retail maize mealing business.

loans.name: Georgina

texts.es:
Georgina has been selling brand-name cosmetics which are popular in her country for a long time now. She has decided to take up this work after observing the economic struggle of her family during periods of absence of her husband, who makes a living as a musician, touring throughout the country with his band. Her involvement in this business has been very positive, and her knowledge of beauty products has increased. Now Georgina is hoping for a loan of $300 to increase her investment capital in order to offer a greater quantity of products, and also offer cosmetic advice out of her home.

Translated from Spanish by Maggie Messerschmidt, Kiva volunteer.

Georgina, desD. hace mucho se dedica a la venta D. cosméticos D. las marcas más reconocidas D. su país; decidió llevar a esta labor al observar la escasez económica D. su familia durante los períodos D. ausencia artística D. su querido esposo, ya que se dedica a llevar alegría con su grupo D. música a los diferente pueblos D. su país.Su incursión en este negocio a sido muy positiva y han incrementado sus conocimientos D. belleza, ahora tiene el propósito D. incrementar su capital D. inversión para ofertar mayor cantidad D. productos y también para brindar asesoría cosmética en la comodidad D. su hogar.

loans.use: Capital for increasing the supply of cosmetic products.

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Mrs. Sopheab C. and her husband, Mr. Phally Heng, were married in 2003 and have two children; one son and one daughter. The couple lives with their parents, brothers, and sisters. The family lives on an island on the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Sopheab has been a weaver for over ten years. It’s a skill she learned from her parents. Her husband is a silk weaver, as well. He has been in this business for seven years. The couple sells their finished product to the middle man in the village who will takes them to Phnom Penh to sell.

Mrs. Sopheab is requesting a loan of US$300 to purchase silk material for weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving

loans.name: Lucho Luciano

texts.es:
Lucho works as an electrician and also teaches guitar. He lives in a house located in the zone of Sopocachi in the city of La Paz. In order to build his business as an electrician, he needs to purchase more tools. This is the 10th loan he has received from Impro. His hard work and efforts qualify him to receive this credit. He would like to have his own shop one day.

Lucho realiza trabajos de electricista y también es instructor de guitarra. Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Sopocachi de la ciudad de La Paz. Aún no cuenta con las herramientas necesarias para poder desarrollar su primera ocupación, por lo que necesita dinero para comprar las herramientas de electricidad. Es la décima segunda vez que solicita un crédito en Impro. Su trabajo y las ganas de superación de Lucho le permiten acceder a este crédito, ya que su objetivo es ser propietario de un taller.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: To invest in his business as an electrician, he needs to buy more tools.

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mr. Mao H., 61, and his wife were married in 1981 and have five children: four sons and one daughter. Two of their children are fishermen, one raises cows, one is a garment factory worker, and the last one is in school. The family lives along National Road Number Five about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mr. Mao has been in the business of selling cows for over 10 years. He buys them from villagers and from the nearby province to raise for reselling to abattoirs and farmers. His wife has been a fruit seller for two years. Mr. Mao is requesting a loan of $1200 to purchase additional cows to raise for resale.

loans.use: To purchase cows to raise for resale.

loans.name: Amadou Oury

texts.fr:
Amadou Oury S. is a young shopkeeper who retails basic need goods. He is able to look after his family thanks to his small business. He is asking for this loan to augment his stock of merchandise in preparation for the month of Ramadan, during which demand will increase.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Amadou Oury S. est un jeune commerçant qui vend au détail des denrées de premiéres nécessité. Il entretient sa famille grâce à son petit commerce. Il sollicite ce prêt pour renforcer son stock de marchandises en perspective du mois de Ramadan durant lequel la demande va augmenter.

loans.use: To increase stock

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mom D. has business renting rooms in her house to earn a living and is able to make $5 of profit per day. Her husband, Ngen Thorn, pictured above, drives a three-wheeled-vehicle called a "Tuk Tuk". He normally serves guests of the hotel and restaurants who need transportation or want to go on a city tour. Her husband Ngen Thon knows  a little English and that is why he can guide visitors around the city. On average, he makes $15 in revenue per day. People prefer to get a ride in a Tuk Tuk instead of a simple motorbike because it more relaxing and enjoyable.

Mrs. Mom would like a loan to replace an old and unreliable Tuk Tuk for her husband. The new Tuk Tuk will be more attractive to passengers.

loans.use: To purchase a new Tuk Tuk for her husband.

loans.name: Francois

texts.en:
Greetings from Francois in Kigali, Rwanda! Francois is 47 years old, married with 6 children. Francois is a retail shop owner, who sells items like juice, bars of soap, clothes for children, shoes, bottles of water, toilet paper, powder, etc.

Francois is looking for a loan worth 519,175 Frws to increase his stock. The loan repayment term is 8 months.

loans.use: To increase his inventory

loans.name: Nazem

texts.en:
Nazem is a 45 year-old man. He lives with his wife and three children in a small village near the city of Nabatieh. 

Nazem is a cab driver, but his taxi is currently in serious disrepair. As a result of the taxi’s frequent break-downs, he is struggling to support his family. 

Nazem has requested a loan of $1000 USD from Al Majmoua in order to cover the costs of repair and maintenance. This is the first time that Nazem has requested a loan from Al Majmoua.

loans.use: To repair his broken taxicab

loans.name: Mwavu Teyebaka Group

texts.en:
Polline O., age 45, is the leader of the Mwavu Teyebaka women’s group on Lumumba Avenue in Kampala. She is married with six children and cares for three orphans. She has a restaurant called Kalo Eating Place in the same location where her group meets, and she has a good clientele. Come lunch time, the place is filled with people from offices and all over town who want to have something traditional to fill their stomachs.  

Polline has been taking loans to help her to maintain her restaurant each day, such as buying food ,sauce, plates, cups, and so much more. To date, she is so happy about it. She now needs another loan to help to buy more food from the villages where the prices are cheaper.

loans.use: To buy food for her restaurant

loans.name: Virgen De Fatima Group

texts.en:
The town of La Merced, where members of the "Virgen D. Fatima" Village Bank live and meet, is located in southern Churcampo Province in Huancavelica Department. The area is located at about 2,300 meters above sea level and has a hot, dry climate. The main economic activity is raising livestock, mostly goats and cows. There is little commerce in the area.

Vilma and Teresa are two members of the "Virgen D. Fatima" Village Bank. Vilma is married with five children between the ages of 8 and 23. Vilma buys and sells fruit, and has been working at this since she was 15 years old. She plans to use most of her loan of 400 soles to invest in her business, and the rest will go towards her children’s education. Her goals for the future are for her family to get ahead and for her business to continue to grow. She likes being able to save money with FINCA, and plans to use her savings to help her children and to invest in her business.

Teresa is a widow and has five children between the ages of 19 and 34. She sells "chancaca" (brown sugarloaf maD. from sugarcane), and also buys and sells fruit from time to time. With her loan of 200 soles, Teresa plans to start buying small animals like guinea pigs and goats. She would like for her children to join FINCA too, someday, so that they could start saving money, as she has. She plans to use her savings as an emergency fund in case she has any unexpected needs in the future

loans.use: Pay children's school fees, buy guinea pigs and goats, etc.

loans.name: Anak Agung Adnyani

texts.id:
Di periode kedua dari pinjaman Yayasan DINARI dipakai untuk menambah modal usaha warungnya.Untuk mencukupi keperluan hidupnya saat ini Anak Agung Adyani bersama keluarganya hanya mengandalkan usaha warungnya.Suaminya adalah seorang karyawan sebuah delaer sepeda motor.penghasilan tetap suami terkadang tidak mencukupi keperluan hidupnya. Baran-barang yang disediakan oleh Anak Agung Adyani seperti barang keperluan sehari-hari yang diperlukan oleh masyarakat sekitar seperti,makanan ringan, aneka macam ringan,rujak dan bakso. Dengan modal awal yang tidak terlalu banyak anak Agung Adyani tetap tekun dalam menjalankan usaha warungnya.

Dana yang didapatnya dipakai sepenuhnya untuk menambah dan melengkapi aneka macam barang dagannya.Dalam satu minggu Anak Agung berbelanja  dua sampai tiga kali melengkapi barang daganganya yang sudah berkurang.untuk berbelanja AnakAgung adnyani  pergi kepasar  Negara dengan sepeda motornya yang berjarak kurang lebih 5 km.Denagn keuntungan bersih sekitar Rp.20.000,- sampai rp. 50.000,- Anak Agung adnayani dapat menambah pendapatan dalam keluarganya bersama kedua putrinya yang masih kecil-kecil selain dari pendapatan suaminya .
texts.en:
Anak Agung Adyani is a housewife. Her husband is working in a local motorcycle dealership. To support the family's economy, she opens a small store selling a daily necessities such as snacks and traditional dishes. She is applying for a second term loan program with DINARI foundation.

She is planning to use the loan money to add the working capital so she can have more stuffs to sell in her store. She goes to market twice to three times a week to buy the merchandise. She rides her motor cycle to go to the Negara market located 5 KM from her house. She can earn a net profit of IDR 20 to 50 thousand per day (around USD 2 to 5). With this she can help make a living for their family and also their two daughters.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To add working capital

loans.name: Uktam

texts.en:
N. Uktam is 41 years old and the father of four children. Uktam is a villager in Istaravshan in Northern Tajikistan. He and his wife are farmers who own a hectare of land to cultivate potato and rice. At the same time Uktam raises cattle. 

Uktam is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and seeds for planting. Uktam’s children are all studying at school. He hopes he can continue to provide for them so they will be able to receive an adequate education.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Clara

texts.en: Clara is 56 years old and married with 8 children. She is a tailor and she also sells clothes and tailoring materials. She needs the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more clothes and tailoring materials to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and tailoring materials to sell

loans.name: Ret

texts.en:
Ret R., 37, is a villager living in a rural area of Siem Reap Province. She is married with four children who are students. She currently plants potato and cucumber crops, which she sells to buyers at a high price three months after she begins planting them. To help support more food for the family, her husband sells firewood.

She is requesting her second loan. She used the first loan to buy a motorbike so she can use it to deliver her produce to sell at the market. She plans to use this second loan to buy firewood in bulk to sell and to buy more fertilizer for her crop growing.

loans.use: To buy firewood and fertilizer

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Mrs. Marissa F. is 28 years old and married with 1 child. She lives in Nazareth, Buenavista, Pagadian City. In order to earn a living she takes in and raises pigs. In order to earn more money, she decided to sell hogs to the market. 

Through Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC), she obtained the capital to purchase her original piglets and feed. Now, she is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy additional feed and expand her hog-raising business. Someday, she wants to build a concrete pig pen to provide more sanitary conditions. She hopes and prays that her business will grow and will benefit her family, supplementing her husband's income. She dreams of a good education for her child.

loans.use: expand her hog-raising business

loans.name: Sara

texts.es:
Es casada y tiene 5 hijos.

El negocio comenzo por la necesidad de apoyar en el hogar ya que su esposo se quedo sin empleo en lo que encontraba otro, ella tuvo que empezar a buscar trabajo, pero decidio que vender en casa seria buena idea y asi  no descuidaria a su familia.

el negocio de las bolsas para dama, le parecio rentable, y aparte vende algo de cosmeticos, ahora  con la moda que pasa muy rapido desea, comprar nuevas bolsas, mas novedosas y asi tener mayor clientela y la que tiene ofrecerle lo mas reciente. 

ella hace demostraciones y la mayoria a quien vende son familares y vecinos.

va comenzando con su negocio, y ha tendio buenas ventas, con la compra de buena mercancia es seguro su exito.
texts.en:
Sara is married and has five children. She started her business out of the necessity to support the household when her husband lost his job and was looking for a new one. She needed to start looking for work, but she decided that doing sales from her house was a better idea, and then she wouldn't neglect her family. She thought selling ladies' handbags would be profitable, and she also sells cosmetics. Since the styles change so quickly, she wants to buy new, more fashionable handbags so she can win more customers and offer them the very latest. She does shows, and most of her products are bought by relatives and neighbors. She's just starting her business and sales have been good. She's sure she'll be successful if she buys quality merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY GOODS

loans.name: Yaa's Group

texts.en:
Yaa, 40 years old, is married and has five children: four sons and a daughter. She says all of her children are currently in junior high and primary schools. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a a farming and trading community near Dormaa, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region. Her husband is a commercial driver.

Yaa is an egg trader. She procures crates of eggs from poultry farms in her community and nearby communities at affordable prices and sells these in the local market. She also travels to other towns to sell. Some of her wares are distributed to local retailers and beverage sellers. 

She has been in business for four years and would like to obtain a loan to procure crates of eggs in bulk. Yaa is hopeful about expanding her business and hopes to give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To procure eggs in bulk for sale.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy A. is from the village of Libertad Alto in Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is 34 years old. Daisy is single. To make a living, Daisy owns and operates a general store where she sells a variety of different products in her local community. Daisy has been engaged in her business for over 11 years and earns approximately 1,200.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Daisy joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Daisy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000.00 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital.

Daisy is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP that she will use to purchase additional products to sell. This will be Daisy's fifth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Kate

texts.en:
Kate owns and operates a beauty salon in her neighborhood. Kate is a very skillful and talented hairdresser. She does all kinds of hair styles including plaiting, perming and fixing of weavons etc. She believes in efficiency and effectiveness of service; therefore, she wants to use this loan to buy larger quantities of hair products like weavons, pomade, shampoo, activators, etc. to provide her customers with quality service. She believes in her ability to increase her income with this loan.
Kate is 45 years old and married with no children.

loans.use: To purchase hairdressing supplies

loans.name: Floravie

texts.en:
Floravie C. is 27 years old and a mother of three children, ages five, four, and two years old. Her children are the angels that keep the bond of her marriage to Vincent C., a utility worker in one of the offices in the municipality of San Jose.

After five years of being married, Floravie saw how hard life can be if her husband alone was earning. She wanted to have her own business to help her husband sustain the needs of their family and to prepare for the future of their children. She dreams that someday through the profit her business can generate, she can send her children to school until college.

After having been recognized as a new member of ASHI, Floravie is excited to start her chosen business which is the buying and selling of processed food. She envisions that someday, together with her husband, she will be able to have a space in the market for her business and can buy a tricycle (motorcycle with sidecar used by people as a means of transportation) for hire to be her other business.

loans.use: To start a business buying and selling processed food.

loans.name: Gladys Kezia Magana

texts.en:
Gladys K., 24 and single, has operated the business of providing phone service to the public for the past five years on Odinga Street in Eldoret Town. She owns a booth equipped with mobile phones that customers can use to make calls from for a fee and also sells prepaid mobile phone cards to people who own their own phones

With the money from this loan, Gladys plans to buy more calling cards for her business as well as detergent for resale, another business she is engaged in. In the future, she intends to diversify by starting a wholesale business. She also hopes to be able to buy a plot of land within Eldoret and to be able to pay school fees for her sister.

Gladys was introduced to KADET by an acquaintance who was already a KADET client.

About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To buy more calling cards for resale and business use.

loans.name: Socheat

texts.en:
Mrs. Socheat C., age 32, and her husband, Mr. Vantha Vong, age 39, have been married since 1996. They have one son and one daughter. The family lives along National Road No. 1, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Socheat has been a garment factory worker for nine years and Mr. Vantha Vong has been a vegetable farmer for 15 years. Socheat is requesting her first loan in the amount of $200 to use as business capital her husband’s farming business. The loan will be used for buying fertilizer and pesticide and to pay for plowing fees.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and pesticide and to pay for plowing fees.
