loans.name: Mario De Jesus

texts.es: El señor Mario de Jesús Pérez T. tiene la edad de 39 años, su estado civil es casado, este señor tiene 3 hijos que todavía estudian. Sus sueños son de mantener activo su negocio y de darle mejoras a su vivienda ya que esta es una de las prioridades que él tiene debido a que sus hijos están creciendo y necesita ofrecerle un espacio que sea propiedad de ellas. Su actividad económica es la carpintería, hace más de 10 años que se dedica a la carpintería. Su negocio inicia porque el mismo con su propio esfuerzo logro aprender este oficio que le ayudaría para su futuro  a prendió en  un taller y el contribuía con este taller, más tarde decide independizarse y formar su propio negocio. Ahora solicita la ayuda de Fundación León 2000 el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo por lo que necesita invertir más en su negocio para la compra de materiales. El deseo de Mario es establecer su propia funeraria.
texts.en:
Mr. Mario de Jesús Pérez T. is 39 years old, married with three children who are still in school. He dreams of keeping his business active and of making improvements to his house. This is one of his main priorities since he wants to ensure his children have a house that they own. Mr. P. has been working as a carpenter for over 10 years. He started his business by learning carpentry on his own and then by helping out at a workshop. Later on, he decided to become independent and start his own business. He is now requesting financial assistance from Fundación León 2000 (micro-finance institution). He will invest this loan in working capital to purchase materials for his business. Some day he hopes to open his own funeral home.

Translated from Spanish by Rina Paguaga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Soline

texts.fr: A. Soline est née vers 1964 à Cotonou, Capitale Économique de la République du Bénin. Soline a fait jusqu’au cours secondaire avant d’abandonner les études. Soline est mariée à NOUKPO Antonin. Soline est mère de trois enfants. La famille vit à Cotonou. Grâce au revenu de son activité, Soline vient en aide à son mari dans les charges de la famille. C’est des divers (Bonbons, biscuits, boîtes de lait, de sardines, de tomates, de sucres, les pâtes alimentaires, les savons de lessive, de vaisselle et de toilette, piles, bougies, etc.) et des articles de mercerie que Soline vend. Soline a besoin de moyens financiers pour mieux développer son activité. C’est la raison pour laquelle Soline demande de crédit pour renforcer son fonds de roulement.
texts.en:
Soline A. was born around 1964 in Cotonou, the economic capital of the Republic of Bénin. Soline went to school up until high school before abandoning her studies. Soline is married to Antonin Noukpo. Soline is the mother of three children. The family lives in Cotonou. Thanks to her business's income, Soline helps her husband with the family's expenses. Soline sells various items (candies, cookies, cans of milk, of sardines, of tomatoes, sugar, pasta, laundry, dish and bath soaps, batteries, candles, etc.) and sewing supplies. Soline needs financial means to further develop her business. It is for this reason that Soline is requesting a loan to increase her working capital.

Translated from French by Heather Nicholson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase various items (Candies, cookies, cans of milk, of sardines, of tomatoes, sugar, pasta, bathroom tissue, etc.) et sewing supplies.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is 38 years old, lives with her boyfriend, and has one 15-year-old daughter.  She is a dairy farmer, and with the milk that her cows produce, she makes and sells yogurt and soft cheese.  Gladys has worked with dairy cows now for over 20 years.  She lives in the center of Maica, a community about 40 minutes outside of the city of Cochabamba.

Gladys is going to buy soy husks with her loan, to augment the food for her livestock.  With the help of this additional food, she can continue producing more milk.  Her products are well known in the area for their great quality.  Gladys sells her products in all of the different markets of the city of Cochabamba.

loans.use: To purchase soy husks

loans.name: Iyabo

texts.en: Iyabo sells plastic and has been in the business for the past 18 years. She lives in Ibadan, Oyo State. She is 43 years old and married with five children. She hopes for a loan of N70,000 to purchase more plastic to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more plastic to sell

loans.name: Walther Isidoro

texts.en:
Walther Isidoro is part of a communal bank consisting of 19 members in Cruz Pata, a town 45 minutes from Cusco.  The group is called Sacro.  He is from Huancayo and lives in Cruz Pata.  He is 48 years old and is married with 5 daughters.

Walther has a bakery where he makes baked goods like cakes and apple pies.  He sells his goods to stores and to tourists. Walther has many regular clients who continue to buy from him. He will use this loan to buy flour and other materials needed by his bakery.

Walther appreciates and thanks you for the loan and promises to pay the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: To buy flour and other raw materials needed for his bakery

loans.name: Ressel

texts.en:
Ressel C.. from the village of Misom, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental, is 31 years old, married and the mother of an infant. To make a living, Ressel owns and operates a snack-vending business whose main income is derived from preparing and selling banana cue for sale in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Ressel joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is now requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase the raw ingredients needed to make her products, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make her products

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
La socia NELLY es una humilde madre de familia que pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN PURIFICADA - ANGOSTURA”. 

La socia tiene 29 años de edad, es madre y padre para su hijo de ocho años. Su hijo estudia en el colegio y esta en el segundo grado de primaria. Ella vive en el distrito de San Jerónimo en la comunidad de Angostura que se encuentra ubicada al sur de la ciudad del Cusco. Ella es de profesión enfermera y trabaja por las mañanas en el  Seguro Social de Salud (ESSALUD). La socia por las tardes alterna sus actividades del hogar con la crianza de pollos y venta de madera. Ya son varios años que trabaja en el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestra socia es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar más pollos para luego venderlos en las ferias del Cusco y así aumentar el capital de negocio.
 
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Nelly is a humble mother who belongs to the communal bank “VIRGEN PURIFICADA - ANGOSTURA”. She is 29 years old and is a single mother of her 8-year-old son. Her son attends school and is in the second grade of elementary school. She lives in the San Jerónimo district within the Angostura region, which is located south of the city of Cusco. She is a nurse and works during the mornings for Seguro Social de Salud (ESSALUD). She alternates during the afternoons her activities in the house with raising chickens and the sale of wood. She has been performing this job for a few years and it has been going well, thanks to all the determination that she puts into her work. She is a hard-working and determined mother who is getting ahead with her family. She is requesting the loan to purchase more chickens to place them for sell in the Cusco market. This way, she will increase the capital for her business. She is thankful of the opportunity granted to her through this method and she promises to complete all the scheduled repayments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Josh Wilcox, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more chickens to sell in the Cusco markets

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina is thirty-four years old. She is married with three children. She is a responsible mother and has her children’s needs and welfare at heart. Currently all her three children are in school. She is a petty trader who sells used clothes. Used clothing sellers are patronized by many people for their daily wear and because of that, Regina has many customers. However, with small capital, she can barely sell enough to make profit. She wants the loan therefore to buy more bales of used clothes that come with a variety of styles to meet the desire of her customer and produce increased income for her family.

loans.use: To purchase assorted used clothes

loans.name: Onon

texts.en: Onon is 34 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Arhangai province, Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian tent. His older son and daughter, 10 and 9 years old, attend a local secondary school while the younger daughter, 1, stays at home with Onon's wife. He operates a business selling groceries and dairy products door-to-door in his town. He has a car, which he uses to deliver his products to his customers. He started his business in 2000 with working capital of 300,000 tugrugs (~210 USD). At first, he used to drive a motorcycle to transport his customer's products. Over the years, he stabilized his business and enabled himself to buy a car. Now his working capital exceeds 2,000,000 tugrugs (~1400 USD). He is quite knowledgeable in conducting his business and says, "My business goal is to provide quality products on time." He is requesting a 2,000,000-tugrug loan to purchase grocery products and clothes to sell to the province residents.

loans.use: To purchase grocery products and clothes

loans.name: Jenny Juana

texts.es:
La Señora Jenny  es una  cliente buena, ella  ya trabajo tres secuencias en la institución, en su comportamiento ella demostró puntualidad y responsabilidad, la señora Jenny se dedica a la venta de ropa de mujer de pollera ( en Bolivia la mujer autóctona es la que utiliza polleras y mantas, la venta de polleras y mantas se da mas en la zona occidental del país, la señora Jenny compra ropa de las tiendas que alquilan esta ropa para bailes, la venta lo realiza en la zona 12 de octubre, esta zona es muy popular de la ciudad de el alto porque no se debe pagar para realizar la venta, en estos puestos lo que mas se vende es la ropa de mujer de pollera, su esposo se llama Antonio el es chofer asalariado del sindicato Pedro Domingo murillo,  la labor de la señora Jenny es sacrificado porque ella no solo tiene que realizar la venta de su ropa sino también  ella ayuda a su esposo en su movilidad cobrando pasajes, el destino del crédito es para la compra de ropa por mayor.
Esta agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en:
Jenny is a good client. She has already worked three cycles with the institution. Her behavior demonstrated punctuality and responsibility. Jenny sells women’s clothes. In Bolivia an Autócona woman is one who wears “polleras” (a traditional long skirt) and “mantas” (shawls). These polleras and mantas are sold more in the western part of the country. Jennny buys clothes from the stores that rent clothing for dances. She sells in the 12 de octubre region. This region is very popular in the city of El Alto because you do not have to pay to sell. At these stands the pollera is what sells the most. Her husband, Antonio, is a salaried driver for the Pedro Domingo Murillo union. Jenny makes lots of sacrifices in her work because she not only sells clothes, but she also helps her husband by collecting fares for his transportation service. The loan is to buy clothes wholesale. She is grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence they show by giving her the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothes wholesale

loans.name: Kaï

texts.fr: T. Kaï est née vers 1965 à Seme Podji.  Mariée à MERESANVI Albert, un magasinier à la SOBEMAP, Kaï est mère de quatre enfants, dont 1 seul est à leur charge.  Kaï vit ensemble avec son mari et l’enfant à leur charge au quartier Xuilacodji à Cotonou, capitale économique du BENIN, depuis 35ans.  Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille.  Kaï n’a pas été à l’école. Kaï vend du charbon et du jus de bissap (boisson locale de la Côte d'Ivoire, pays voisin du BENIN) et du citron de façon ambulante à Xulacodji.Kaï vend également de l'eau glaçée. Kaï exerce cette activité depuis dix ans et s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin.  Kaï est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant déjà obtenu 2 crédits à ALIDé.  Ces crédits ont été bien remboursés.  Elle sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé pour renforcer son activité et acheter du charbon,du sucre,des feuilles de bissap, et divers autres produits. Kaï voudrait vendre également des pagnes.
texts.en:
Ms. T. Kaï was born around 1965 in Seme Podji. Married to Mr. MERESANVI Albert, a store clerk at the SOBEMAP, she is the mother of four children, of whom only one is in her care. Kaï has been living together with her husband and child in the Xuilacodji district in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, for 35 years. The couple jointly ensure that family expenses are covered. Kaï did not go to school. In Xulacodji, she goes door to door selling charcoal and lemonade and bissap juice (a local drink from Cote d'Ivoire, a country near Benin). She also sells ice water. She has been in this business for ten years and gets her supplies from Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. She is a previous ALIDé client having already obtained two loans from ALIDé. These loans have been repaid. She is requesting a third loan from ALIDé for bolstering her business and buying some charcoal, sugar, bissap leaves, and various other items. She would also like to sell pagnes (colorful West African cloth).

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying charcoal, sugar, bissap leaves, etc.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia L. is from the village of Purok 1, San Pedro, Initao, Misamis Oriental. She is 46 years old. Delia is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Delia owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling vegetables and cooking ingredients in the local community. Delia has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Delia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Delia is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Delia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement income of her family and support the education of her children.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Merly

texts.en: Merly P. is from the village of Magsaysay, Gingoog City. She is 51 years old, is widowed, and has five school-aged children. Merly owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Merly joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Merly is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 2nd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Ulises

texts.es:
El señor Ulises H. es casado, tiene 2 hijos en edad escolar, su esposa es maestra de educación primaria.
Don Ulises es trabajador de la Alcaldía Municipal de Chichigalpa desde hace 13 años desempeñándose como conductor de una unidad recolectora de basura.
A él se le han otorgado 5 créditos los cuales han sido para mejoramiento de vivienda y este ultimo que es para gastos médicos y otros gastos.
Él nos expresa que han sido de mucha ayuda, ya que le han permitido dar un mejor nivel de vida a su familia
texts.en:
Sr. Ulises H. is married and has two school age children. His wife is an elementary school teacher. Don Ulises has been working for the Chichigalpa municipal government for 13 years as a garbage truck driver.

He has received five previous loans which were used for making improvements to his home. This latest loan will be used for medical and other related expenses. Ulises says the loans have been very helpful because they have allowed him to provide his family with a better standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Medical and other related expenses (such as buying medicines)

loans.name: Nestor

texts.es:
Nestor es artesano; confecciona chamarras al por mayor; estudia en la universidad estatal UPEA la carrera de ciencia de la educación. La confección de chamarras es su principal fuente de ingresos con que cubre sus gastos personales y su educación. Vive en la casa de sus padres ubicado en la zona Ciudad Villa Tunari – Rio Seco de la ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito lo destinara para la compra de  materia prima (tela) para poder incrementar su producción y poder satisfacer la cantidad de demanda que existe en su mercado.
 
Es el primer crédito con IMPRO, la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado por Nestor.
texts.en:
Nestor is a craftsman; he makes jackets that are sold at wholesale. He is a student at the state university UPEA, and is majoring in educational sciences. The production of jackets is his main source of income with which he covers his personal and educational expenses. He lives in his parents' home located in the Ciudad Villa Tunari-Rio Seco neighborhood of the city of El Alto. This loan will be used to buy raw materials (fabric) so that he can increase his production and satisfy the demand that exists in his market. This is his first loan with IMPRO. Nestor was approved for this loan after a credit evaluation conducted by IMPRO.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fabric to make jackets

loans.name: Aracely De Los Angeles

texts.es: La señora Aracely  S. PerezLabora para la Universidad Catolica de Nicaragua ,tiene tres años de laborar como conserge es madre de un hijo y es soltera ella costea los gastos del hogat, este es mi segundo préstamo que trabajo con CEPRODEL, los cuales los he utilizado para mejoras de vivienda , ya que de acuerdo a mi ingreso es poco lo que me pueden financiar , poco a poco hago mi obra , hasta terminar , me siento agradecida por al oportunidad y la rapidez de los créditos .
texts.en:
La señora Aracely S. PerezLabora para la Universidad Catolica de Nicaragua ,tiene tres años de laborar como conserge es madre de un hijo y es soltera ella costea los gastos del hogat, este es mi segundo préstamo que trabajo con CEPRODEL, los cuales los he utilizado para mejoras de vivienda , ya que de acuerdo a mi ingreso es poco lo que me pueden financiar , poco a poco hago mi obra , hasta terminar , me siento agradecida por al oportunidad y la rapidez de los créditos .

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: mejoras de vivienda

loans.name: Conquistadores De Tapana Group

texts.en:
Norma, Silvia and Marisol are members of the village bank "Los Conquistadores Tapana", which begins its first loan cycle with 18 members.

Norma lives with her two children who are eight and two years old. She has separated from her partner because he abused her. Norma received a loan of PEN 500 for salt and small animals for her business. Ever since she was a little girl Norma has worked and built up savings by buying and selling small animals to her neighbors. Norma is expecting her business and life to change significantly as she progresses as a member of FINCA and gets the chance to learn how to save her money, take care of her community, and attend various training sessions offered. Norma is dreaming of having a large guinea pig farm someday.

Silvia is married and has two children who are also eight and two years old. Silvia was granted a loan of PEN 200 to use for her business, selling grains and small animals. Silvia has suffered greatly since childhood, becoming an orphan at the young age of eight. She bought grains to start a business and move forward and decided to join FINCA to learn to save her money and because she likes the training sessions and workshops. Silvia expects that her life will change as a member of FINCA and that she will learn to appreciate herself as a woman. Silvia dreams of owning a small grocery store.

Marisol is married and has three children who are two months, four and six years old. She has struggled since the father of her children abandoned them. She used her PEN 200 loan to purchase more chickens for her business. Marisol is grateful to FINCA because she will now have life insurance (FINCA Vida) and will have more capital for her business. Marisol is excited to learn how to save her money and invest it in her business. She dreams of having a larger chicken business.

loans.use: Buying small animals to re-sell

loans.name: Raliatou

texts.fr: Née en 1976 à Banigbé au Bénin, S. Raliatou est mariée à TOSSOU Germain. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés. Raliatou s’est installée depuis cinq ans, à PK10 dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji, où elle vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Raliatou participe pleinement aux différentes charges de la famille. Raliatou n’a pas été à l’école. Depuis huit ans environs, Raliatou s’est mise à vendre des tissus et des chaussures de façon ambulante. Cette activité lui génère des revenus l’aidant à faire face à ses multiples charges. Raliatou se ravitaille à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C’est la deuxième fois que Raliatou sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé, afin de renforcer son capital et de rehausser le niveau de son activité.
texts.en:
Born in 1976 in Banigbé in Benin, Ms. S. Raliatou is married to Mr. TOSSOU Germain.  The couple have two children, who are both in school.  She settled five years ago in PK10, in the community of Sèmè-Podji, where she lives with her husband and children.  She fully participates in meeting their various family expenses.  Raliatou did not attend school.  Eight years ago, she started selling cloth and shoes door-to-door.  This business generates the revenues for helping her to cope with multiple expenses.  She gets her supplies at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin.  This is the second time that Raliatou is requesting financial support from ALIDé in order to bolster her capital and to raise up her level of business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying shoes and fabrics

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David M. K. is twenty-four years old, married and has two children aged between the age of twelve years old and six months old. His business is located at Kamkunji in Nairobi. Nairobi is the capital city of Kenya.

He owns a restaurant in which he sells food to the local people. He has been in this business for the last five years. He says that this business is profitable, but the major challenge is that there are so many people in the area doing the same kind of business as his and so the customers are not loyal as they are spoiled by choice. However, he works very hard to keep his business doing well. He is using his loan of Kes 20,000 to buy food items to make food to sell to his customers. He describes himself as hardworking, ambitious and focused.

loans.use: To buy ingredients to make food for his restaurant.

loans.name: They

texts.en: Mrs. They C. is 66 years old and lives in Pongro village, Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns two hectars of land to cultivate rice for a living. She works very hard to help her family. She does not have enough money to support the farm, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticide, and rice seed and to pay for a laborer to plow her farm to grow rice. Mrs. They C. is a widow with two children; one is a laborer and one is seamstress in a garment factory.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticide, and rice seed and to pay for a laborer to plow her farm to grow rice.

loans.name: Han

texts.en: Han T., 40, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Battambong Province, Cambodia, an area known for quality rice products. T. sells green coconuts, earning an income of $6 US per day. Her husband is a carpenter and earns an income of $3 per day. T. is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase coconuts and to repair the house. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to expand her current business.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy more coconuts; repair the house

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina B. is from the village of Poblacion, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 38 years old. Rosalina is married and has 7 school-aged children. To make a living, Rosalina owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Rosalina has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rosalina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosalina is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Rosalina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it.. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more cartons of milk, soap, toothpaste, candy, copybooks and sugar

loans.name: Gantuya

texts.en:
Gantuya G. lives with her husband and two children in her own house in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her daughter attends Otgontenger University, while her son is currently studying for his bachelor's degree at the Mongolian Science and Technology University. Her husband works in a construction college as a teacher. 

Gantuya operates a women's lingerie retail business from a stall at the biggest market in Narantuul. She sells a variety of different lingerie items and accessories and her wide product selection attracts many customers. She started her women's lingerie business in 2000. She imports her products from Erlian, a border city of China, twice a month. Her business location is good. In the future, she plans to expand her business by increasing her working capital during the peak season for sales. She is a very modest and hardworking person and says, " I want to help with my sister's children's education." She is requesting a 1,000,000 tugrik loan to purchase more lingerie with an increase in her working capital.

loans.use: To purchase more lingerie

loans.name: Rob's Group

texts.en:
Rob S. is a 30-year-old married woman and is the leader of a group loan, having been selected by its four members, who live in Kampong Pou village, Kandal province. The members of this group will each use their portion of the loan to support their different purposes. 

 Rob S. is a grocery and vegetable seller in the local market, and she is able to earn a small income to support the family. Her husband, Mr. Phan S., who is 32 years old, earns his living with a motorbike and Khmer trailer in the local village. Since the grocery business is going well, Rob S. wants to expand it, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more groceries to sell. This couple has three children who are between 10 and 5 years old.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes K. makes a living by selling rice, beans, and other items and has applied for this loan to buy more bags of rice and beans from Uganda to sell to her customers. Agnes is 49 years old, married to a driver, and has six children, three of whom are enrolled in school. With the extra income made possible by this loan, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice and beans from Uganda to sell

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a farmer from Murang'a town in central Kenya. She has been practicing mixed farming for twenty years. Her farm produces coffee which she sells to the local market and milk which she sells through a local cooperative society. Her biggest challenges have been drought and lack of enough financing to venture fully into rabbit keeping.

She has requested this loan of 20,000KES through Juhudi Kilimo for rabbit keeping. The income from the sale of rabbits will help improve the livelihood of her family. In five years' time she hopes to be having over 300 rabbits of pure breed.

Jane is 43 years old. She is married with 4 children who are between the ages of 11 ans 23. Two of the children are currently attending school. She comments that with Juhudi's financial assistance the future is bright.

loans.use: For rabbit keeping

loans.name: Lun's Group

texts.en:
This village loan consists of nine members. They are located in Peam Reang Kraom village, Kandal province. This village members selected Mrs. Lun S. as the village bank president. Each members will use their portion of the loan with different purposes. 

Mrs. Lun S. and her husband, Mr. Vann Saratt, are farmers who own 1-hectare of land to cultivate corn and peanuts. With their farming, they face a problem. They do not have enough money to buy vegetable seeds. Thus, Mrs. Lun S. would like to ask for a loan to buy corn seeds, peanut seeds, and fertilizers and pesticides to strengthen the business. Beside being a farmer, Mrs. Lun S. is also sells Khmer cake in the local market and is able to earn some additional profit to support the family. This couple has three children. Two are students in the local school and also help their parents business, while another is just 3 years old.

loans.use: To buy corn seed, peanut seed, fertilizer and pesticide.

loans.name: Sem

texts.en:
Sem V., 42, is married and resides with her husband and six children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for its pre-Angkorean temples. V. is a housewife while her husband is a carpenter, earning an income of about USD 3 per day. Three of her children are employed in factories, earning an income of USD 3 each per day to help cover the family expenses. 

V. has to spend USD 20 on food, USD 5 on electricity and water, and USD 20 on other necessary expenses every month.  V. is requesting a loan of USD 550 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to provide transportation services. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy a motorbike

loans.name: Damasco Group

texts.es:
El grupo Damasco está conformado por tres mujeres trabajadoras una de ellas es Ivania de 39 año quien vende nacatamales los fines de semana comida típica a base de masa y cerdo, fritanga  todos los días y ropa. Este negocio lo inicio cunado se quedó sin empleo  hace 6 años trabaja arduamente junto con su familia.
Las otras integrantes de grupo son Claudia comerciante de ropa (camisas, pantalones, jeans, blusas…etc.) desde hace 5 años  y Emerita vende ropa y zapatos.
texts.en:
The 'Damasco' group is made up of three hard-working women.  One of them is 39 year-old Ivania who sells 'nacatamales' (Nicaraguan 'tamales' - steamed corn dumplings with a pork filling) on weekends, fried food every day of the week and clothes.  She started her business when she lost her job 6 years ago.  She works hard together with her family.

The other members of the group are Claudia who has been selling clothes (shirts, pants, jeans, blouses, etc...) for five years and Emerita who sells clothes and shoes.

loans.use: To buy corn, pork, basic grains, meat and clothes

loans.name: Purísima

texts.es:
Purísima forma parte del banco comunal “El Sol Brilla para todos” perteneciente a la ciudad de Viña del Mar. Ella se dedica a la producción y venta de empanadas por encargos, los días viernes y sábados. También vende ropa de lencería en su casa, los otros días de la semana. Ambos negocios los tiene desde hace 5 años. Con este préstamo comprará ropa de lencería e ingredientes para cocinar las empanadas. 
Vive solo con su esposo, ya que sus tres hijos son mayores de edad e independientes.
Su sueño es tener una tienda de lencería. 
A pesar de que Purísima padece de diabetes y presión alta, desde hace 3 años, ella mantiene su ánimo y su sueño para crecer en su negocio.
A Purísima, le han sido de gran apoyo los préstamos de Fondo Esperanza, además le es muy grato compartir con sus compañeros de grupo y también le han sido muy útiles las enseñanzas que recibe de parte de la asesora, acerca de la administración de su dinero.
Viña del Mar es una ciudad y comuna ubicada en el litoral central de Chile, conocida como la Ciudad Jardín debido a los jardines y patios que poseen algunas viviendas antiguas de la ciudad. También es considerada la capital turística de Chile.
texts.en:
Purísima is a member of the communal bank, The Sun Shines for All ("El Sol Brilla para todos"), which pertains to the city of Vina del Mar.  She works in the making and selling of empanadas in bulk, on Fridays and Saturdays.  She also sells underwear in her home, the other days of the week.  She has owned both businesses for over 5 years.  With this loan she plans to purchase underwear and ingredients with which to make empanadas.  She lives only with her husband now since her three sons are all grown and independent.

Her dream is to have an underwear store.  Even though Purisima was diagnosed with diabetes and high blood pressure over 3 years ago, she remains very positive and her dream is to grow her business.  The loans from Fondo Esperanza have been a great help to Purisima.  She is very pleased to share with her team members and also finds the lessons that she receives from the financial advisor about the administration of her money to be very useful.  Vina del Mar is a city and commune located in the central coast of Chile, known as the Garden City due to the gardens and patios that some of the older houses in the city possess.  It is also known as the tourist capital of Chile.

loans.use: Purchase underwear and ingredients for empanadas.

loans.name: Carlos Augusto

texts.es: CARLOS AUGUSTO  tiene 24 años es conviviente hace mas de 7 años tiene 2 hijos menores de edad viven en casa de sus abuelos , se dedica a trabajar como chofer hace mas de 4 años cuentan con buena acumualación de bienes, no tiene experiencia crediticia gozan de buenas referencias personales , tiene aspiraciones a seguir trabajando con la entidad para luego poder solicitar un crédito mayor para la compra de dicho activo fijo (auto tico) solicitan dicho crédito para gastos personales se propone dicho crédito por contar  con capacidad de pago.
texts.en: CARLOS AUGUSTO  is 24 and has been living with his partner for over seven years. He has 2 young children, and they live in the home of their grandparents. He has worked as a driver for over 4 years. He has a good asset accumulation, and has no credit history. He has good personal references and hopes to continue working with the company in order to later request a larger loan for the purchase of assets (a car). He is requesting this loan for personal expenses, and he has the ability to repay it.

loans.use: for personal expenses

loans.name: Elsa Isabel

texts.es:
Elsa Isabel M. F. tiene 32 años de edad, Vive en Unión Libre junto a su compañero y a sus hijos. En el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los ríos. Tiene 4 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. JESUS NOS AMA se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto los Amarillos, Perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas Esta Ventanilla se dedica a labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Elsa Isabel  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz, cacao desde hace 5 años. Compra sus productos en Agripac Eicopa, y  vende en la feria en Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz, arroz. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprarse un carro.

Le gusta escuchar música.
texts.en:
Elsa Isabel M. F. is 32 years old and she lives with her common-law husband and their children. They live in the city of Ventanas, in the province of Los Rios. She has 4 children. 

The communal bank named "Jesus Loves Us" is located in the community of Los Amarillos in the city of Ventanas. This group is dedicated to short-cycle agriculture, planting corn, and rice. This is a business they have practiced for a long time. 

Isabel is an agriculturist who has harvested corn, rice, and cocoa for the past 5 years. She buys her products from Agripac Eicopa, and she carries out her sales in the fair at Ventanas. 

She requests a loan to purchase agricultural products and fertilizers to cultivate corn and rice. The support from this loan will be a financial help for her to provide for her needs. She faces challenges such as plagues, diseases, and the changing weather. Her dream is to have a car. 

She enjoys listening to music.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural products and fertilizers.

loans.name: Nan

texts.en:
Mrs. Nan B. (in the photo) is 47 years old and her husband, Mr. Ol Saing is 46 years old. They have been married since 1987 and have six children: three sons and three daughters. Two are married, one is a garment factory worker, and the other three attend school. The family lives on an Island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

Nan is a farmer; she grows sugar cane, tomatoes, and corn. Her husband constructs wooden houses. The house where she lives is old and is broken down in some parts, so she is asking for her first loan of $1,000 to repair it.

loans.use: To repair the house where she lives.

loans.name: Princesas De Cuautlapan Group

texts.es: Esta foto fue tomada en el negocio de la señorita Guadalupe Fidelia R., un integrante del grupo Las Princesas de Cuautlapan, que esta ubicado en el Estado de VeraC., en México. Ella se dedica a la venta de Papeleria y merceria que inicio hace 1 año. Solicita el préstamo para comprar más mercancía y tener surtido su negocio para incrementar sus ventas, además de dedicarse a la organización de eventos sociales. Sus compañeros, vecinos y clientes la conocen como una persona trabajadora y responsable. Al momento de solicitar este préstamo se siente satisfecha ya que por medio de este crédito podra incrementar sus ventas. Tiene 42 años, estudio hasta el bachillerato y es soltera. También espera seguir ayudando a sus padres y apoyarlos con los gastos de la casa ya que vive con ellos.
texts.en: This photo was taken at the business of Ms. Guadalupe Fidelia R., a member of the group "Las Princesas of Cuautlapan" ["The Princesses of Cuautlapan"], which is located in the Mexican state of VeraC.. Guadalupe sells stationery and other merchandise, which she started doing one year ago. She is requesting this loan to buy more merchandise and to stock her business in order to increase her sales, as well as to work planning social events. Her friends, neighbors, and customers know her as a hard-working and responsible woman. As she requests this loan, she feels happy that this will make it possible for her to increase her sales. She is 42 years old, finished high school, and is single. She also hopes to continue helping her parents with the expenses for the home where they live together.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise for her paper store

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a married woman who lives in Bataraza, Palawan. She earns her living by operating fish vending and fishing businesses. Her husband Antonio, who is 43 years old, works as a fisherman to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities. They have eight children who are between 7 and 19 years old. Gloria joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 21 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Gloria has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 29,500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 17,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 22nd loan, she is borrowing PHP 29,500 to fund the operation of her businesses so that she can continue to save up for future house repairs and the education of her children. Gloria is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines

loans.use: To fund business operations

loans.name: Battsetseg

texts.en:
Battsetseg is 30 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.  They live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Battsetseg is tailor who used to work for different clothes factories as a seemstress.  In July 2010, she opened her own tailoring business. At the moment, she rents a small workroom and works alone. She started with one sewing machine. She is planning to extend her business by buying another sewing machine with more capability and employing someone else.

Her husband works as a taxi driver. Mrs.Battsetseg is a self-motivated, hard working woman who dreams of having better living conditions and a successful business. She wants to use the loan as a part payment to buy a $520USD sewing machine with more capability.

loans.use: to pay for a sewing machine with more capability

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a 35-year-old married man living in his own house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is solely charged with the responsibility of looking after six of his household members. His desire is to educate his four children up to university.

Moses has been running a retail shop for 12 years. He started out with capital of 100,000 UGX and now has working capital of 500,000 UGX. Moses confesses to not having met any major challenges and his dream is to own a supermarket. Moses intends to use the loan to buy salt, sugar and soap to sell.

loans.use: to buy salt, soap and sugar

loans.name: Gagik

texts.en:
Gagik V. was born in 1970. He is married with two daughters. Gagik’s older daughter is a student, and younger one is a pupil. For over 20 years Gagik has been a bee keeper in Nerkin Hand village, an area of Kapan. He likes his occupation very much and therefore works very hard. Gagik sells his honey to villagers, and also distributes honey to Kapan and Yerevan cities. Thanks to his business income Gagik provides for his family’s needs and pays for his older daughter’s education.   
Gagik needs a 600,000 AMD loan to increase the number of his bee hives, and also to buy wax paper and frames for his business. This is Gagik’s fifth loan from Nor Horizon. He has never delayed his repayments.

loans.use: To increase his number of bee hives, and also to buy wax papers and frames

loans.name: Maame Aba

texts.en: Maame Aba A. runs a stall selling kenkey and other food items. Kenkey is a popular Ghanaian staple made from fermented corn dough. (It is displayed in the pink basin that Maame is holding in the photograph). It is usually served with pepper sauce and fried fish. Maame has been in this business for five years and is now looking to expand it. She intends to use her Kiva loan to purchase more food items to sell. Any additional profits she earns will be reinvested back into her business. Maame is married to a farmer and they have five children. Her income helps pay for the children's school fees and household utility bills.

loans.use: to purchase more food items to sell.

loans.name: Flordiliza

texts.en:
Flordiliza Lodivico is 42 years old and has a retail shop where she sells different products. Flordiliza has had this business for one year. She has five school-aged children and she is married.

Flordiliza is requesting a loan of 10,000 to purchase additional products to sell like spices and soft drinks. Each month, Flordiliza earns about PHP 5,000 doing this type of work.

In the future, Flordiliza hopes to expand her business to support the daily needs of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell like spices and soft drinks

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr: Née en 1978, Akouvi est née à Lomé et mère au foyer avec 02 enfants en charge. Coiffeuse de profession elle a ouvert son salon de coiffure depuis 2000 et emploie deux autres coiffeuses pour mieux satisfaire ses clientes. Parallèlement  elle vend des produits esthétiques dans son salon  pour répondre aux attentes de certaines clientes et leur faciliter la vie. Elle s’approvisionne sur place et affectionne son métier.
texts.en: Born in 1978 in Lomé, Akouvi is married  with two children in her care. A hairdresser by trade, she opened her salon in 2000 and employs two other hairdresser in order to better meet her clients’ needs. In addition, she also sells beauty product to meet the expectations of some clients and make things convenient for them. She stocks up locally. She is enthusiastic about her profession.

loans.use: to buy beauty products

loans.name: Hilario Rene

texts.es: El señor Hilario Ramón se dedica a brindar el servicio de  transporte de taxi, es un hombre muy responsable que disfruta de este medio de vida. Hace más de 4 años que ofrece este servicio y que siempre se preocupa por brindar una buena atención. Hilario se caracteriza por ser un padre responsable y que disfruta de su negocio y de interactuar con sus clientes. Lo que él quiere es incrementar las ganancias para brindarle más comodidades a su familia. El piensa en su futuro y en la de su familia, quiere brindarle una mejor calidad de vida, al igual lograr unas metas propuestas para crecer como persona. El financiamiento es para la compra de llantas, repuesto, focos y mantenimiento.
texts.en:
Mr. Hilario Ramón, a very responsible man, is in the taxi business and enjoys being able to earn his living this way.  For over four years he has been offering service and always worrying about providing the best attention possible.  Hilario is known to be a responsible father who enjoys his work and relating to customers.

He hopes to increase his earnings so he can provide his family with better living conditions.  Providing his family with a better lifestyle and meeting his goals are very important in his development as a person.  The loan will be used to buy tires, repair parts, headlights and pay for maintenance.

loans.use: To buy tires, repair parts, headlights and pay for maintenance.

loans.name: José

texts.es: José es un hombre  muy trabajador, desde hace 3 años se dedica al transporte urbano como chofer de taxi, llevando a sus clientes a su destino por un bajo costo. Para tener mejores ganancias el trabaja día y noche de esta manera ayuda a su esposa con los gastos del hogar. Es padre de dos pequeños por quienes sale adelante para ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida. El préstamo que solicita es para comprar partes de refacciones para darle mantenimiento a la unidad y así ofrecer un mejor servicio.
texts.en: José is a very hardworking man. He has been working in urban transportation for 3 years as a taxi driver, taking his customers to their destination for a low price. In order to have better earnings, he works day and night and in this way he helps his wife with the household expenses. He is the father of two young children, for whom he does his best so he can offer them a better quality of life. The loan he is requesting is to buy replacement parts so he can maintain his car and offer better service.

loans.use: to buy car parts for his vehicle.

loans.name: Dios Es Amor Y Mi Guia Group

texts.es: Indudablemente las damas son las mejores vendedoras. ¿Porqué? Porque además de que  son carismáticas, conversadoras y sensibles: jamás se rinden!!! Así se identifican las señoras del grupo Dios es amor y mi guía con tres años y medio trabajando, la señora Shirley de 63 años de edad, es divorciada y es un vivo ejemplo de una mujer luchadora e invencible, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, con trece años en el negocio, y ahora es una gran  líder de ventas de dos empresas, comenzó en este negocio a raíz que la economía en su hogar era demasiada baja y necesitaba mayores ingresos para los  3 hijos que tiene, ella ha podido darles lo mejor ya que ahora son todos mayores de edad, con su esfuerzo a dado estudios a sus hijos y a podido mejorar su casa, también se dedica a la venta de zapatos que trae desde Trujillo, con el reciente préstamo piensa en viajar a traer variedad de zapatos.
texts.en:
Women are undoubtedly better sellers. Why? They are charismatic, conversationalists, and sensitive. Plus, they never give up! These qualities help identify the ladies of the group “Dios es Amor y Mi Guía” (God is Love and My Guide) and their work.

Sra. Shirley, age 63 and divorced, is a living example of a determined and invincible woman. She sells beauty products and has been in business for 13 years. Now she is the leader of two sales businesses. Shirley started working because the household finances were lacking and she needed more income to support her three children. She was able to provide them the best. Now that her children are grown, she strives to provide an education for their children and also make improvements to her home.

Shirley also sells shoes that she brings in from Trujillo. With this recent loan, she plans to travel so that she can bring back a variety of shoes.

loans.use: to purchase shoes.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 6 children. Maribel has a shop that sells detergent, snacks & bread. She has been running this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy snacks, beverages & canned goods for sale at her store.
Maribel has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In future, Maribel hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy snacks, beverages & canned goods for sale at her store.

loans.name: Wissam

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 28 years old, married and has one child.

Wissam has owned a store since 2006, selling wheels, tires and cars batteries. He has good experience and a good reputation, and he is well known in his area.

He is requesting a $2400 loan to make a sliding door and to buy a split air conditioner. He is aiming to make more profits to improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To make a sliding door and to buy a split air conditioner.

loans.name: Shem

texts.en: Shem is a thirty-year-old married man with two children. He owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in the produce business for one and a half years and he started the business with capital acquired from farming. Some of the hardships he faces are poor means of communication, and theft, but nonetheless his vision is to own a food store that can ably supply the western region of the country, and to have an educated family. Shem needs this loan to buy beans for resale.

loans.use: to buy beans for resale.

loans.name: Agarezi

texts.ru: Agarezi 40 let. On jenat i imeyet 4 detey. Seychas on jivet v Baku regione vmeste so svoyey lubimoy i bolshoy semyoy. Agarezi seychas nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN xchtobi kupit rassteniya i sajenci dlya pereprodaji. Uje 8 let kak on zanimayetsya prodajey rassteniy. Etomu biznessu on nauchilsya u svoyego druga.
texts.en: Agarezi is 40 years old.  He is married and has four children.  Currently, he lives in the Baku region together with his beloved and large family.  Agarezi needs 2000 AZN in order to buy plants and seedlings for resale.  He has been involved in selling plants for 8 years.  He learned this business from his friend.

loans.use: to buy plants and seedlings for resale

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en: Bernard is married to Catherine Nyokabi. Together they have two children who are in school. He owna a taxi at Githurai 44. He has been in the business for the past 10 years. His monthly income is 30,000 KES. This is his second loan in KADET. He repaid the earlier loan successfully. He intends to use the loan to buy another vehicle. The anticipated profits will help him educate his children and improve his family`s living standard. His ambition is to buy more taxis and buy a plot of land and develop it.

loans.use: to buy another vehicle

loans.name: Natalya

texts.ru:
Наталья живет на востоке Украины, в городе Никополе. У нее есть муж и трое взрослых детей, которые живут отдельно. Наталья торгует женской одеждой и обувью. Товар, который предлагает Наталья в своем магазинчике, больше эксклюзивный и добротный, не совсем дешевый, тем не менее, Наталья имеет своих постоянных покупателей. Шестнадцать лет назад Наталья начинала с торговли туалетными водами, а потом решила перейти на тот товар, на котором больше накрутка и стала торговать женской одеждой и обувью. На данный момент у нее в товаре около 100 000 гривен. 

Кредит в 15 000 гривен Наталья планирует вложить в закупку дополнительного количества одежды и обуви, чтобы пополнить осенний и зимний ассортимент. Благодаря успешному ведению бизнеса Наталья смогла приобрести квартиры всем своим троим детям. Заёмщица планирует и дальше развивать свою торговлю, пока хватит сил. 

Пометка: история на РУССКОМ языке
texts.en: Natalya lives in east of Ukraine, in the town of Nikopol.  She has a husband and three grown children, who live separately.  Natalya sells women's clothing and shoes.  The merchandise, that Natalya offers in her store, is more exclusive and of high quality, and not cheap.  She has loyal customers.  Ntalya started her business 16 years ago with the sales of Eu De Toilette and then decided to transition to merchandise that has the most add-on, and started to sell women's clothing and shoes.  Currently, she her merchandise is valued at 100 000 hryvnia.  Natalya plans to use the 15 000 hryvnia loan to purchase an additional inventory of clothing and shoes, in order to add to her fall and winter assortments.  Thanks to the success of her business, Natalya was able to buy apartments for all of her three children.  She plans to further develop her sales business, while she has strength to do so.

loans.use: to purchase an additional inventory of clothing and shoes, in order to add to her fall and winter assortments

loans.name: Arman

texts.en:
Arman is 25 years old. He lives in Koti village, Tavush marz, with his wife, his son and grandmother. 

Arman has a farm where he breeds pigs, turkeys, chickens and rabbits. Also he grows wheat. He sells pork, eggs, chicken and turkey meat to bulk buyers. But Arman's principal source of income is fodder threshing: his fellow villagers bring fodder to him and Arman grinds it for a fee. Thanks to his occupations Arman has been able to sustain his family, buy necessary furniture, and repair his house. 

Arman says that selling ground fodder is more profitable than just grind it for a fee. So he decided to buy a large lot of fodder, grind it and sell it. Therefore he asks for an 800,000 Armenian Dram (AMD) loan. This is Arman's third loan from Nor Horizon and he has never delayed his repayments.

loans.use: To buy and grind a large lot of fodder

loans.name: Samuel

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Boane, provincia de Maputo, sul de Moçambique, casado e pai de 4 filhos dos quais 2 ainda frequentam a Escola. Fez a 2ª classe e não continuou por falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa propria com sua família e não sustenta mais ninguem. 

É comerciante ha mais de 8 anos e tem um rendimento de cerca de 5.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Nunca teve emprestimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de amigos que tambem saõ clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu quinto emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 17.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construcao da sua casa  (barrotes, areia, pedra, ferro, e outros.) para dar continuidade a sua obra. Os primeiros emprestimos foram de: 5.000.00mt, 7.000.00mt, 10.000.00mt, e 15.000.00mt, todos  para construção da casa.
No futuro pretende solicitar mais valor no futuro para concluir a sua casa e oferecer mais conforto a sua familia e ira solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku para construir um estabelecimento comercial.
texts.en:
Samuel was born in the District of Boane, in the province of Maputo in the south of Mozambique, is the father of 4 children, 2 of whom are still in School. He completed 2nd grade and didn't continue with his education due to a lack of financial means. He lives in his own house with his family and doesn't support anyone else.

He has been a trader for more than 8 years and has a monthly income of around 5,000.00 MZN which he uses on household expenses and saves in his bank account (BIM).

He has never had loans from other banks and came to know Hluvuku through friends who are also clients of this institution. This is his fifth loan from Hluvuku for the amount of 17,000.00 MZN with which he intends to purchase construction materials for his house (beams, sand, stone, iron and others) to continue with the construction of his home. His first loans were for 5,000.00 MZN, 7,000.00 MZN, 10,000.00 MZN and 15,000.00 MZN, all for the construction of his home.

In future he intends to solicit more loans to conclude the build of his house and offer his family more comfort and he will also solicit more loans from Hluvuku to build a commercial establishment.

loans.use: purchase construction materials for his house (beams, sand, stone, iron and others)

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband, who is a rickshaw driver and wants to buy a new rickshaw. His current one has grown old and needs replacing. By purchasing a new rickshaw, he will be able to provide better quality transport services to his passengers and earn more profits. Nasreen is very confident about the success of her husband in his business after the loan investment. 

She is very supportive and sews clothes for her neighboring clients. She receives a good number of orders every month due to good quality work. She has given birth to four daughters. All of them left their education after their fifth year and started work to contribute financially to the family. She wants her eldest daughter, who is now 20 years of age, to marry in the near future. She hopes that her husband’s improved business conditions will help her to save some profits every month for that purpose.

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Nasreen.

loans.use: To buy a new rickshaw

loans.name: Adjeniya Group

texts.fr: Le groupe ADJENIYA est composé de trois membres qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe du nom de Marie est celle qui a une main levée sur la photo. Dans le but de rehausser le niveau de leur activité afin de mieux faire face à la demande de leur clientèle, ce groupe sollicite pour une première  fois, l'appui financier de ALIDé. Marie est âgée de 32 ans et est mariée à un vulgarisateur du nom de Nassirou. Le couple a deux enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Marie n’a pas fréquenté l'école. Marie  vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Depuis quatre ans, Marie vend des produits divers (savons, conserves, pâtes alimentaire, et du lait) de façon ambulante. Marie s'approvisionne dans l’un des marchés du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer leur activité et de mieux satisfaire leur clientèle, Marie et les autres membres du groupe ADJENIYA sollicitent un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
The Adjeniya group is composed of three members who reside in the same neighborhood. The representative of the group is named Mary and is raising her hand in the photo. To raise the level of their business and better meet the demand of their customers, this group is seeking for the first time a financial support from ALIDé.

Mary is 32 years old and is married to a vulcanizer named Nassirou. They have two children who both attend school and live under their care. Mary herself did not attend school. She lives together with her ​​husband and children.

For the past four years, Marie has been selling various products (soap, canned goods, pasta, and milk) as an itinerant vendor. She gets her supplies from one of the markets in Benin.

In order to strengthen their business and better serve their customers, Mary and the other Adjeniya group members are seeking a first credit loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: Buy cartons of soap, pasta, milk and canned goods

loans.name: Islom

texts.ru: Ислом трудолюбивый человек, ему 41 год. Он женат и у них четверо детей. Ислом с детства интересовался скотоводством, а когда он вырос начал заниматься этим. Более 11 лет он продолжает скотоводство и успешен в своем бизнесе. Он хочет расширить свой бизнес и получить хорошую прибыль. Он запрашивает займ в размере 5000 сомони для пополнения оборотного капитала и покупки скота.  Ислом надеется на вашу помощь, который позволяет ему улучшить благосостояние семьи.
texts.en: Islom is a hardworking man, he is 41 years old. He is married and has four children. Islom was interested in animal husbandry since childhood and when he grew up he began to do it. He does animal husbandry for more than eleven years and is successful in this business. He wants to expand it and get good profit. He is asking for a loan in the amount of 5000 somoni to refill his working capital and buy cattle. Islom hopes for your help which will let him improve the livelihood of his family.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Monat

texts.ru: Монат жительница города Исфара. Возраст, 43 года. Образование – среднее. Замужем. У нее трое детей. Она более семи лет занимается производством. Монат печет лепешки для продажи. Кредит берет для закупа муки.
texts.en: Monat lives in the city of Isfara. She has finished high school and is 43 years old. Monat is married and has three children. For the last seven years she has been working as a baker, making traditional Tajik bread for sale. Monat is taking out this loan to purchase a big batch of flour wholesale.

loans.use: top purchase flour

loans.name: Vann

texts.en: Vann, 57, is a widower and resides with four children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. He is a farmer. All of his children are employed as garment workers. Vann requests a loan of 600 USD to purchase a motorbike for his children to drive to work. By doing so, his children can easily go to work on time. In the future, he would like to run a sewing shop for his children to sew at home and build a bathroom.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for his children to drive to work

loans.name: Buuraima

texts.ru: Буурайма  проживает в селе Кичи Айдаркен  на юге Кыргызстана со своей семьей с четыремя детьми, младшему из которых один год. Как и многие семьи в сельской  местности,   Буурайма с мужем откармливают скот, начав этот бизнес в 2001 году. Начав со стартовой суммы в 3,000 сом (KGS), Буурайма на сегодняшний день  в своем хозяйстве имеет 4 головы дойных коров, что позволяет получать около 4,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи молочных продуктов.  В целях увеличения удоя и дальнейшего расширения бизнеса,   Буурайма обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дойных коров.  Доходы   Буурайма  планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота.
texts.en: Buuraima lives in the Kichi Aydarken village in the south of Kyrgyzstan together with her family of four children, the youngest of whom is one years old.  Much like many other families in the rural locale, Buuraima and her husband fatten up livestock, after starting this business in 2001.  Having used an initial sum of 3,000 som (KGS) to start the business, today the business has four dairy cows, which allows Buuraima to earn about 4,000 som (KGS) per month from the sales of dairy products.  In order to increase milk production and further expand her business, Buuraima requested a loan in the sum of 70,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to purchase dairy cows.  She plans to invest the profits from this loan into further increasing livestock headcount.

loans.use: to purchase dairy cows

loans.name: Kiwambi Cha Amani Ilela Group

texts.en:
Dastan is a 44 year-old father of six children and three are attending secondary education. He is hardworking and has been producing maize, beans, cassava and coffee for over 26 years. He faces farming problems due to a lack of fertilizers and crop diseases.

Dastan is looking for working capital in order to purchase fertilizers and insecticides. In the next five years, he wishes to improve his scale of production from 10 to 21 acres which can lead to more income which can repair his family home, pay for school fees and cover medical expenses.

The Amani Ilela group had five members but two of them have passed away. Currently there are only three members.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizers and insecticides.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Mercedes works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending.  Mercedes is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell for her general store business.

Mercedes has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell at her general store

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 44-year-old married woman. She has two children with ages ranging from 12 years to 18 years. She describes herself to be a confident woman.

She operates a poultry business in which she sells chickens. She has been involved in this business for one year and employs one staff member. Her business is located at a strategic area, and her primary customers are local residents. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. She will use the 12,900 Kenyan shillings loan to buy a solar lamp, which will be used by her family members. Her business goal is to be a supplier of chickens to customers within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will run a butcher shop.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es: El señor Cesar es nacido en la comunidad de Murmuntani de la Provincia de Tiraque del Departamento de Cochabamba, actualmente es natural de lugar y vive junto a su esposa que tienen un hijo menor a su custodia, actualmente está viviendo en su casa de su abuelito que a un todavía no tienen casa propia, los clientes manifiestan que en los próximos años construirán su propia casa, por el momento están viviendo por cuidar a su abuelo que son de tercera edad y también le están ayudando en su trabajo a su abuelo. El cliente en realidad se dedica a la actividad agrícola como decía anteriormente trabajan junto a su abuelito en sus terrenos, al mismo tiempo el crédito que están solicitando es para comprar los insumos agrícolas para sembrar este año.
texts.en:
Cesar was born in the Murmuntani community in the Tiraque province of the Cochabamba department and currently lives there along with his wife and their young child.  He is currently living in his grandfather's house since he does not have his own house.  He says that in the next few years he will build his own house, but for now he is helping care for his grandfather who is elderly and helping him with his work.  

Cesar works as a farmer.  He used to work together with his grandfather on his land.  He is requesting this loan to purchase farming supplies to plant this year.

loans.use: to purchase farming supplies.

loans.name: Alan Aleksander

texts.es:
Alan tiene 27 años de edad y le encanta jugar futbol con sus vecinos y amigos del barrio cuando tiene un tiempito libre, ya que el trabaja muy duro día a día ya que con el fruto de su trabajo puede apoyar a sus padres con los gastos del hogar. Alan tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de arroz por sacos y ofrece sus productos en un espacio afuera de su vivienda, él le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 10 horas y puede atender hasta 8 clientes diariamente, el cree que está saliendo adelante con su trabajo porque es muy amable con los clientes. 

Alan está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar mas mercadería para su negocio ( arroz por sacos) ya que tiene varios pedidos de clientes; de esta manera el podrá mejorar sus ingresos y seguir luchando por hacer realidad su mas grande sueño:” Tener un local propio para su negocio”.
texts.en:
Alan is 27 years old and loves to play soccer with his friends and neighbors when he has free time since he works hard every day.  He uses his income to help his parents with their household expenses.  Alan has a small business selling sacks of rice and other products in a space outside his home.  He works at his business around 10 hours a day and can assist up to eight customers a day.  He believes that his work is doing well because he is nice to his customers.  

Alan is very thankful to the Kiva lenders since their help will allow him to purchase more merchandise (sacks of rice) for his business since he has orders from some customers.  This will allow him to improve his income and continue working toward making his greatest dream a reality: to have a store for his business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of rice.

loans.name: Galawezh

texts.en:
Galawezh, is a 48 years old widow woman mother of two . After her husband’s death she had no source of income to support her family. Fortunately she had an old sewing machine to work on; she gained an excellent reputation in the neighborhood, thanks to the quality of her work and affordable prices.
She took a 1800$ loan to buy new sewing machine and renovate her workplace to increase her profit.
She is aiming to grow her business and increase her profits .
The story of Galawezh and her business is just one of the many examples of Izdiharona for economic development clients .
She preferred to blur her face for cultural reason.

loans.use: to buy sewing machine  and renovate her workplace.

loans.name: Sour's Group

texts.en: Sour’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Sour makes a living cultivating rice and raising pigs to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Wilmer

texts.en:
My name is Wilmer G.. I sell used clothing for ladies, gentlemen and children. I´ve had my business for 3 years. I have lots of good clients since the products I sell are of good quality. My business generates income to support my family. My goal is to increase my inventory in order to sell more and with the earnings that I obtain to be able to rent a storefront in order to open my business in a place with more customer traffic.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, a Kiva volunteer.

Mi nombre es Wilmer G. me dedico a la venta de ropa usada para dama, caballero y niños, tengo mi negocio hace unos 3 años, mis clientes son muy buenos ya que el producto que vendo es de muy buena calidad, mi negocio me genera ingresos para sustentar mi familia, mi meta es incrementar mis inventarios y asi tener una mejor venta y con las ganancias que obtenga poder alquilar un local para abrir mi negocio en un lugar de mayor movimiento.

loans.use: Purchase of used clothing for ladies, gentlemen and children.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is married with four children. She also takes care of her mother; her dad died five years ago.

Amina sells different kinds of snacks to various restaurants in the Ilala district of Dar es Salaam. These snacks include samosas, buns, sausages, eggs, and the like. She has been in this business for six years now. She has regular customers for her products. Sometimes she prepares snacks for ceremonies like weddings, baptisms and holy communions. She recently forecast a demand increase for her products from her regular customers. She wants to subsidize her working capital with USD400 to meet the rising demand.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase and selling of cereals (rice)

loans.name: Ángela

texts.es:
Angela is a married mother of three. Her husband works as a security guard in San Juanito, in the Mexican state of Chihuahua, which is where they are from. Angela wants her children to have a good education, something which would be impossible with only her husband's salary, so seven years ago she decided to start her own business selling shoes. She started with a small amount of merchandise, but little by little she has increased her sales.

Now, in order to grow and reinvigorate her business, Angela is requesting a loan of $650, which she will use to purchase more shoes so she can offer a wider selection and better service to her customers. She plans to repay the loan in just a month. Help Angela and her family by contributing to her business. They are very grateful for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Ángela es casada y tiene tres hijos, su esposo trabaja como velador en la localidad de San Juanito, Chihuahua, de donde son originarios. Ángela desea que sus hijos puedan tener una buena educación, lo que sería imposible solo con el salario que recibe su esposo, por esto decidió iniciar su propio negocio vendiendo zapatos hace siete años, empezó con muy poca mercancía pero poco a poco se han estado incrementando sus ventas.

Ahora para hacer crecer su negocio y darle un nuevo impulso Ángela solicita un préstamo de $ 650 dólares que destinará a la compra de mercancía, con lo que podrá ofrecer una mayor variedad a sus clientes y mejorar su servicio, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en sólo un mes. Ayuda a esta familia contribuyendo al crecimiento de su negocio, ellos agradecen mucho la confianza y apoyo que les brindas.

loans.use: Purchase shoes

loans.name: María Margarita

texts.en:
Maria is a 57 year old single mother. She supports her son with her small restaurant while he attends university studying engineering. 
She started her business 8 years ago, but hasn´t always worked in food industry. She used to work in high fashion as a seamstress for 30 years. However, the long history of wars, dictators (particularly that of Alfredo Stroessner which lasted 30 years), and corruption left the Paraguayan economy in shambles, and for lack of work Maria was forced to give up her passion to support her family. 
	Maria dreams of one day returning to the fashion industry. For now she is trying to be as successful as possible with her restaurant so that she can save to buy sewing machines to begin working in her field once again. She is requesting this loan to purchase more food for the restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase more food

loans.name: Ni Kadek

texts.id:
