After marrying Putu Eka Susanta, Ni Kadek A. started a small kiosk in front of her home. SHe chose this business since there were no other kiosks in the neighborhood. SHe sells vatious snack items, ice, coffee, etc. Every day, Ni Kadek A. opens the kiosk at 7 am and closes at 6 pm. SInce the kiosk is in front of her home, Ni Kadek A. cna still take on additional small projects when business is quiet. Ni Kadek A. joined DINARI Foundation to get funding and training assistance on the advice of her sister. The loan will be used to increase her kiosk's working capital so she can offer more goods and increase the variety of her offerings. With $175 loan, Ni Kadek A. expects to increase her profit up to $2 a day. She hopes this business would expand faster in the future.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

Setelah menikah dengan Putu Eka Susanta, suaminya, Ni Kadek A. mulai membuka warung kecil di depan rumahnya. Usaha ini dipilih karena tempat dimana Ni Kadek A. tinggal, tidak ada usaha warung yang menjadi saingannya. Barang yang dijual aneka macam makanan kecil , es, kopi dan lain - lain. Setiap hari Ni Kadek A. membuka warung pada pukul 07.00 wita dan tutup pada pukul 18.00 wita. Karena warung ada didepan rumahnya maka Ni Kadek A. dapat mengambil pekerjaan dirumahnya apabila warung tidak ada pelanggan. Melalui informasi dari saudaranya Ni Kadek A. akhirnya bergabung dengan Yayasan DINARI dan menjadi salah satu binaannya dan mendapat dana pinjaman. Dengan dana tersebut dipakai untuk menambah modal usaha warungnya. Menambah dan melengkapi jenis variasi jenis barang dagangannya. Dengan pinjaman Rp.1.500.000.- Ni Kadek A. dapat memperoleh keuntungan bersih mencapai Rp.20.000,- setiap harinya. Usaha warung ini ditekuninya dengan harapan kedepannya warung dapat lebih meningkat dan lebih besar lagi.

loans.use: Increase capital to increase shop offering

loans.name: Dionicio

texts.es:
Mr. Dionisio J. lives in his home in the Villa Ingenio zone of the city of El Alto with his wife and 3 children. He’s a construction worker for a private contruction company in his city. With the help of 4 previous loans, he was able to build 4 rooms in his home. He is requesting this latest loan in order to construct 2 additional rooms, which will ultimately be used to open a small general store, thus creating an additional source of income for the family that will improve their standard of living. This is the fifth time he is requesting a loan, and his socioeconomic analysis (credit check) favorably qualifies him to take out an additional loan.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Dionisio J. vive en casa propia en la zona de Villa Ingenio de la Ciudad de El Alto con su esposa y sus tres hijos; el señor Dionicio trabaja como obrero constructor en construcciones privadas en su ciudad. Con los créditos anteriores (cuatro) realizaron la construcción de cuatro habitaciones que forman parte del proyecto de su vivienda. El crédito solicitado será destinado a la construcción de dos habitaciones cuyo fin es el de instalar una tienda de barrio con la que podrán generar una fuente de ingresos que mejorará sus condiciones de vida. Esta es la quinta ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un crédito

loans.use: Construction of 2 rooms to be used as a general store

loans.name: Boimatov

texts.en: Boimatov A. lives in Spitamen, Tajikistan. He is married and has 3 children. Boimatov A. has been the client of MicroInvest since 2007. H has  recommended himself as a serious and strongly motivated client who trusts the MicroInvest loan procedures.  Mr. Boimatov A. is very experienced in business (about 8 years) and it is the family business. He is engaged in the business of  livestock raising and selling and milk production. He dreams of purchasing a horn pedigree bull and milk cow for  further meat and milk goods production (to supply to the bazaars). It is planned to include an assortment of milk products such as pasteurized milk, sour milk, sour cream, curd and etc. Now Mr. Boimatov A. requests a loan of $500 for  business development that would permit him to increase significantly his family income and to improve the existing business.

loans.use: for business development

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase her stock of clothing for sale

loans.name: Rahma's Mkombozi. Group

texts.en:
Rahma is 29 years old and is a married woman with three children, ages 13,10 and 8 years old. Rahma owns a small charcoal store that she started in 2006. Her store also carries food items for sale. Everyday, she works from 7am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $170 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items and charcoal for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing in grocery and salon.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Ly

texts.en: Mrs. Ly P., 28, is married with two school-aged children and lives with her husband in Siem Reap province, Cambodia. She works selling fish and Khmer noodles on the road side of her village, making on average around $2.50 per day of net income. Her husband is a carpenter and typically makes about $2.50 each day too. Mrs. Ly P. has lately requested a loan to purchase more fish to expand her inventory and the remainder of the loan she would like to use to buy a motor-bike to use for business transportation. (She is pictured with a motor-bike she hopes to buy.)

loans.use: To purchase a motor-bike to use for business transportation

loans.name: Faraja Group

texts.en: These are the seven members of the Faraja group in Mbagala, a Dar es Salaam city suburb.  They are a group of grandmothers who take care of orphans. They weave and make candles and sell them to supermarkets. The income generated helps them to sustain a living and send their grandchildren to school. They are in need of a loan to help them expand their business.

loans.use: Expand business

loans.name: Youb

texts.en:
Youb S., 44, is a widowed farmer who supplements her income selling used clothes in her village and earns around $3 per day. She lives with one child in Pealnhek I Village, Pursat Province. Her child attends primary school.

S. is seeking a loan to purchase fertilizer for her farming business and use the remainder of the loan to purchase more used clothes to sell. These funds will help sustain and expand her businesses to meet growing local demand. She hopes that the Kiva loan will allow her to increase her income and thereby improve living conditions for her and her child.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for her farming business as well as used clothes for her clothing sales business

loans.name: Fotima

texts.ru:
Fotima A. lives in the Gissar district. She is 55 years old, married and has five children. To support her big family, Fotima sells cold beverages. She has a retail outlet where fountain and bottled beverages are sold. She would like to purchase an ice-cream refrigerator in order to increase her business profit. Fotima wants to obtain a 12-month loan for this purpose.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina, Kiva Volunteer.

Абдухоликова Фотима жительница района Гиссар. Возраст 55 лет. Замужем и имеет пятерых детей. Для того , чтобы прокормить семью, а она у них большая , Фотима торгует холодными напитками. Имеет торговую точку , где прдает напитки на разлив и бутылками. Для того, чтобы увеличить прибыльность бизнеса она хочет купить холодильник для хранения мороженного. Для этой цели Фотима хочет получить кредить сроком на 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase a refrigerator

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen is 59 years old. Her famiL. currentL. lives in Ning Gian, Hai Duong. Besides income from raising livestock, they also do business selilng poultry at the market. Everyday her husband, a retired government worker, helps her butcher and prepare the poultry so she can sell it to the market-goers to use. Two of her three children are grown and help their parents in their free time. Not onL. does the famiL. sell poultry at the market, but they also deliver to customers’ houses; therefore they employ one person with a salary of more than 1,000,000 VND a month. With her husband’s pension, the famiL.’s income is very stable at 5,000,000 VND a month. In this round of funding she is requesting 15,000,000 VND to continue investing in the poultry business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi Nguyen, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Lý năm nay 59 tuổi, gia đình chị hiện đang sống tại huyện Ninh Giang Tỉnh Hải Dương. Ngoài thu nhập từ chăn nuôi, hiện nay gia đình chị đang kinh doanh gia cầm tại chợ. Hàng ngày chồng chị - một cán bộ hưư trí thường giúp đỡ chị giết mổ gia cầm để chị bán cho người tiêu dung. Hai trong số ba người con của chị đã lớn và có thể phụ giúp cho anh chị trong lúc rảnh rỗi. Không chỉ bán gia cầm tại chợ gia đình chị còn phục vụ cho khách hàng mua tại nhà vì thế gia đình chị hiện đang có một người làm thuê với mức thu nhập trên 1.000.000đ/ tháng. Cùng với lương hưu của chồng thu nhập của gia đình chị rất ổn định 5.000.000 / tháng. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 15.000.000đ để tiếp tục đầu tư vốn vào kinh doanh gia cầm.

loans.use: Invest in business

loans.name: Ou

texts.en: Ou K., 29, is a widow living in Siem Reap that sells grocery products out of her home for US$7 per day in income. She lives with her younger sister who is employed at a nearby hospital. Ou K. has asked CREDIT for a loan of US$1000 to purchase more grocery products to meet her growing customer demand and diversify her product options. She would like to continue expanding her business in the future, as well, and sees this loan as only the first step in improving her enterprise.

loans.use: Increase grocery inventory

loans.name: Gaagay Group

texts.fr: Palmarin  (http://www.sem-fund.org/palmarinfr.php) étant une zone d’élevage extensif et vu l’abondance du tapis herbacé et l’abondance de plants fourragères, le Gie Gaagay s’est fixé comme objectif de revaloriser la race bovine et ovine. Le prêt acquis, ils vont acheter des animaux à bas prix, les engraisser  et les revendre surtout aux moments de fêtes de Tabaski (Aîd El kabir). Après cette période de fête, et comme ce sera la saison sèche, ils vont créer des réserves fourragères pour vendre du foin aux populations environnantes
texts.en:
Palmarin (http://www.sem-fund.org/palmarinfr.php) is an area of extensive livestock raising and in view of the abundance of grasslands and plants that serve as fodder, the Gaagay group has decided to have excellence in cattle and sheep raising as its aim.

Assuming the loan request is granted, they will buy animals at a low price, fatten them, and then re-sell them at the period of feast days (Tabaski or Aîd el Kabir: the Muslim feast of the sacrifice). After the feast days this year, it will be the dry season, so they are going to create reserves of fodder so as to sell hay to the neighboring people.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: fattening livestock for sale

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es: Sofía tiene 35 años, vive con sus hijos. Ella tiene un talento especial para elaborar bellos trabajos de bordados de  fustanes folklóricos de su zona, desde niña lo viene haciendo, su trabajo consiste en diseñar previamente el motivo o imagen, para luego realizar los bordados, tendiendo sumo cuidado en la combinación de colores que usará, es por ello que es muy importante la calidad de hilos que utiliza para poder tener un acabado de calidad, se dedica a esta labor casi todo el día, además de la crianza de animales de corral, sin descuidar el cuidado de sus 3 hijos que están estudiando. Sofía trabaja motivada por ser un sostén para su hogar.  Solicita un préstamo para la compra de hilos y telas para sus bordados, además, para la compra de lana, porque también se dedica al tejido de chompas a palito.
texts.en:
Sofía, 35, lives with her children. She has a special talent creating beautiful embroidery on local folk skirts, which she has been doing since she was a girl. Her work includes first designing the image or motif, then creating the embroidery, using extreme care in the combination of colors she will use. For her, the quality of thread she uses is very important in order to have a quality product. She spends almost all day at this work, as well as raising animals in pens, without neglecting the care of her 3 school-age children. Sofía is motivated to work to support her household. She is requesting a loan to buy threads and fabrics for her embroideries, as well as to purchase yarn, because she also weaves patterned sweaters.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of materials for her embroidery.

loans.name: Ilhomjon

texts.en: Ilhomjon A. is a good father, hard-working farmer, and is steadfast in his endeavor of raising animals. Thanks to his wife’s assistance, he is able to raise and feed the animals and prepare them for sale at both fairs and marketplaces in nearby towns. Traveling to nearby towns increases his costs, but the increase is offset by the higher price he is able to command. Ilhomjon would now like to increase the amount of cattle and is requesting a loan in the amount of 1500 Somoni ($ 450 USD). He promises to be responsible and prompt in repaying it.

loans.use: To purchase more cattle to expand the business.

loans.name: Karen Del Carmen

texts.es:
La Sr. Karen tiene 24 años de edad, habita en el  barrio Laureles Norte, casada,  su esposo trabaja como operario en una empresa, tiene dos preciosos hijos de 6 meses y 4 años de edad, los planes para su familia es mejorar el nivel de vida ofreciéndole a sus hijos un futuro diferente.
Doña Karen posee su pequeño negocio de comida desde hace dos años lo inicio con fondos propios y ahora ya esta estable en el campo de comercialización. Sus objetivos en el ámbito económico es incrementar sus ventas, aumentar el local generando mayores ganancias para el benefició del hogar. Gracias a los préstamos de Afodenic lograr comprar materia prima, para seguir ofertando sus ricos platos y variados de comida, también  podrá comprar utensilios y otras inversiones que crearan mayores fuentes de trabajo.
texts.en:
Karen is 24 years old and married, and her husband works as an operator. They live in a neighborhood known as Laureles Norte and have two beautiful children, a 6 month old and a 4 year old. The couple hopes to improve their quality of life so that they can offer their children a brighter future. Two years ago, and with her own savings, Karen began a small business selling meals. Now she has a stable shop at a commercial center, but would love to see her business grow. Her goals are to increase her sales and to expand her shop, so that she can bring more money home for her family. With Afodenic's help, she will buy the raw ingredients for her delicious meals, so that she can continue to offer a varied menu. She will also buy some utensils and invest the money in ways that will help her expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy ingredients for meals

loans.name: Teang

texts.en:
Mrs. Teang L., 47, is married with two children and works on her rice paddy growing rice and some other crops. She started her farming activity in 1980. With her daily business activity, she can earn around $6.50/day of income.
Her husband works as a broker buying cattle and reselling them for a profit, making around $2.50 each day of income. Teang L. and her husband would like to request a loan from KIVA to purchase more cattle to generate more profit to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more cattle to resell for more profit.

location.town: Tboung Kmum district, Kampong Cham province, Cambo

loans.name: Natavan

texts.en: Natavan is an internally displaced person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, in the Kalbadjar region, and is settled in the town of Xirdalan. She was born in 1981 and is single. Three years ago she opened her general store. Now she needs a loan of 950 AZN to buy foodstuffs for improving her business.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Hay Dee

texts.en:
Hay Dee P. is a resident of Calamagui 1st village. She is 35 years old and married to Jojit, 40 years old, a driver in their village. They have been blessed with 3 children namely: Analiza - 15 years old, studying third year high school; Judy - 12 years old, studying first year high school; and John Mark - 5 years old. The family has good relationships and respect their elders.

Hay Dee manages a buy and sell business of charcoal in their village. She wishes to receive a loan in the amount of PHP6,000 as additional capital for her business. Hay Dee needs to work hard and strives to increase her daily income, so she can help her husband with their motorcycle transport monthly amortization, and send their children to school. She aims for a successful business and hopes for its development. Doing her best towards the development of her business is a great challenge for her. She wants to become productive in her business undertakings.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en:
Mrs. Ruby S. is a resident of Laredico, which is 5 kilometers from Quezon, where commercial gasoline stations are found. Mrs. S. decided to open a gas station in Laredico to serve the people there. The majority of people work and ride "habal-habal," or on a passenger single type motorcycle.

Mrs. S.'s husband sells electronics in their neighborhood.

She would like to apply for a loan of PHP 5,000 so she can purchase gasoline to sell. She will also use the loan to pay for a subscription to a network service that lists her as a retailer. This will be her first loan from HSPFI, a KIVA partner.

loans.use: To purchase gallons of gasoline to sell

loans.name: Sharifa

texts.en:
For the last year and a half, Sharifa has made a living running a hardware store in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar. She belongs to the Asaakher loan group, and currently earns an average monthly profit of $90. She works at her business for 12 hours a day.

She has applied for her second loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more used TVs, radios and bicycles to sell to her customers. She hopes that this loan will allow her to increase her profits, grow her business and save money for future use.  

Sharifa is 24 years old, married, and has three children. She also cares for two other dependents.

loans.use: To buy more used TVs, radios and bicycles to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Everilda

texts.es: Everilda tiene 21 años, vive con su hijo, su madre y su hermano en una casa alquilada. Hace 3 años tomó la decisión de comprar animales y venderlos en las principales ferias ganaderas de su zona, para ello cuenta con el apoyo incondicional de su madre y su hermano  para la atención y transporte de su ganado. Los animales que vende principalmente son vaquillonas y ovejas, en algunas ocasiones cerdos, las ventas se realizan generalmente los fines de semana, cuando Everilda dispone de todo el día hasta que termine todas las ventas. Gracias a los esfuerzos constantes en este negocio, ella puede sostener las necesidades de su casa y tiene planes de poder conseguir un terreno propio donde pueda hacer su casa y su establo para los animales que va a comprar y luego vender. Esta es la segunda vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y está muy contenta y satisfecha de ser parte de este grupo humano porque es un buen espacio de amistad. El dinero que solicita es para invertirlo en la compra de dos toretes.
texts.en:
Everilda is 21 years old and lives with her son, mother and brother in a rented house. Three years ago, she decided to buy animals and sell them at the major livestock markets of her area. To do this, she counts on the unconditional support of her mother and brother who help her tend to and transport her game. The animals she sells are primarily cows and sheep and, on some occasions, pigs. She realizes her sales mostly on weekends, when Everilda sets out all day until she completes every sale. Thanks to her constant efforts toward the business she can sustain the household, and has plans to buy her own land to build a house and livestock stable. This is the second time she’s turned to MFP for a loan, and she is very happy to be part of this group that is such a support and filled with friendship. The funds that she requests are for the purchase of two young bulls.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase two young bulls.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys A. is a trader who sells maize, groundnuts and beans at Yamoransa in Cape Coast. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a security guard.

Gladys has been selling maize, groundnuts and beans since 2000. She is responsible for paying school fees, utilities and clothes. Her loan will be used to purchase more food supplies for selling. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to buy land.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy more food supplies for selling.

loans.name: Oyuntuya

texts.en:
Oyuntuya D. lives with her husband and three children in the Bayanzurh district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The two oldest children are university students in the city and the youngest son goes to a local kindergarten.

Oyuntuya has a small business selling food. She rents a stall in the local food market and sells various food products, mostly half/un-processed poultry products. She started her business in 1993 with the help of her husband. She is an authorized seller of chicken products from Bohog Od, one of the largest poultry companies.

In the future, she would like to expand her business and make sure that she leaves a successful business for her children. She requests a loan to purchase more products from Bohog Od for her business.

loans.use: To purchase poultry products from poultry companies for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase four sewing machines and rent a workshop

loans.name: Ni Made Kursini

texts.en:
Ni Made Kursini - (DNR.M-0583) is a 54-year-old woman living in the town of Palasari - Melaya. She is married and has 2 school-aged children. To making a living, Ni Made Kursini owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Ni Made Kursini has been engaged in this business for over 4 years and earns approximately 350,000 Indonesian rupiahs (about $350 US) a month from these activities.

In 2008, Ni Made Kursini joined DINARI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ni Made Kursini is requesting for the first time a loan from DINARI. She is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 rupiahs which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell. Ni Made Kursini plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.

About DINARI:

The mission of DINARI is to strive for the preservation of the environment, to empower the poor, and to provide socio-economic development opportunities to small business owners.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

Ni Made Kursini - (DNR.M-0583) merupakan 54 tahun wanita. Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Palasari - Melaya. Dia (perempuan) menikah dan memiliki 2 anak usia sekolah. Untuk membiayai hidup, Ni Made Kursini memiliki & menjalankan usaha. Bisnis beroperasi di sektor pertanian. Tujuan utama bisnis tersebut adalah memelihara ternak. Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual. Ni Made Kursini sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 4 tahun. Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Ni Made Kursini menghasilkan sekitar 350,000 IDR sebulan.

Dalam 2008, Ni Made Kursini bergabung DINARI untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis. Ni Made Kursini telah berhasil melunasi pinjaman sebelumnya dari DINARI. Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 3,000,000 IDR. Pinjaman saat ini akan digunakan untuk untuk membeli bibit ternak untuk dibesarkan & dijual di masa mendatang. Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 1st pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari DINARI. Ni Made Kursini berencana untuk menggunakan pendapatan tambahan yang dihasilkan dari bisnis untuk mendukung keuangan anggota keluarga langsung peminjam.

Tentang DINARI:

Misi DINARI adalah memperjuangkan kelestarian lingkungan, memberdayakan kaum miskin, dan menyediakan kesempatan pembangunan sosial ekonomi bagi pemilik usaha kecil.

*Catatan: Untuk memaksimalkan efisiensi & menurunkan biaya, pinjaman ini ditempelkan menggunakan templat sehingga dapat diterjemahkan otomatis oleh Kiva. . Mengingat bahwa terjemahan manual atas profil memakan biaya besar, Kiva menciptakan templat ini untuk Mitra Lapangan untuk memungkinkan mereka terus menempelkan pinjaman dalam Bahasa sambil memberikan informasi yang bermutu & akurat kepada para pemberi pinjaman Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise & sell

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
ELSA C., is 50 years old, married with 5 adult children, and lives in Purok Kakahuyan, Brgy. Daga in the outskirts of Cadiz City, Negros Occidental.

Elsa and her husband have been ambulant fish and crab vendors for the past 15 years and this earns them on the average, PHP 5,000 per month.

In 2000, she joined NWTF-Project Dungganon, and the loans that she borrowed over the past nine years have had a great impact in stabilizing the financial situation of their family.

Now on her 13th loan cycle, she wants to use the PHP 11,000.00 additional capital to increase their volume capacity in the fish and crab vending business to enable them help financially support immediate members of her family.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: additional capital for the borrower's fish and crab vending business

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
Estelita hails from the mountainous city of Antipolo in the province of Rizal in the Philippines. Her business partner is her husband, Ricardo, who is 54 years old. Estelita is the mother of two sons and three daughters, all of whom are grown. But the urge to strive for a living and to get out from poverty is still burning within her.

Her aspiration to cut the rope of poverty that ties her way to success caused her to join ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and Kiva partner in the Philippines, in 2004. She has applied her loans toward her fried chicken business. Specifically, she buys chickens, cleans and fries them, and sells the prepared food in the village. She even sometimes receives orders from other villages. This business has brought her enough income to support her family.

Now on her eighth loan, Estelita has requested a loan of 30,000 as additional capital for her fried chicken sales business. Part of the loan will also be used to finance her secondary business: she runs a general store where she sells such items as rice, charcoal, and meat. She been operating the business for several years and is hopeful that her business will continue to prosper.

Her aspiration is to expand her business and she dreams of having a space in the market someday. She also hopes to have a bigger and more durable house built on her own lot.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her fried chicken sales business as well as for her general store.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is a 30-year-old mother of three. A boutique owner and a landlady for the past nine years, Emily owns three rooms in the Mukuru slums which she rents out both as residences and small-business spaces. She describes herself as diligent and quiet, yet jovial.

Emily is requesting a loan of 60,000 KES in order to stock her boutique with new clothes. She hopes to educate her children and build a better home for them.

Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing access to financial opportunities. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: To add new stock to her boutique.

loans.name: Loko Masama Group

texts.en:
These are members of the Loko Group. They are Mamsusu K., Mamusu B. B. and Marie S.. They are all residence of Waterloo small town, twenty-two miles from Freetown. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva. These entrepreneurs sell different type of goods but their businesses have been developing at a very low pace due to the lack of capital. With SMT opening a new branch in Waterloo in partner with Shine on Sierra Leone, they have come to solicit a loan of Le 1,500,000 in order to help improve their businesses and living standards

Mamusu K. (left) is the leader of this group. She is approximately age thirty-six, born in Loko Massama, Port Loko district, in northern Sierra Leone. She is married to a building contractor and they still have no children. Mamusu sells cotton and has been in this business for more than ten years now.

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Danaya. Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre membres du groupe Danaya sont tous des femmes mariées  ayant en moyenne  40 ans, 3 enfants et  vivant la plupart dans des familles monogames à Mancourani II un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative de la république du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et sont à leur troisième  prêt de groupe, tous les prêts antérieurs se sont  bien dénoués. 
Elles font comme activité l’achat et  la vente d’atiecké, de savons modernes et de médicaments. 
Avec leur nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter, 100kg d’atiecké, 20 cartons de savons modernes et 4 emballages de médicaments.  Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché de Sikasso ville et effectuent leurs ventes à domicile, dans les marchés et dans les quartiers de façon ambulante, au comptant  souvent à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 32.500 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour l’épargne et les besoins de la famille; l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
Elles ambitionnent avoir plus de capitaux pour mieux satisfaire leurs clientèles et  pouvoir aménager un point de vente.

loans.use: Achat d’articles divers.

loans.name: Okunola

texts.en: V. is 51 years old and married with four children. She is into the rentals service business. She has been in the business for the past five years. She hopes for a loan of N80,000 to purchase more chairs and tables to rent. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more chairs and tables to rent.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: La Señora Maria Elena tiene la edad de 30 años. La actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 5 años que posee este negocio. La ubicación de su negocio es de manera ambulante ya que es la única manera de mostrar su mercadería. Por lo que sus inicios surgen con muy poco capital,  y con fondos propios pero con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Por lo que tenía que pagar las cuentas de su vivienda y además buscar el alimento diario. Poco a poco fue incrementando su inventario con las pocas ganancias que su negocio le generaba, hasta que se le presento la oportunidad de trabajar con Fundación León 2000. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de pantalones, camisas, faldas y camisetas. Su mayor sueño es seguir con vida para mantener esta actividad.
texts.en:
Señora Maria Elena is 30 years of age. For work, she sells various products. She has had her business for more than 5 years. She is a street vendor because this is the only way to show her merchandise. She started with very few resources with her own funds but she has a great desire to get ahead as she has to pay the bills for her housing and food. Little by little she has increased her inventory with the little earnings her business generates. It was not until now that she was presented with the opportunity to work with Fundación León 2000. The loan she requests is for business capital for the purchase of pants, shirts, skirts, and t-shirts. Her greatest dream is to continue her business.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Joelita

texts.en:
Mrs. Joelita E. is married, 42 years old, and has 9 school-aged children. A resident of Banisilon, Aloran, Misamis Occidental, she grows corn, bananas and root crops and sells them at the market and even to her neighbors.

In 2005, Joelita joined Paglaum MPC because of their programs and services, and she is now applying for her 9th loan amounting to 3,000 PHP as additional capital to purchase fertilizer for corn, banana and root crop production. This purpose is to make her plants grow faster, healthy, and have a good harvest.

She wishes for her children to finish their studies and to be able to renovate their house for comfortable living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her corn

loans.name: Twekwatire Wamu Matumba Zaituni Group

texts.en:
Zaituni M.  is thirty-seven years old, married with seven children of whom six are in school. She is also taking care of four dependents who are orphans and schooling too. She sells new shoes to children and to both men and women. Zaituni will use the loan to purchase and improve stock . Zaituni is a very hardworking business woman whose future plan is to obtain enough capital to enlarge her business.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.

loans.use: To purchase new shoes for ladies, gents and kids.

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana is forty-five years old. She is married and has given birth to five children who are all schooling. She lives with the family in a rented apartment in a fishing community in the central region of Ghana.

Diana works hard to help her husband provide for the family. She is a fishmonger. She buys directly from the fishermen in her community, smokes the fish, and supplies to other retailers and food vendors. Diana has been in business for over twenty years and yearns to increase her stock. It is her desire to give all her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy fresh fish to smoke and sell

loans.name: Shaloon Group

texts.es:
El grupo Shaloon está integrado por María Antonia F. S.,  Sonia Teresa M., Cándida Rosa J. P., Judith Raquel S. S. y Maura del Carmen Velásquez ellas son mujeres trabajadoras que desde muy jóvenes han tenido que laborar arduamente.

María Antonia F. S. de 54 años empezó hace 30 años vendiendo ajeno ahora ella misma produce las cajetas con ayuda de sus hijas.Mientras Judith Raquel S. S. de 28 años se dedica hacer y vender cajeta desde niña cuyo negocio ha ido de generacion en generación

En cambio Sonia Teresa M. vende productos de la Avon, ropa interior y hace ropa y manteles tejidos, Cándida Rosa J. P. hace pan y nacatamales los fines de semana y Maura del Carmen Velásquez vende comida en el mercado de Masaya.
texts.en:
The Shaloon Group consists of María Antonia F. S., Sonia Teresa M., Cándida Rosa J. P., Judith Raquel S. S. and Maura del Carmen Velásquez, who have all been hard-working women since they were very young. María Antonia is 54 years old and started selling sweets 30 years ago. She makes her products herself with the help of her daughters. Meanwhile, Judith Raquel is 28 years old and also makes and sells sweets, which she has done since she was a little girl. It is a business that has been handed down from generation to generation in her family. Sonia Teresa, on the other hand, sells Avon products and undergarments and also makes clothing and woven tablecloths. Cándida Rosa makes bread and tamales on the weekend, and Maura del Carmen sells food in the Masaya market.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies such as milk, sweets and firewood

loans.name: Alamos Group

texts.es:
El Banco D. Emprendimiento ALAMOS, es una asociacion D. la zona D. Alto Irpavi (Peña Azul) una zona que no esta urbanizada a la cual aun no tiene ingreso el transporte publico, las socias se reunen en la casa D. la Sra Maria que tiene su tienda D. barrio en la misma casa, en su mayoria son personas que se dedican a la crianza D. vacas y la venta D. leche.

Se organizan D. una mesa directiva la cual esta compuesta por La sra Rebeca Presidenta quien se dedica a la venta D. salchipapas en un kiosko, La Tesorera es la Sra. Angela que venD. cosmeticos por catalogo, y como secretaria esta la Sra.  Celia  que trabaja en labores D. casa. los demas socios tienes actividades distintas como Venta D. Leche las Sra. Gloria y la sra Juana, crianza D. animales, la Sra. Lidia, Jose es Transportistas al igual que los Sres. Joaquin  y el sr Felix,  Control D. movilidades el Sr. Lucio, Venta D. Pollos la Sra. Elizabeth, en su mayoria no cuentan con un negocio estable pero el prestamo sera invertido en el incremento D. capital D. trabajo y asi obtener estabilidad economica en sus hogares.
texts.en:
The ALAMOS communal bank is located in the Alto Irpavi (Peña Azul) zone. This area isn't urbanized yet; there is no public transport access. The members meet in Maria's house. She has a neighborhood grocery store in her home. Most members are dairy farmers. The governing board is maD. up as follows: Rebeca is president; she sells salchipapas (a type of fast food that consists of thinly sliced pan-fried beef hot dogs or sausage and French fries, mixed together and served on a plate or in a paper cone, served with different sauces) in a food stand. Angela is treasurer; she sells catalogue cosmetics. Celia is secretary and works as a domestic. The other members have various lines of work like: Milk sales (Gloria and Juana), small animal raising (Lidia), transportation services (Jose, Joaquin and Felix), vehicle control (Lucio), chicken sales (Elizabeth). For the most part, they don't have stable businesses so the loan will be used to invest in working capital so as to obtain better economic stability for their homes.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital increase.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 30 years old, married with two children: one is 3 years old and the other one is just 4 months old. Josephine was a farmer before thinking on how she could start up a business selling a variety of goods in a shop. Josephine lives in Nyamagabe, a region situated in the southern province of Rwanda. It is in this area that, since 2008, she has owned a shop and she is happy because since she started this business, her family situation changed positively. Her shop is open from 7 AM until 6 PM every day.

As the number of her customers keeps growing, Josephine needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company so that she can add more goods to her shop which hopefully will increase sales as well as profits. With the profits from this loan, Josephine hopes to do a lot in her life including taking care of her family as well as saving for their future. Josephine has a hope that if her business keeps growing, she will create many sources of income as well as creating more jobs for the people of her community.

loans.use: Additional foodstuffs including rice, cooking oil, beans, etc.

loans.name: Ou

texts.en: Ou R., age sixty-two, is married and resides with her husband in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has one child. She is engaged in a business of selling cow ties and cow bells, by which she earns an income of approximately US $3.30 per day. By doing this, she is able to cover her family expenses, especially for her child's education. She has been with this business since 1999. Her husband helps his wife in the business of producing cow ties, and he earns an income of US $3.30 per day. The family's standard of living has been improved since R. began working with this business, so she has requested a loan to expand her business. R. is requesting a loan of US $1,000 to purchase more nylons to produce more ties for sale. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy more nylons to produce more cow ties for sale

loans.name: Khoeurn

texts.en:
Mrs. Khoeurn S. is 37 years old and lives in Kor village in Kandal province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land on which she cultivates rice.

In order to support her rice farming, Mrs. Khoeurn S. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and gasoline to support her farming.

Her husband, Mr. Phal Phoa, is a construction worker who is able to earn a small income to support his family living. He is shown on the right in the photo. Mrs. Khoeurn S. is the mother of four children, three of whom are attending the public school while the youngest one is too young to study or work.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and gasoline for her farm

loans.name: Maiela

texts.en:
Maiela and Beatriz, two sisters originally from Bolivia, are the hardworking owners of Susie’s Bridal Supplies. They have an unrelenting work ethic and unfailing determination to succeed. For Beatriz, a mother of two, much of her determination stems from a desire to provide for her children. “My life has not been easy, but I would like it to be easier for them. I don’t want them to have to work while they are in school, it is important that they are able to focus on their studies.”  

When the sisters first purchased the store from Susie six years ago, it was a party supply store with a generalized focus. However, they saw an opportunity to increase profits so Maiela and Beatriz made the timely decision to shift their focus to provide for more elegant events such as quinceañera parties, weddings, proms, and baptisms. They now spend many of their weekends with their four part-time employees, transforming event sites into glamourous spaces fit to hold that night’s celebration. “Every day and every party is a challenge. We’re excited to be doing this work, we love the adrenaline rush,” says Maiela. 

A $4,000 loan will help the sisters increase their inventory, better manage the operating costs of the store, and launch a more extensive marketing campaign. Although the economic downturn has made running a business particularly challenging, the sisters are optimistic about the future and confident in their business decisions. They work at the store every day, often until nine at night, and will do whatever is necessary to make sure their business is a success. 

As Maiela explains, “If you want to survive in this world, you have to be strong, you have to work hard. We work very, very hard.”

loans.use: Increase store inventory, help pay for store operating costs, increase advertising

loans.name: Arely Sugey

texts.es:
La joven Arely Sugey C. P., se dedica a la venta de sopa de res, mondongo, cuajada y de gallina  los días lunes, miércoles, Viernes. En su casa de habitación, barrio san Agustín. 

La joven Arelys C. es madre soltera tiene un hijo de dos años vive con su mama y dos hermanos, tiene tres años de trabajar con créditos los cuales ha cancelado en tiempo y forma demostrando ser una persona honesta y responsable, cabe señalar que con tosodos los créditos obtenidos ha ido mejorando su estilo de vida mejorando su vivienda y manteniendo su negocio.
texts.en:
The young Arely dedicates herself to preparing and selling soups made with beef, tripe, curd, and chicken, on Mondays, Wednesdays, and Fridays, from her home in San Agustín barrio. Arely is a single mother who has a 2-year-old son and lives with her mother and two brothers. She has worked for the last 3 years with loans she has paid off as scheduled, demonstrating herself to be an honest and responsible person. It is worthy of mention that with each of the loans she obtained, she has improved her style of life and maintained her business.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING INGREDIENTS TO PREPARE THE SOUP SHE SELLS

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida A. is from the village of Upper Dicayas. She is 60 years old. Aida is widowed and has 6 adult children. To make a living, Aida owns & operates a specialized retail store selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Aida is just starting this business.

In 2006, Aida joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Aida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from PMPC. Aida is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This will be the 6th loan taken out by Aida from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Fuseini Solidarity Group

texts.en:
Fuseini is a 38-year-old man who describes himself as hard-working.  He is married and has 3 children between the ages of 6 and 11 years old. Fuseini has been trading in livestock for the past 16 years.  He will use the loan to buy more sheep, goats and cattle to supply restaurant operators. Fuseini hopes to eventually own his own slaughter house.  His future family goals include building a home.

Fuseini is the leader of the group 'Fuseini Solidarity Group', named after the leader.  He believes he was selected as group leader because he is a team player.  There are three members in this group.  The other members are also traders in food and clothing. They plan to use the loan to buy stock to grow their businesses to enable them to support their families better.

loans.use: To purchase to more sheep, goats and cattle

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 50-year-old manufacturer of metal products.  He primarily makes metal basins and frying pans, which he sells from his shop opposite a busy street near a junction heading to the market area. He has been in this business for 25 years and has five employees. Joseph is married and has six children, four boys and two girls. The primary business challenges that he faces are competition and the high prices of raw materials.

Joseph plans to use the 30,000 Kenyan shillings loan to purchase additional raw materials such as drums and metal sheets. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 KES.

In the future, Joseph hopes to buy a plot of land and build a house so that he can retire and do some farming.  In five years, he dreams of opening another branch elsewhere to continue expanding his income.

Joseph describes himself as hardworking, industrious, dedicated and God-fearing.

loans.use: To purchase additional raw materials such as drums and metal sheets

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 31 year old married man from Lebanon. He opened his own dental clinic in 2007 and is still expanding it to attract new clients.
He is requesting to borrow $1,200 in order to purchase a new teeth whitening machine.

loans.use: To purchase a new teeth whitening machine.

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
Estelita B. is a 32-year-old married woman who lives in Sitio Toledo, Manapla, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a sari sari (general) store. Estelita’s husband, Amador, is a carpenter and they have two children aged three and 13.  The children go to school and also help their parents in the business as part of their daily chores.

Estelita  joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve their family's quality of life. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family income with her general store. Now she earns an average monthly income of Php 6,000.

Estelita  is a member of good standing. Her previous loan of Php16,000 was used to fund operations of her store, and it had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing Php16,000, (her sixteenth loan) which she intends to use on her general store. Estelita  is working hard to achieve her dream, which is to provide her family with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon — a title of esteem bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additonal Working Capital

loans.name: Soam

texts.en:
Soam P., 43, is married and resides with her husband and five children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known as the most favorite tourist place in the country. P. sells beverages, earning an income of USD 3 per day. Her husband is a taxi driver and earns an income of USD 6 per day. P. is requesting a loan of USD 1,200 to purchase more beverages to resell.

In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy more beverages to resell.

loans.name: Math

texts.en:
Math F. is a young woman whose husband appears in the photograph. Math F. lives with another family member in the capital of Phnom Penh. She has rented a market store, where she sells chickens to earn a living. She and her husband usually go to buy chicken in bulk at the cheapest price possible from rural people whose houses are full of the poultry they raise. 

Math F.'s business has recently come to a low capacity due to insufficient financial capital. Math F. would like to seek a loan on Kiva through HKL’s project. She will be using her loan to increase her capital, which will allow her to improve her profits.

loans.use: To increase her capital

loans.name: María Dionisia

texts.es:
María Dionicia tiene 50 años de edad, es separada y vive en caserío Cruz del Medano, una zona rural perteneciente al distrito de Mórrope. Un distrito conformado por varios caseríos que distan mucho entre si. La zona pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicada a mas de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado vacuno y ganado menor. Ella compra animales a sus vecinos y pobladores de zonas aledañas y los vuelve a vender a los negociantes que siempre visitan la zona. Adicionalmente se dedica a brindar servicio de costura en un pequeño taller instalado en su domicilio. Con estas actividades sustenta la economía de su familia.

María necesita adquirir mas animales para ampliar su negocio de compra y venta, como no cuenta con el capital suficiente para realizar esta acción se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que le permitan realizar su objetivo.

Maria es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria para mejorar su calidad de vida y la calidad de vida de su familia. En la zona donde vive sus vecinos y conocidos la estiman mucho y la consideran una mujer de confianza.
texts.en:
María Dionicia is 50 years old, is separated and lives in the suburb of Cruz del Medano, a rural zone belonging to the Mórrope district. This district is made up of various suburbs very far apart. The zone belongs to the Lambayeque province, and is located more than an hour from Chiclayo. María buys and sells cattle and smaller livestock. She purchases animals from her neighbours and villagers in the zones around and returns to sell them to the businesspeople that always visit the zone. She also provides a dress-making service in a small workshop installed in her house, and with these activities she sustains her families. María needs to acquire more animals to increase her buying and selling business, and as she doesn't have sufficient capital to do this she has seen it necessary for the first time to seek a loan from Edpyme Alternative for 1500 nuevos solves, which will allow her to achieve her objective. María is a very hard-working and entrepreneurial woman. Her biggest desire is to continue growing as a businesswoman to improve her quality of life and the quality of life of her family. In the zone where she lives her neighbours and acquaintances respect her greatly and consider her a trustworthy woman.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase animals

loans.name: Aram

texts.en: Aram H. is married with one child. He supports a large family with parents and pensioner grandparents. Before starting serviette production, he worked as a delivery man for a meat factory, contacting numerous clients in various regions of Armenia. To be more financially secure, he decided to start his own business. Knowing many retail shop owners helps him a lot in his business now. Currently Aram has large orders for which he needs to order large volumes of packaging.

loans.use: To order large volumes of packaging for serviettes

loans.name: Khann

texts.en: Mr. Khann P. is a villager in Mea Neak village in Takeo province. He was born in 1980. He is a farmer who owns a 1.5-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support his family. He is also a fisherman. His wife, Mrs. Ny Nouv, owns a general store in the local village where she is able to earn a large profit to support her family. Although they try to work hard, they can't earn enough income. So to improve this condition, Mr. Khann P. is asking for a loan to buy a cow to breed to start a new business. The rest of the loan he will use to buy rice seed to grow this year. He is a father of three children. One of the children is a student and the others are too small to work or study. His wife is shown in the photo with him.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding to start a new business

loans.name: Roselyne

texts.en:
Roselyne B. is 38 years old and lives in the town of Kinubi in the Hoima region of Uganda. She is married and has 3 children. All of her children are currently in school. Roselyne has a business of a garment shop, which she has had for 8 years.         

To help expand her business, Roselyne has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more clothes and suitcases. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Roselyne hopes to generate greater profits and buy food. In the future, Roselyne hopes to set up another business.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and suitcases.

loans.name: Laila

texts.en: Laila M. is from the village of Cabuan, Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 45 years old. Laila is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Laila raises crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting vegetables like ampalaya or amargozo (bitter melons). Laila has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Laila joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Laila is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers, such as manure, and other tools needed for the vegetable garden. This will be the first loan taken out by Laila from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, such as manure, and other tools needed for the vegetable garden

loans.name: Nat's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Nat C. is a 32-year-old married woman selected as the village bank president of this 24-member group. Located in Pou Thum village in Kandal Province, the members of this village loan will use the money to buy supplies, equipment and other items to support their various purposes.

Nat earns her living by selling groceries in the local village. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it and so is requesting a loan to buy more groceries. Her husband, Mr. Him Sokha, 34 years old, works as construction worker. With their occupations, they are able to earn a little income to support their famiL. which consists of three children, all students in the local school and also helpers in their mother's business.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to enlarge her business activities.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa R. is from the village of Katipunan, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 55 years old. Rosa is married and has 9 adult children. To make a living, Rosa owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising cows for sale. Rosa has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Rosa joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Rosa is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used additional capital for her business. This will be the second loan taken out by Rosa from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: additional capital for her business

loans.name: Julia Del Carmen

texts.es: Julia Del Carmen tiene, es madre soltera. Tiene 3 hijos y todos estudian. Su actividad es una pulpería,  desde hace más de 12 años pues siempre se ha preocupado por incrementar los ingresos de su hogar, no es la primera vez que solicita créditos pues ha sido muy satisfactorio. Desde muy joven le ha gustado trabajar y sacar adelante a su familia. Lo que ella solicita actualmente en este crédito es para comprar granos básicos, golosinas, pan, refrescos, detergentes y jugos.
texts.en: Julia del Carmen is a single mother. She has 3 children and they are all in school. She has had a grocery store business for the past 12 years. She has always paid particular attention to increasing the income generated by the store. This is not a first time loan that she requests.  Past loans have been very helpful. Since she was very young she has always enjoyed working and providing for her family. She requests a loan to purchase basic grains, snacks, breads, soft drinks, detergents and juices.

loans.use: To purchase basic grains, snacks, bread, soft drinks, detergents, and juices.

loans.name: Oscar Walter

texts.es:
En el sector conocido como el Guabito de  la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Amor Y Felicidad.

En este lugar encontramos a don Oscar, tiene 47 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene 5 hijos, dos de ellos ya son mayores de edad, los menores estudian en colegio y escuela, su mujer es comerciante.

Se dedica a conducir un taxi por las tardes y noches. Además tiene una pequeña granja de pollos en su casa, compra por cajas los pollos cuando están pequeños, los cría por dos meses y luego los vende en pie o por libras a los vecinos o entrega a las tiendas de la localidad, dice que sus pollos se venden mucho ya que los cría con maíz por lo cual su carne es  parecida al pollo criollo. Trabaja todos los días dos a tres horas por día.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar más pollos y comida y medicamentos para estos, además de ropa para el negocio de su esposa. Está en el Banco Comunal desde sus inicios y le gusta porque los intereses son bajos.  Sus sueños son tener una granja grande y con tecnología.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of the 'Amor y Felicidad' (Love and Happiness) community bank meet in the Guabito sector of the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí.  For many years this city has been known as the City of the Royal Tamarind Trees.

Here we meet 47 year-old Oscar.  He lives with his common-law wife and has 5 children.  Two of his children are already grown up and the younger children are studying in high school and elementary school.  Oscar's wife is a saleswoman.

Oscar drives a taxi in the afternoons and evenings.  He also has a small chicken farm at home.  He buys the chicks by the box load when they are young, he raises them for two months and then he sells them whole or by the pound.  He sells them to neighbors and also delivers them to local stores.  He says that his chickens sell well because he raises them on corn which means that their meat is similar to that of 'pollo criollo' (Creole chicken).  Oscar works every day for two or three hours a day.

Oscar will use this loan to buy more chicks, feed and medicines.  He will also buy clothes for his wife's business.  He has been a member of his community bank since the beginning and he likes it because the interest rates are low.  His dream is to have a large farm with technology.

loans.use: To buy chicks, feed and medicines.  To buy clothes

loans.name: Batmunh

texts.en: Batmunh G., 37 years old, lives with his wife and three children in the Hovd province of Mongolia. Batmunh and his family live in their own ger, a Mongolian traditional nomadic tent. His wife is a homemaker and their three children attend high school. Since 2004, Batmunh has been operating a manufacturing business as well as selling meat. With his successful business, he bought a car, tools and already has his own workplace. Batmunh is a handy and talented man. He is requesting 2,500,000 MNT to purchase more tools and boards for his manufacturing business.

loans.use: to purchase more tools and boards

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es:
Don Jorge Luis L. es trabajador en la Empresa Nicaragüense de Acueducto y Alcantarillado (ENACAL) desempeñando el cargo de Distribuidor de Factura desde hace 7 años.
Es soltero con una persona a su cargo, este es su primer crédito con CEPRODEL y lo solicita para mejora de vivienda.
texts.en: Mr Jorge Luis L. has been a worker in the Empresa Nicaragüense de Acueducto y Alcantarillado (ENACAL) [Nicaraguan Aqueduct and Sewage Company] for seven years. He is a Bill Distributor. He is single with one person to take care of. This is his first loan with CEPRODEL, and he is requesting it for home improvements.

loans.use: home improvements; the purchase of construction materials

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This borrower is 30 years old, married, and has two children. He graduated from primary school. He has a shop selling cars equipment. The borrower will use this loan to purchase spare parts for various cars. He has a good reputation in the market. He sells good quality items to his clients at a sound price for the customers. He has an ambitious to develop his shop.

loans.use: For purchasing spare parts

loans.name: Elsa Raquel

texts.es:
Elsa, de 25 años de edad, nacida en el departamento de Estelí, soltera, de oficio sastre, tiene alrededor de 10 años de dedicarse a  esta actividad. Empezó a la edad de 15 años con la ayuda de su madre, con capital propio, ultimadamente ha tenido mucha demanda por parte de su clientela, ya que ella diseña uniformes para equipo locales de beisbol, su mama le enseño hacer muñecas de tela, elabora uniformes para fabricas, vestuarios para cantantes de mariachi, también hace bolsos y carteras con material reciclable como sobrantes de  jeans e incluso se diseña su propia ropa.
Solicita EL préstamo para compra de materia prima como telas de mejor calidad, ya que así  podrá promocionar mejor  su diseños, hacer más clientelas y dar una mejor calidad de sus productos. 
Sus planes futuros son tener  una  buena sastrería donde pueda dar empleo  a otras personas para poder suplir la creciente demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Elsa is 25 years old and was born in the Department of Estelí. She is single and works as a seamstress. Elsa has been in this business for approximately ten years. She started out at the age of 15 by helping her mother. With her own capital, she ultimately generated great demand from her customers. Elsa has designed uniforms for local baseball teams. Her mother taught her how to produce cloth dolls, factory uniforms, costumes for mariachi singers, as well as purses and handbags made of recyclable materials such as leftover jeans. She even designs her own clothing.

Elsa is requesting a loan to buy materials such as high quality fabrics. This will help improve her designs, attract more customers, and result in better quality products. Her future plans include having a successful tailoring shop where she can provide employment to other people. This will allow her to keep up with the increasing demand from her customers.

loans.use: Purchase materials for making uniforms & business suits

loans.name: Thuan

texts.en: Thuan T. C. is 39 years old and has four small children. Being a farmer,her main activity to earn money to growing rice, and vegetable. All these agricultural products are use to meet her family food. To have daily income, she goes to some household to buy chicken eggs and sell them at local market. Her small business  provide a  considerable profit that helps her improve her living standard. Participate in credit project of Center of small enterprise development assistance in 2004, she  has been a good re payer. Now, she is requiring a new loan of 8,502,000  Vietnamese dong to buy more eggs to meet the demand of customers.

loans.use: to buy more eggs to meet the demand of customers

loans.name: Anabilla

texts.en:
Anabilla R. is from the village of ZNAC, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Del Norte. She is 48 years old. Anabilla is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Anabilla owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Anabilla has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Anabilla joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anabilla has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Anabilla is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Anabilla from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Awacou

texts.en: Awacou was born in 1957 in Cotonou, Benin's largest city. She now lives in the Agbato district with her husband Latifou and two of their four children. For the past 11 years, Awacou has sold firewood directly from her home. This is her sixth loan with ALIDE following successful past repayments. This loan will allow her to purchase stock in bulk from Tokpa, Benin's largest market. Her aim is to further strengthen her business.

loans.use: to purchase wood for resale

loans.name: Sandra Milena

texts.es:
Ofrecerle a sus tres hijos la posibilidad de estudiar en una Universidad es el sueño de Sandra Milena C., quien después de trabajar como empleada en algunas cafeterías decidió crear su propio negocio, una cafetería en la que trabaja de domingo a domingo desde tempranas horas con la esperanza de mejorar su calidad de vida. 

Sandra espera ampliar su negocio y para ello necesita de un préstamo que le permita comprar surtido para ampliar su oferta de productos y generar más ventas.
texts.en:
Sandra Milena C.'s dream is to offer her three children the opportunity to study in university. After she was employed in cafeterias she decided to set up her own business. She has a cafeteria that she opens for business from Sunday to Sunday from the very early morning hours.  Her hope is to improve her quality of life. 

Sandra wants to expand her business and for this reason she needs a loan. This will permit her to purchase inventory to increase the variety of products she offers and to generate more sales.

loans.use: to purchase inventory for her store

loans.name: Jamie

texts.en:
Jamie S. builds, installs, and services doors and gates.  As the owner of “Texas Overhead Doors,” Jamie works in the residential and commercial sectors of the construction industry.  A few examples of his work include building custom gates, mounting garage doors, installing fire alarms, and removing sections of wall for new doors.  He especially enjoys doing custom work that requires him to think creatively, and he has developed the reputation of being the person to call for complicated jobs.  For example, there is a large garage door installation company who contacts him for jobs they deem to be too involved to be worth their time.  As Jamie puts it, “I get a lot of weird jobs.”  

Jamie was referred to ACCION Texas-Louisiana by his local bank.  With this loan, Jamie bought a scissor lift that helps him install large doors used for commercial buildings.  This scissor lift expands Jamie’s business capabilities because its height allows him to install taller doors than he previously could.  The scissor lift Jamie bought is in good condition, and he estimates that it will last him at least ten years.

Though Jamie usually works alone, he hires sub-contractors to help him with his larger commissions.  Down the road, Jamie wants his business to begin specializing in door maintenance.  Companies would have him inspect and maintain their doors to prevent them from breaking and becoming a bigger problem later.  This line of work would be advantageous to his business because it is less labor-intensive than what he does now, while still maintaining a high profit margin.  Jamie has five children, his youngest being 17-year-old twins.

loans.use: to pay for a scissor lift.

loans.name: Davaasuren

texts.en:
Mrs. Davaasuren C. is a 51 year-old widow. She has 2 children who are married and live with their families. Her husband passed away last year from cancer.  Davaasuren lives on her own in her house in Darkhan, the second largest city of Mongolia. She works in “Solongo”, a small food factory, as a manager. The factory makes different types of jams and purees from fruits.  

Each year she does some renovations to her house. Last year she managed to replace all the windows of the house. Now she is planning to do some renovations to the interior of the house. The loan will be used to replace ceiling and wall papers and to do some interior renovation to the house.

loans.use: to replace hanging ceiling and wall paper and do some interior renovation to the house.

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia is a 46-year-old widow with two sons. After her husband’s death, all three of them started to work in order to sustain the family financially. The eldest son makes furniture while the youngest son is a rickshaw driver and provides transport services to his passengers. Razia operates a clothes sales business. She sells clothes to customers in her community and earns a good amount of income every month. Along with her business, she also performs her household duties very well.
Razia has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for the expansion of her clothes sales business. With the loan, she will purchase clothes of different varieties in bulk in order to provide a better clothing choice to her customers. She hopes that the loan will prove to be a profitable investment for her business. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her second loan application. In her previous loan year, she established good credit behavior and never missed a meeting. Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Razia.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es: La señora Virginia es originaria Del estado de Morelos, México, ella tiene 37 años de edad, ella es casada y tiene 3 hijos Sarai de 18 años de edad está estudiando el bachillerato, María Guadalupe tiene 16 años está estudiando la secundaria y Francisco Javier de 11 años de edad está estudiando la primaria, ella vende tamales y atole de arroz y champurrado, ella solicito su préstamo para comprar maíz, leña, hojas para tamal, manteca carne y una parte para comprar lamina para el techo de su casa porque ya van a comenzar las lluvias y están muy mal las que tiene su casa, ella inicio su negocio hace 2 años con la que le daba su esposo para el gasto, ella aprendió porque le ayudaba a una señora a elaborar los tamales y a venderlos, la misma señora la animo a que comenzara por su cuenta a vender tamales y atole, su negocio es importante porque puede salir adelante con los gastos de sus hijas en la escuela, ella está orgullosa de ver que sus hijas le ayudan a vender los tamales y atoles y pueden salir adelante y que sus hijos se sientan orgullosos de ella, las ganancias las utiliza en los gastos de la escuela de los niños, para algo que falte para la casa. Ella tiene la esperanza de que su casa estuviera bien parada con sus cimientos y paredes de concreto porque la que tiene es de carrizo, las mejoras que desea para sus hijos son que tengan estudios que salgan por ellos mismos adelante. Ella quiere decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “mas que nada darles las gracias que nos han ayudado y no vamos a defraudarlos, vamos a salir adelante con el negocio y con la familia”.
texts.en:
Virginia is from the state of Morelos, Mexico.  She is 37 years old, married, and has three children.  Sarai, age 18, is studying for her high school degree.  María Guadalupe, age 16, is in junior high school; and 11 year old Francisco Javiar is in elementary school.

She sells tamales, “atole de arroz” (a hot rice drink), and “champurrado” (chocolate atole).  She is requesting the loan to buy corn, firewood, leaves for the tamales, butter, and meat.  She will use part of the loan to buy laminate sheets for the roof.  The rains are going to start, and it is very bad at her house. 

She started her business two years ago with what her husband gave her for the expense.  She learned because she helped a woman make tamales and sell them.  The same woman encouraged her to start selling tamales and atole on her own.  

Her business is important because she is able to get ahead with her daughters’ school expenses.  She is proud to see that her daughters help her sell the tamales and atoles, that they are able to get ahead, and that her daughters are proud of her.  She uses her earnings for her children’s school expenses and for things that she needs for the house.

She hopes that her house would be well built with a concrete foundation and walls because it is now made of reeds.  The improvements that she wishes for are that her children are educated and can get ahead on their own. 

She wants to tell Kiva and the Fundación Realidad that, “More than anything I want to thank you because you have helped us, and we will not let you down.  We will get ahead with the business and the family.”

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, leaves for the tamales, butter, meat,  and laminate sheets for the roof of her house.

loans.name: Issa
