texts.en: Issa is a 35-year-old, single man from Ramallah. In 2007, Issa opened his own coffee and "Bilardo" shop. He hopes that using this loan he will be able to change the décor of the business premises, which will bring in more customers and increase his income.

loans.use: to change the decor of his shop.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.es:
La señora Elisa es socia del banco comunal Las Tigresas del Distrito De Calleria, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 38 años de edad, y tiene dos hijos.
Lleva 10 años trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos, y se dedica a la venta de productos Herbalife.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 3,000.00 comprará: 6 bebidas nutricional de diferentes sabores, 2 multivitaminico, 2 te concentrado, 1 proteína, 2 bebidas de aloe en polvo, 2 te instantáneo, 2 vigorizantes.

Tiene un club de batidos que funciona en su casa, cada mañana prepara los batidos para ofrecer a las personas que están  decididos a bajar de peso, ella misma es una de las personas que está siguiendo esta dieta nutricional.  Se puede decir que está innovando con este servicio ya que estos productos no son muy comerciales debido a su costo.  Son productos muy caros pero que están haciendo efecto en poco tiempo, de esa manera más personas se están animando a tomar los batidos.
Agradece a Manuela Ramos por los préstamos que le ha otorgado a la fecha y que le han permitido seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Elisa is a member of the Las Tigresas community bank of the district of Calleria, department of Ucayali. She is 38 years old and has two children. She has been working with loans from Manuela Ramos for 10 years, and she sells Herbalife products. With her new loan of S/. 3,000.00 she will buy: 6 nutritional drinks in different flavors, 2 multivitamins, 2 tea concentrates,1 protein, 2 powdered aloe drinks, 2 instant teas, and two 2 invigorators.

She has a smoothie club that she operates from her house. Every morning she makes the smoothies to offer to people who want to lose weight. She herself is one of the people who is on this nutritional diet. It can be said that she is an innovator with this service since these products aren't very marketable due to their cost. They are very expensive products but they are having an effect after a short time. In this way more people are deciding to drink the smoothies.  She is thankful to Manuela Ramos for the loans it has given her so far that have allowed her to continue working.

loans.use: to buy Herbalife products

loans.name: Meas' Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Meas was selected by the other three loan group members as the head of this loan group. She is a villager in Kompong Chhnang province and is a domestic farmer. She also runs a small business selling miscellaneous items. She is the mother of four children, one of whom is married. None of them is employed, so the family depends entirely on Mrs. Meas's daily income and that of her husband. 

Mrs. Meas and her husband have spent their lifetime working in the field. They can generate profits of about US $4.25 each day to cover the family’s basic requirements. 

To earn some additional money to support the family, Mrs. Meas started raising a few piglets in a cage over three months ago, but they are still very small because they lack sufficient food. For this reason, Mrs. Meas is requesting a loan from Kiva in order to buy several sacks of pig feed to fatten her pigs.
 
The other borrowers are as follows: 

Mrs. Norng is seeking a loan to purchase fertilizers to ensure the successful growth of her crops.
    
Mrs. Vann, a rice farmer, is looking for a loan to buy pigs for breeding, as well as to purchase fertilizers. 

Mrs. Um, a domestic farmer, is requesting a loan to buy several sacks of fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy many sacks of pig feed to fatten her pigs.

loans.name: Philomene

texts.en: Philomene is 26 years old, single and runs a well-organized business where she sells household items such as soap, rice, sugar, cooking oil, cake, drinks and pens. She is applying for this loan through Kiva to buy more items to sell to her customers, and intends to reinvest the profits in her business so that she can eventually earn enough money to build a house.

loans.use: to buy food and other items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Claudio

texts.en: Claudio is 36 years old, and married with eight children aged 2-11 years. He is the sole bread winner for his family of 10 people living in Hoima, Uganda. For two years, he has been operating a general merchandise shop. From this business, he has been able to buy a vehicle; however, his only challenge is the high inflation rate. He hopes in the future to upgrade his shop to a wholesale status. Claudio needs a loan to buy sugar, soap, and salt to sell.

loans.use: To buy soap, sugar, and salt to sell.

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey is a hardworking 52 year-old. He is married and blessed with 5 children, two of whom are in school. For the last two years he has been selling stationery in order to meet the needs of his family. He makes an extra shilling by cultivating tea and engaging in dairy farming. He wants, in the next 5 years, to be the leading distributor of stationery in his region. 

He is requesting a loan of 100,000 Kenya shillings pay for a trading license and to renovate the premises. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has been able to embrace the culture of saving.

loans.use: to pay for the trading license and renovate the premises

loans.name: Ana Elizabet

texts.es:
L.  socia pertenece al banco comunal “SOLIDARIDAD-CACHIMAYO” el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Cachimayo, en L. Provincia de Urubamba y Departamento de Cusco.

L.  socia Ana Elizabet; tiene 32 años de edad,  L. socia es conviviente; L. socia tiene 2 hijos de 11 y 7 años de edad;  L. socia es comerciante minorista, L. socia tiene su stand en un centro comercial muy conocido en L. ciudad del Cusco, elL. alquiL. este stand y se dedica  a L. venta de colchas de lanas para bebes y adultos, L. socia también hace chompas, guantes, chalinas, gorros, medias, chalecos, mantas y todo con finas lanas peruanas y en los diseños que se desee. L. socia desea en un futuro poder tener su  distribuidora de chompas hechas  a mano para L. venta a las grandes tiendas comerciales y tener su marca. L. socia por el momento desea invertir el préstamo en L. compra de lanas al por mayor para poder realizar sobre todo sus trabajo de colchas para bebes y colchas en general realizadas en pastillaje para cubrir las camas de 1 plaza y de 2 plazas también. L. socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en L. compra de lanas al por mayor y en varios colores y grosores. 

L.  socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “SOLIDARIDAD-CACHIMAYO” communal bank, located in the Cachimayo district, in the Urubamba province, Cusco department.

Ana Elizabet is 32. She lives with her partner and they have two children ages 11 and 7. She is a retailer and has a stand in a very well-known shopping center in Cusco. She rents this stand and sells woolen bedspreads for babies and adults. She also sells sweaters, gloves, scarves, caps, stockings, cardigans, and blankets. All of these products are made of fine Peruvian wool and are her designs. She wants to have a wholesale distributor for her hand-made sweaters so that she can focus on her baby blankets and blankets in general. She makes them for single and double beds using appliqué. She is requesting this loan to invest in the wholesale purchase of wool of various colours and sizes.

She is grateful for the support that you are providing and promises to repay her quotas in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to invest in the wholesale purchase of wool of various colours and sizes.

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
La señora Maria Teresa de dedica a la venta de ropa usada en diferentes partes de la ciudad. 
Esta solicitando un préstamo para invertir en comprar ropa (de damas, caballeros, niños, zapatos, y juguetes) ya que en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para invertir en su negocio. 
Doña Maria Teresa planea pagar el crédito con las ganancias que obtiene de su negocio ya que su esposo el señor Juan Ramón se encargara de los gastos familiares y escolares de sus tres hijos, con el sueldo que recibe de su trabajo. 
Desean mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y que su negocio tenga mas variedad de productos para vender.
texts.en:
Maria Teresa sells used clothing in different parts of the city. She is asking for a loan to invest in the purchase of clothes for men, women and children as well as shoes and toys, since right now she doesn't have the money to invest in her business. 

Maria Teresa plans to pay the loan back with the profits from her business. Her husband, Juan Ramon, takes care of the family's living expenses and school costs for their 3 children with the salary from his job. 

They want to improve their family's quality of life and to have a greater variety of products to sell in their business.

loans.use: to buy new and used clothing for her business.

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana is married with two adult sons. She sells various products like plastic bags, toilet paper, napkins, and artificial flowers at the central market in Pavlograd City. Tatyana has been in this business for 16 years. Being polite and offering good products at low prices has helped Tatyana to develop her business well. 

This business is the only source of her family income. Tatyana would like to borrow 5,000 UAH to increase her inventory. She is hoping to make additional income and help her youngest son by paying part of his college tuition.

loans.use: to increase her inventory of assorted merchandise.

loans.name: Searn

texts.en:
Mrs. Searn is a 60-year-old married woman who lives in the Baray District of Kompong Thom Province. She is a widowed woman who currently lives with four single children. Three of her children are employed in various jobs, earning profits to share responsibilities with Mrs. Searn. 

To make a daily income, Mrs. Searn provides a sewing clothes service to her neighbors, sewing both traditional clothes and modern clothes in Baray market. She runs her business very well and her many customers recognize the good service she provides. She is able to make an income, on average, of $2.40 per day to cover financial expenses for the whole family. Mrs. Searn will use all of her loan to buy more clothes for her sewing business. 

In the future, Mrs. Searn hopes, with her increase income, she will be able to open a new shop for her cloth-sewing business. She also hopes to make her house bigger than it is at the present time.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for her sewing business.

loans.name: Burul's Group

texts.en:
Burul is the leader of this group. She is 50 years old and married to a farmer. Together with her husband she has raised four daughters and a son. Her two older daughters are married and have their own families, the third daughter works as a teacher in Bishkek and the younger children study at school. In order to earn money, the family cultivates agricultural products and breeds cattle. At the moment they keep four cows, four calves and fifty sheep. After selling some part of the harvest, Burul spends the profits on purchasing cattle. With the money received from this loan, she plans to purchase a bull-calf for breeding. In the future Burul wants to purchase a hectare of land, half of which she will use for growing wheat and the other half for cultivating potatoes. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase a bull-calf for breeding

loans.name: Wanignon Group

texts.fr: Le groupement WANIGNON est composé de treize personnes qui habitent le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Noudéhousèa est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Noudéhousèa est âgée de 47 ans et ne vit plus avec son mari. Noudéhousèa a deux enfants dont un scolarisé et à sa charge. Noudéhousèa n’a jamais été à l’école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de son enfant, Noudéhousèa mène comme activité depuis vingt cinq ans la vente de légumes. Parallèlement à cette activité, Noudéhousèa vend du pain et des noix de palme.  Noudéhousèa s’approvisionne dans un village du Bénin. Dans le but de rehausser le niveau de son activité et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle, Noudéhousèa sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe WANIGNON, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé. Noudéhousèa ambitionne plus tard acquérir puis construire une parcelle.
texts.en: The Wanignon group is made up of thirteen people from the same neighborhood.  The group representative, named Noudéhousèa, has her hand raised in the photo. Noudéhousèa is 47 years old and no longer lives with her husband.  She has two children, one of whom is in school and under her care.  Noudéhousèa never attended school. To meet her and her child's needs, she has been selling vegetables for 20 years. She also sells bread and palm nuts. Noudéhousèa buys her stock in a village in Benin.  With the goal of increasing her business activity and better meeting her customers' needs, she is requesting, along with the other members of the Wanignon group, a first loan through ALIDé. Noudéhousèa hopes to later buy a piece of land and build on it.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and palm nuts.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is a farmer in Kitale, Western Kenya. He is married with six children ranging from three to 25 years old. He has been a farmer for 15 years and currently employs one farmhand. He sells corn, milk and chickens to the local market. He is also a government employee.

Simon has requested a loan of 60,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to boost his poultry business by buying more birds. He says he wants to focus on farming in a bigger and better way and to buy a motor vehicle to help in making his deliveries on time. He says that part of his additional income will help pay to educate his children.

He sees the high feeding costs for dairy animals as a challenge.

loans.use: To buy chickens

loans.name: Riffat Bibi's Group

texts.en:
Riffat is a 32-years-old woman. She is married and lives with her family, a husband and four daughters who are 14, 12, 9 and 4 years old.  

Riffat’s days are focused on making progress with her business. She is involved in sewing & embroidery work.  Her work is home based. She crafts beautiful embroidery designs on clothes and sews them with perfect measurement. Her excellent skills enable her to receive good orders from her clients and she generates good revenue from them.   Her husband’s economic mainstay is selling construction supplies. He also knows construction work and worked as a constructor for many people. He has been operating his business for over 10 years and has a  good clientele.  He is well-known in his business.   

Riffat is requesting for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. He intends to use the loan to  purchase construction supplies such as ladders, bamboos, etc. for his business.   She hopes that her husband will grow the business more and improve the quality of service after the loan investment.

loans.use: buy construction supplies

loans.name: Phat

texts.en:
Phat, 60, is widowed and resides with her daughter in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is a fruit vendor. Her daughter runs a cosmetics shop at home.

Phat requests a loan of 700 U.S. dollars (USD) to pay for her daughter’s examination in teacher training. In the future, she would like to renew her house and support her daughter’s study in teacher training until she becomes a teacher.

loans.use: To pay for her daughter's examination in teacher training.

loans.name: Rustam

texts.ru:
Рустам молодой перспективный юноша. Он женат. Детей пока не имеет. Несколько лет он был на заработках в России. На накопленный капитал купил землю. Отец у него дехканин. Он хочет создать для себя хорошие условия. Наладить бизнес и никуда не выезжать на заработки. Он на данный момент занимается выращиванием сельхоз культур. Так как он проживает в аграрном регионе на сельхозкультуры большой спрос. Он хочет получить займ для покупки минеральных удобрений для обработки земли и ее подготовки к весеннему посеву. Он надеется на вашу поддержку.
Спасибо.
texts.en:
Rustam is a promising young man. He is married. He does not have children yet. For several years he worked in Russia. For the accumulated money he purchased land. His father is a farmer. 

Rustam wants to create good conditions for himself, to establish business and don't have to travel anywhere for work. He is currently growing crops. As he lives in an agricultural area there is a high demand for it. He wants to get a loan for the purchase of mineral fertilizers for cultivation of the land and preparation for spring planting. He hopes for your support. Thank you.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
Jonathan is 30 years old and married to Jane. They have three children and they support four people within the family.

He has been a shopkeeper for the last 4 years, selling sugar, cooking oil, bread, maize flour and wheat flour, from which he earns a monthly income of about Kes 12,000. He is applying for his first loan of Kes 25,000. He was introduced to KADET ltd by a credit officer.

He hopes to use the profits to save for his children's education and to open up another business to provide basic family needs.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs like wheat flour and maize flour to stock his shop.

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua is a 30-year-old married man. He has a child who is  years old. He describes himself to be a faithful man. He operates a retail business where he sells fertilizers, farm seeds, pesticides, etc. He has been involved in this business for one year. His business is located at a viable business area, and his primary customers are local residents and farmers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be delay of payments from customers. 

He will use the 20,000 Kenyan shilling loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides. His business goal is to improve his business within five years. This is his  second loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more pesticides and fertilizers.

loans.name: Toleafoa

texts.en:
M. is married with 3 children. Before she started her own business she worked at the Yazaki EDS factory as a wire operator (Yazaki is one of only 3 manufactring companies in Samoa and is a large employer of unskilled labor). She had to leave this job to look after her children.

She started a business making elei printing. This is a style of cloth printing which is unique to Samoa and is used in much of Samoan clothing. The photo shows M. with some examples of material which she has printed for sale. Running her own business enables her to also look after her children during the day.

loans.use: Purchase material and improve home

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Joan Wanjiku Mwaura intends to buy two dairy cows

loans.name: Lily

texts.en: Lily is 44 years old and a mother of two children, and she takes care of three others. Lily began her business in 1992. Over the years, Lily has acquired solid experience selling both kitchen utensils and charcoal. Through her determination and hard work, she has been able to build a loyal customer base that has begun to pre-order utensils. Lily is asking for a loan of $1000 to help increase her working capital and buy additional goods.  This will enable her to generate additional profits, which will allow her business to grow and change.

loans.use: To buy 100 sacks of charcoal and utensils for resale.

loans.name: Rustam

texts.en:
Rustam F. is 35 years old and has secondary education. He is married and has 3 children. He is a truck driver.

Rustam has been doing stockbreeding for 10 years. This activity is an additional income source which he gets from his cows' milk and meat. For the loan amount of $1000, Rustam is planning to buy 2 cows. This will increase both the number of his cattle and the quantity of their daily milk yield. His fresh milk will be sold to town inhabitants who don't have the opportunity to raise cows. Rustam is going to pay off the loan over a period of 12 months.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Elvira Bertha

texts.es:
Doña Elvira is originally from this region and she decided to stay in her native land to try to beat poverty which a lot of families are face with in this part of the country. She has been succesful due to her optimism and the love she has for her family. She has 3 children whom she supports and loves dearly. She wants for her kids to get an education and to have a better quality of life.

She raises and sells chickens. She has been doing this for the past 6 years. She gets up at the crack of dawn to feed her chickens and to make sure they are well-taken care of. She feels that she has enough experience doing this and her wish is to increase the number of chickens in her little farm. She is requesting a loan in the amount of $325 USD to purchase more chickens so that she can make more profit in a short time and use the money to take care of her family. With your help, Doña Elvira can make her dream come true!

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Elvira es natural de la zona y decidió quedarse en su propia tierra para salir adelante y enfrentar la pobreza que agobia a muchas familias en el interior de su país y hasta ahora lo ha logrado con suma satisfacción gracias a su optimismo y al amor de su familia, ella es madre de tres niños a los que mantiene y educa con sumo amor y su deseo de brindarles una mejor calidad de vida ha hecho que su perseverancia este centrada en la venta y crianza de pollos; actividad a la que se dedica hace ya 6 años.Su labor cada día es realizada con mucha entereza y para ello debe iniciar sus actividades desde muy temprano y para lograr pollos bien nutridos y de excelente calidad no escatima esfuerzos ni inversión. Habiendo adquirido la experiencia suficiente en este oficio su deseo es incrementar el número de ejemplares en su pequeña granja motivo por el cual solicita un préstamo de 325 dólares que invertirá exclusivamente en la compra de más pollos para que a corto tiempo pueda obtener mayores ganancias e invertirá sus réditos para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Con tu ayuda podrá hacer de su anhelo un hecho real.

loans.use: To purchase chickens and food to feed the chickens

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Mr. P. Heng was married in 1979, and he has 2 sons and 5 daughters. He is currently in the business of farming, fishing, and planting soy beans. He started the farming business in 2004. Before that, he worked as a construction worker. His wife assists him in planting the soy beans. They both did not finish primary school. Four of his children live under his care, and three children are married and living in separate houses with their families. Two daughters work at the garment factory and two children are studying.

He has borrowed money from MAXIMA five times previously. He is now requesting a loan in the amount of $1,000. He will use this money to purchase a fishing net and baby fish to feed.

loans.use: To purchase a fishing net and baby fish.

loans.name: Rosario 2 Group

texts.es:
Maria is 30 years of age, married, and has 2 children. Her husband is a farm laborer who works in the cultivation of flowers. Maria and the rest of the members of her group create embroidery work such as table linens, napkins, and blouses because this activity is most popular among the women of her community. They sell their traditional products to the tourists in the area because they are beautifully-designed and colorful handicrafts.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

MARIA , TIENE 30 AÑOS ESTA CASADA Y TIENE 2 HIJOS , SU MARIDO TRABAJA COMO CAMPESINO EN EL CULTIVO D. FLORES . ELL. SE DEDICA A CONFECCIONAR Y BORDAR PRENDAS D. ARTESANIA TALES COMO : MANTELES , SERVILLETAS , BLUSAS , AL IGUAL QUE TODAS LAS DEMAS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO YA QUE ES UNA ACTIVIDAD QUE MAS AUGE TIENE ENTRE LAS MUJERES D. SU COMUNIDAD . SUS PRODUCTOS LOS VENDEN CON LOS TURISTAS QUE VISITAN L. ZONA YA QUE SON TRADICIONALES LOS BORDADOS MUY BONITOS POR SU GRAN COLORIDO Y DISEÑO.

loans.use: Purchase of thread and fabric to distribute among the members of the group

loans.name: Pisey

texts.en:
Mrs. Pisey K. (age 41) and her husband, Mr. Sek Rathmony (age 50) have been married since 1990. They have two children, one son and one daughter. Their children are studying in the local school. Pisey and her family live along National Road number one south of Phnom Penh. She has been selling fruit since 1979. She buys many kinds of fruit from farms for reselling around her village. Her husband has been a motor taxi driver for five years.

She is requesting a loan from MAXIMA for the first time in the amount of $600. She will use this loan to expand her business of selling fruit.

loans.use: To purchase fruit for reselling

loans.name: Kisakye B Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Cissy I.. She has a tailoring business and is requesting a loan to improve her business. Cissy is 34 years old and is married. Her husband is a teacher. She has 5 children, ages 2.5 to 15 years old, and 4 of them go to school.

Each week, Cissy makes approximately 60000 UGX (about $35) profit. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a television and fridge. Previously, Cissy had a loan for 300000 UGX (about $175) from BRAC Uganda in order to invest in business and the loan was paid back on time.

Cissy is joined in her small group by Esta K., Zelipha N., and Else M.. Esta K. has a business selling charcoal and wants to increase her stock of charcoal. Zelipha N. sells used clothing and wants a loan to purchase more clothing to sell. Else M. runs a welding business of welding and wants to make more windows to sell.

loans.use: To improve and increase the tailoring business

loans.name: Katwe B(I) Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Esther N.. She is currently in the business of running a beauty salon and is requesting a loan to purchase more hair chemicals and a dryer. Esther is 27 years old and is married, with a husband who sells produce for work. She has 2 children, aged 6 and 10, and both of her children go to school. Each week, Esther makes approximately UGX 50000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to add to her business. Esther has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 300000 in order to buy a hair dryer and the loan was paid back on time.

Esther is joined in her small group by Eva N., Amina N., and Hadija N.. Eva N. has a business selling new clothes and wants to purchase more clothes and start a business selling shoes. Amina N. is currently operating a business in used clothing sales and wants a loan to purchase more clothes to sell. Hadija N. operates a restaurant business and wants to venture into another business.

loans.use: To boost beauty salon business and offer better quality services

loans.name: Chun

texts.en:
Chun B. is 38 years old and with her three children, has resided in Kampong Cham province for many years. All her children are students and sometimes, when they have free time, they help their mother selling sugar cane juice and groceries. On average, she earns around $6 a day of profit. She started the business in the year 2000. Moreover, to support the family’s income her husband, Kun Sopheap, 43, is a police official with a salary of $50 per month.

Because she wants to increase the number of groceries for sale to meet her customer's demand, she has applied for a loan from Kiva, to purchase groceries in bulk and save the money. The majority of the loan will however be used to purchase a plot of land to resell whenever the price is high.

loans.use: To purchase groceries and land

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Joy O. is married with eight children. She sells foodstuffs such as plantains, cassava (garri) and corn. She also sells mortars, small hard bowls in which one can crush substances such as seeds and grains into powders with a special object called pestle. She is 50 years old and hails from Edo State, Nigeria, and has been in business since 1988. She needs the loan  of $450 to buy more foodstuffs for sale.

loans.use: To buy more corn and other foodstuffs for sale

loans.name: Mohira

texts.en:
K. Mohira is 32 years old. She and her husband have raised three children. Now all of her children are studying at school. Her husband has a taxi service.

To improve her family position, Mohira started her business two years ago. She bakes lepeshka, the national bread. She has lots of customers and sells the majority of her products from her own place. However, she also has a trading place in the central local market for selling lepeshka.

Now Mohira requests 2000 Somoni (600 $ US Dollars) for the term of 12 months. She is planning to purchase wholesale flour for her business. From the profit of her business, Mohira wants to send her children to a better school, as she dreams of her children to be well educated. With your help this will be possible. Mohira is grateful for everyone supporting her and promises to manage the loan responsibly.

loans.use: Purchasing flour wholesale for baking the national bread “lepeshka.”

loans.name: Konoba

texts.fr:
Konoba F. is married and raising 6 children. She has been a member of the village bank of Karsia for seven years. She wants to bolster her business by buying sugar, tea, matches, palm oil, smoked fish, Omo (detergent), etc. in the weekly markets and big stores to retail in Karsia. Konoba has transformed her storeroom into a little store where she sells general merchandise. The loan that she is requesting will be reimbursed at the end of 6 months in one single payment.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Konoba F., mariée avec 06 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Karsia depuis 7 ans. Elle veut renforcer son activité en achetant du sucre, du thé, des allumettes, de l’huile de palme, du poisson fumé, de l’Omo etc… au niveau des marchés hebdomadaires et des grandes boutiques pour revendre au détail à Karsia. Konoba a transformé son grenier en une petite boutique ou elle vend ses divers produits. Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use:
purchase and resale of various products

achat et revente de produits divers.

loans.name: Asha Muhammed Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Asha Mohamed. She is currently in the business of selling charcoal and bread and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Asha is 40 years old and is married with a husband who is a peasant. She has 3 children ranging in age from 12 to 20 all of whom go to school. Each week, Asha earns approximately 50 Sudanese pounds in profit and with the extra money from this loan, she hopes to be able to expand the business. Asha is joined in her small group by Grace P., Leya T., Esther K., and Jenifa Y..

Grace P. has a business selling local brews and wants to expand the business. Leya T. is currently operating a business selling videos and televisions and wants a loan to expand her business. Esther K. operates a business selling green vegetables and beans and wants to expand the business. Jenifa Y. is currently in the business of selling bread, charcoal and vegetables from her home and is requesting a loan to expand her business.

loans.use: Expanding Various Retail Businesses

loans.name: Zibula Atudde Kyetume Group

texts.en:
Milly N. is the chairperson of Zibula Atudde women's group in Kyetume in the Mukono district. She is married with four children, three of which are in school. She also cares for the three orphans of her late brother and sister. She is a business woman and a farmer, mostly growing cabbage, cassava, and matooke. She sells the produce at the Kyetume Central Market. She would like to be able to transport her produce to the city for more profits.

Milly also has a bar that she started six years ago. She sells local brew, a delicacy for most of her customers, as well as beer, wine, spirits, and soda. Milly and her husband make the brew with the help of their children. She prefers to sell the local brew because she determines the pricing, unlike other spirits where the pricing is standard.

Milly needs a loan to help buy more waragi and tonto for her bar and to pay school fees for her children, who are soon beginning their third term.

loans.use: To help buy more waragi and tonto for her bar and pay school fees.

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.es: La señora Felicidad, se dedica a la distribución de medicamentos en zonas alejadas de la ciudad de El Alto, en su mayoría son zonas perihurbanas y rurales de la ciudad de El  Alto, Bolivia. Labor que realiza junto a su hija quien estudió la carrera de enfermeria. Ambas realizan esta labor con mucho sacrificio y esfuerzo, generando un pobre ingreso económico, por lo cual trabajan los siete días de la semana, con mucho ahinco. Viven en una casa muy pobre, que apenas cuenta con los servicios básicos de saneamiento.
texts.en:
Señora Felicidad distributes medications in the outskirts of the city of El Alto, along with her daughter, who studied nursing. Most of the areas she works in are suburban and rural areas. Both she and her daughter work very hard, make a lot of sacrifices and earn very little, so they eagerly work seven days a week. They live in a very humble home, which only has a very basic drainage system.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy medications

loans.name: Balimaya Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Balimaya sont toutes des femmes mariées ayant en moyenne 26 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles traditionnelles élargies avec leur mari, coépouses, beaux frères, belles sœurs, enfants et autres parents dans la sous-préfecture de Fana Région de Koulikoro(deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali). Ces femmes font généralement le commerce de pagnes (wax et fancy tissus très prisés en Afrique de l’ouest) et de différentes sortes de tasses (ustensiles de cuisine, thermos, tasses galvanisées en aluminium etc.). Les tasses servent également de récipients pour les travaux domestiques mais aussi à servir la nourriture.
Ce groupe de femmes a décidé d’adhérer au programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso avec lequel il est à son cinquième prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe). Les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
Les femmes du groupe comptent utiliser ce prêt pour acheter, 100 pièces de pagnes wax et 500 tasses auprès des grossistes du grand marché de Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali). Elles effectuent leur vente dans les marchés journaliers de la ville de Fana et dans les foires hebdomadaires des localités environnantes telles Dioïla, Massigui, Beleko et N’golobougou à une clientèle essentiellement constituée de femmes et de quelques hommes. Les ventes se font surtout au comptant et quelques fois à crédit à des clients fidèles.
Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel de 30 000FCFAqui sera utilisé pour aider les conjoints dans les dépenses familiales et élargir la taille de leur commerce.
texts.en:
The members of the Balimaya group are all married women with an average age of 26 and on average, 3 children. They live in traditional extended families with their husband, co-spouses, brothers- and sisters-in-law, children and other relatives in the Sous-prefecture of Fana, Koulikoro region, (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

These women generally sell “pagnes” (lengths of brightly colored African cloth; wax-types and fancy types, much esteemed in West Africa) and various sorts of table ware (kitchen utensils, thermoses, galvanized aluminum cups etc.) These basins are used as recipients for preparing food and as table ware. This group of women decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program and are on their 5th solidarity loan (group loan). Their preceding loans have been correctly reimbursed.

The women intend to use this loan to buy 100 lengths of wax-type “pagne” and 500 pieces of table ware from the wholesalers at the big open-air market in Bamako (capital of the Republic of Mali). They make their sales in the daily markets of the town of Fana and the weekly markets of surrounding localities such as Dioïla, Massigui, Beleko and N’golobougou to a clientele essentially made up of women and a few men. They mostly sell cash or sometimes on credit for trusted customers. They hope to make a monthly profit of 30,000 F CFA each which will be used to help their spouses in supporting the family and to enlarge the size of their businesses.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of "pagnes" and table ware

loans.name: Shavkat

texts.en:
Shavkat, amother of 5, is a native of Khujand, Tajikistan and has stayed in her native land. Six years ago she decided to begin a business raising livestock. She began with just one cow and now has many. Every morning, Shavkat awakes early so that her beloved cows may graze among the hills all day in hopes that they return happy and satisfied. Shavkat is motivated to continue in this arduous work and received help from her children and husband.

In order to succeed in her business, Shavkat and her family look to nourish the animals and keep them happy, in hopes of ultimately selling them at a just price. Shavkat and her family are able to sustain themselves and this fills her with great satisfaction. With the support of this loan, Shavkat, would now like to purchase more species of livestock to increase her clientele. With your support, Shavkat will be able to accomplish her business goals and eventually fund the education of all five of her children.

loans.use: Tp purchase cattle to expand the business.

loans.name: Nenas Group

texts.es:
El  g/s NENAS está conformado por 3 integrantes 2 mujeres y un varón que viven en la zona rural de la comarca el raizon de la ciudad de Nindiri. Ellos han iniciado su negocio con capital pequeño  solicitaron su primer crédito con ADIM y se dieron cuenta de los beneficios que se obtienen cuando invierten bien en su negocio y pagan a tiempo su crédito.
Doña  Reyna es la coordinadora del grupo. Ella nos cuenta que su g/s tiene éxito por la buena comunicación y solidaridad de sus integrantes  piensan seguir trabajando y ampliando cada vez más  productos. Son beneficiadas de un segundo  ciclo de crédito y se siente orgullosa de no haber quedado mal con ADIM 
El g/s ha recibido capacitaciones  en economía y administración del negocio. Su mayor aprendizaje ha sido que para progresar es necesario ahorrar, pues así se queda bien, se pude tener un nuevo crédito y progresar.
texts.en:
The group, NENAS, includes 3 members: 2 woman and one man who live in the rural area, Comarca el Raizon, of the city of NIndiri. They have started their business with a little capital they solicited as their first loan from ADIM. They realized the benefits they could obtain when they invest well in their business and pay back their loans on time. Reyna is the coordinator of the group. She tells us that their group is successful because of great communication and solidarity of their members who always think about continuing to work and constantly improving their products. They have benefited from a second cycle of loans and feel proud of not having become delinquent with ADIM. The group has received administrative and financial training from ADIM. Their greatest lesson has been that to succeed it is necessary to save; in order to follow this rule, they must have a new loan and progress.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work Capital; Invest in their different businesses; Sales of Plants, CDs, and pewters.

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en:
49-year-old Thuy Y. lives in Siem Reap province with his wife, Tit Sokha who is 38 years old, and their child. He earns a living by collecting and re-selling used goods from villagers. His wife grows various kinds of vegetable, like cabbages and morning glories, and also sells fish in the market. She earns approximately $6 per day.

Thuy Y. hopes to reduce the cost of transportation, therefore, he is applying for a loan to buy a motorcycle. The motorcycle will allow him to transport his family, as well as used goods that he sells.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph O. is 64 years old and married with 4 children. He has a farm where he cultivates cassava. He has not cultivated the entire piece of land because of funding. He is requesting the loan amount of 30,000 to cultivate more cassava. He says thanks to Kiva and all lenders.

loans.use: To cultivate more cassava

loans.name: Maria Eugenia

texts.es:
La señora Maria Eugenia vive en alquiler con su mamá en la calle Manuel Jofre de la zona de Tacahua de la ciudad de La Paz. La actividad que ella realiza es la elaboración de donuts, las mismas que ella comercializa llevando a los diferentes colegios, con esta actividad ella puede cubrir sus mas mínimas necesidades. El crédito que solicita es para compra de insumos (harina, queso, levadura, sal, etc.) y poder elaborar empanadas y otras masitas de esta manera  mejorar sus ingresos y estabilizar su negocio.

Es cliente de Impro desde el año 2007  y su historial de pagos es muy bueno; también fue parte de Kiva con dos créditos anteriores. Por la actividad que realiza y el carácter social puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Maria Eugenia lives in a rented house with her mother on Manuel Jofre Street in the Tacahua area of La Paz. She makes donuts and sells them at various schools, enabling her to cover her basic expenses. This loan will be used to purchase inputs (flour, cheese, yeast, salt, etc.) so she will be able to make empanadas and cookies to improve her income and stabilize her business. She has been an Impro client since 2007 and has a good repayment history. She has also borrowed through Kiva twice. Her business and her character have given her access to more credit.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase flour, cheese, yeast and other inputs for making and selling empanadas, cookies and donuts

loans.name: Toyin

texts.en: Toyin sells drinks, ready-made, and also rents DVD plates. Toyin learned this business in 6 months and she has been in it for the past 8 years. Toyin opens her shop from 7am to 11pm, from Monday to Sunday. Toyin is 45 years old and married with 2 children. She lives in Agege and she is requesting the loan amount of N 100,000 to purchase more drinks, CDs, and DVD plates to sell and to rent. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks, CDs, and DVDs to sell or rent

loans.name: Shohusein

texts.ru: Шохусейн занимается ремонтом бытовой техники, а точнее холодильного оборудования. Шохусейну 31 год, женат, 3 детей. Недавно он открыл свою собственную мастерскую. Где он спокойно может принимать своих клиентов. Кроме того, что его клиенты привозят холодильники к нему в мастерскую он еще выезжает к ним на своей машине. Запасные части для холодильников различных марок, а также фреон он покупает самостоятельно и затем после установки получает с клиентов вознаграждение, которое и является его прибылью. Для покупки запчастей ему и необходим займ.
texts.en:
Shohusein is in the business of repair of household appliances, mostly refrigerators. Shohusein is 31 years old, married and has three children. He has opened his own repair shop just recently where he can meet and service his clients. Besides that his customers bring their refrigerators to his shop he also travels out to them on his car. He buys the spare parts for different refrigerator brands and freon himself and then gets a reimbursement after installation which is his profit. He needs a loan to buy the spare parts.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy spare parts

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita T. raises pigs at the back of her house. She is a 40-year-old mother of two children who has been raising pigs for quite a long time already. Her husband, Ranulfo T., works with his motorcycle. However, his earnings are not enough to cover their needs.

The purpose of her loan is to buy piglets. She already has a pig fence and she wants to make her small piggery grow. The loan will definitely help her family sustain their livelihood and increase the size of her business.

CEVI is reaching out to a lot of people to help them start their own businesses. CEVI offers not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To buy additional pigs

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es: Virginia tiene 44 años, es madre de 3 hijos que están estudiando en otra ciudad, ahora vive acompañada de su esposo, quien trabaja como operador de tractores. Ella es secretaria y trabaja en la municipalidad de su localidad, la cual se ubica cerca a su casa. Sin embargo, también tiene un negocio propio, en sociedad con otra persona, de compra y venta de repuestos para motos y motocarros. Con esta actividad ya lleva un año, y le va muy bien gracias a su buena administración. Virginia está muy satisfecha por las ganancias que viene obteniendo, y como es una mujer que siempre procura estar en actividad y aprovecha cada oportunidad de negocio que se presenta, también quiere implementar una tienda de ropa, por lo que está ahorrando, para que su deseo que haga pronto realidad. Este es su préstamo número 12 créditos con MFP, y en todo este tiempo lo que más aprecia del trabajo en su banco comunal es el compañerismo entre todos los integrantes, además de su compromiso y responsabilidad en el pago de sus cuotas. El dinero que está solicitando en esta ocasión es para incrementar la cantidad de repuestos que ofrece en su negocio.
texts.en:
Virginia is 44 years old, is mother of three children who are studying in a different city, and now lives with her husband who works as a tractor operator. She is a secretary and works for the municipal government of her area, near her house.

She also has her own business, with a business partner, to buy and sell parts for motorcycles and motorcycle taxis. She has worked in this business for one year and it is successful due to her good business management. Virginia is very satisfied with her earnings and, because she is a woman who is always stays busy and takes advantage of every business opportunity that arises, she always wants to open a clothing store. She is saving up so that this dream can soon become a reality.

This is her 12th loan with MFP and during all this time what she most values about her work with the community bank is the feeling of comradeship between all the members, along with their dedication and responsibility for their repayments.

This loan will be used to increase the quantity of replacement parts that she offers in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Mary McKee, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise.

loans.name: Theary

texts.en:
Mr. Theary V., 28, and his wife, Mrs. Soklim Nao, 30 were married in 2003 and have three sons and two daughters. Their eldest son attends school and the other two are still too young. The family lives in a small village on National Road Number Two about twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. Mrs. Soklim Nao has been a garment factory worker for six years.

Theary has been selling cows for over twenty years. He buys them from his villagers and the nearby district for resale to a middleman who comes to buy the cows at his house. Theary is applying for his first loan of $1,000 in order to purchase additional cows for resale.

loans.use: To purchase additional cows for resale

loans.name: Khady

texts.fr: khady N. est vendeuse de petit dejeuner.elle est parent beneficiaire,elle habite camberene.elle a une experience de dix ans.elle sollicite un pret decent mille pour faire face a la forte demande a laquelle elle est confrontee.
texts.en:
Khady N. is a breakfast-seller. She is a client parent. She lives in Camberene. She has ten years of experience. She is requesting a loan of 100,000 francs to address the strong demand with which she is confronted.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary sells second-hand bags, shoes and bed sheets. Mary hopes for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more second-hand shoes and bed sheets to sell. Mary is 41 years old and married with two children. She says thank you to Kiva lenders and promises to repay her loan promptly.

loans.use: To purchase more second-hand bags and bed sheets to sell

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr: Akossiwa K. est une femme de 42 ans, mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Elle est revendeuse des tenues prêt à porter à Lomé. Elle exerce ce métier depuis 4 ans et souhaite avec ce crédit accroître la taille de son commerce en achetant de nouveaux produits pour la revente.
texts.en:
Akossiwa K. is a 42 year old woman, married and the mother of 2 children. She sells ready to wear clothing in Lomé. She has been practicing this trade for 4 years. She wishes to use this loan to increase the size of her business by purchasing new items to resale.


Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of ready-to-wear clothing for resale

loans.name: Marva

texts.en:
Marva is a member of the Mbagala east in kinyanambi,Iringa,she is 38 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 1 child.Her child is aged 4 years.

Marva started her own Tailoring business 2 years ago,she works 12 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 100,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Marva`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more materials for her business.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan,Marva hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more material

loans.name: Safiétou

texts.fr: Safiétou F. du Banc Villageois de Vélingara Ouest2 est âgée de 51 ans, elle est mariée et a en charge 4 enfants. Elle est d'une ancienneté de 5 ans et demi de son Banc Villageois et y a contracté 11 prêts qu'elle a toujours remboursés sans difficulté. L'objet de son crédit est de poursuivre son activité de vente sur table des produits alimentaires tels que des fruits, du Maïs, des œufs durs des arachides grillées etc. Les bénéfices de son petit commerce lui permettront de soutenir son mari pour la prise en charge de la famille et de subvenir à ses besoins personnels.
texts.en:
Safiétou Faofana, a member of the Vélingara Ouest2 Village Bank, is 51 years old and married with four children. She has been with her Village Bank for five and a half years, and has taken out and repaid eleven loans without difficulty. She plans to use this loan to continue her business selling food like fruits, corn, hardboiled eggs, roasted peanuts, etc. The profits generated by her small business will allow her to help her husband support their family and take care of her personal needs.

Translated from French by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To promote her business

loans.name: Jackilne

texts.en:
Jackline is a member of the Kichangani borrower group in Kihesa, Iringa. She is 32 year old woman, she is married and a mother of 3 children. Her children are 19, 11, 7 years old.

Jackilne has owned a clothing business for 1 year, she works 5 hours a day and she earns a monthly profit approximately 30,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Jackline`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 200,000 Tanzanian shillings in order to buy more kanga and vitenge (fabric) for sale.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan,Jackline hopes to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more kanga  and vitenge for sale

loans.name: Deogratious

texts.en:
Deogratious is a 34 year-old businessman who sells new clothes in Westlands Nairobi. He was previously employed in a soft drink manufacturing company before he began his business four years ago. He is requesting a loan of Kes. 50,000 to add to his stock of clothes. A father of two, Deogratious hopes to educate his children and start a business for his wife. He describes himself as social and determined.

About Faulu Kenya:

Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: To purchase new clothing.

loans.name: Constance

texts.fr: H. Constance est née en 1975 à Abomey-Calavi au Sud du Bénin. Constance est mariée à SENOU Ludovic, un gendarme. Constance et Ludovic ont trois enfants tous scolarisés et encore à leur charge. La famille vit à Djassin à Porto-Novo, Capitale Administrative du Bénin. Constance et Ludovic assurent ensemble les charges de la famille. Constance vend du pain au collège de Djassin. Constance vend aussi des divers (pâtes alimentaires ; boîtes de mayonnaises, tomate, sardines, lait ; du sucre ; des savons ; etc.). Constance achète ses produits à Ouando à Porto-Novo. Constance a eu deux crédits de ALIDé pour son activité. Constance a bien remboursé ses crédits. Constance sollicite un autre crédit pour mieux développer son activité.
texts.en:
H. Constance was born in 1975 in Abomey-Calavi in the south of Bénin. Constance is married to SENOU Ludovic, a gendarme. Constance and Ludovic have three children, all in school and all still under their care. The family lives in Djassin in Porto-Novo, Administrative Capital of Bénin.

Constance and Ludovic share in supporting their family. Constance sells bread at the high school in Djassin. Constance also sells varous other items (pasta, jars of mayonnaise, tins of tomatoes, sardines, milk; sugar and soap, etc.) She buys her products in Ouando in Porto-Novo.

Constance has received two loans from ALIDé for her business. She has reimbursed these loans in a timely manner. She is requesting another loan so that she can develop her business further.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of pasta, mayonnaise, tins of tomatoes, sardines, milk, etc. for resale

loans.name: Alberto

texts.en:
Alberto is part of a communal bank consisting of 19 members in Cruz Pata, a town 45 minutes from Cusco.  The group is called Sacro.  He is from Chinchero and lives in Cruz Pata.  He is 46 years old and married.

Alberto has a small farm and unloads merchandise from trucks in Cusco.  With this loan, he will buy supplies for his farm.

Alberto appreciates and thanks you for the loan and promises to pay the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: To buy supplies for his farm

loans.name: Juvelyn

texts.en:
Juvelyn B. is one of the youngest entrepreneurs in Maricaban, Pasay City. She is 19 years old and is not married.

Two years ago, Juvelyn joined the bandwagon of women entrepreneurs engaged in direct selling of cosmetics and apparel from prominent direct-selling companies (such as Avon, Sundance, Natasha, and Marikina Shoe Exchange), which is a proven additional source of income for women in the Philippines. She also sells biscuits and cookies from factory surpluses. She currently earns more than 5,000.00 pesos a month. Her earnings provide for her personal needs.

Juvelyn also happens to be one of the newest members of the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in Pasay City, having joined early this year. She hopes to receive from the cooperative the same social benefits her neighbors have been telling her about. She is now on her third loan cycle. She applied for a 9,000.00 peso loan as additional capital for her business. She dreams of having her own house and lot, and also a nice place to do business.

About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and an evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered on the Lordship of Jesus Christ. CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: Increase her inventory of cosmetics and apparel

loans.name: Isabelle Dessimé

texts.fr: Cette femme est une dame qui est mariée et mère de 04 enfants, elle vit avec sa famille dans le quartier d’attiegou qui est un quartier périphérique de la ville de Lomé. Son mari est un conducteur de taxi moto, afin de l’aider dans les charges de la famille, elle s’est lancée dans le commerce de maïs qui est une céréale très utilisée par les togolais dans leur alimentation. Pour réaliser une plus grande marge bénéficiaire sur ses ventes, elle  s’approvisionne à l’intérieur du pays à Anié. Voulant gonfler son stock elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l’achat de 17 sacs de maïs.
texts.en:
Isabelle Dessimé G. is a married woman and mother of 4 children. She lives with her family in the outlying Attiegou quarter of Lomé village. Her husband drives a motor taxi. To help support her family, Isabelle started trading maize, a grain Togolese people often use in their food. In order to make a larger profit margin on her sales, she buys her supplies inland in Anié. Wishing to increase her stock, she is asking for a WAGE loan to buy 17 sacks of maize.

Translated from French by Kelly Percival, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of Sacks of Maize

loans.name: United Trading Center Group

texts.en:
Mr. Anthony A. is a leader of a group of 2 borrowers called United Trading center. He is married with 3 children aged 12 to 25 years old, and their educational level that they have reached is the 3rd through the 12th grades.

Mr. Anthony's educational level is a Bachelor degree in Basic Education. He and his children lives downtown Voinjama city, and he works in the Voinjama central market, in the capital of Lofa county, in northern Liberia. His business is the sales of palm oil. He buys oil by the gallons and sells in the Voinjama central market. Mr. Anthony has been running this business for 3 years, and he is hoping to improve to become an international businessman. He is regular with his customers and sells quality oil in order to encourage customers to continue patronizing his business. Anthony needs this loan to buy and sell more palm oil on an export basis.

He dreams of being a great help to the family!

loans.use: To buy and sell more palm oil on export basis.

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en:
Adelina C. is from the village of Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 30 years old, is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Adelina owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Adelina is just starting this business.

In 2009, Adelina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan that Adelina has taken out from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Kadidiatou Foulo

texts.fr: Kadidiatou Foulo D. est une femme de 34 ans, elle est mariée et mère d'un enfant. Elle est membre du Banc villageois de GADAPARA depuis 5 ans. Avec son crédit elle fait un petit commerce de crème, de jus de fruits naturels, de glace et de couscous au lait. Elle participe à la prise en charge familiale.
texts.en:
Kadidiatou Foulo D. is a 34-year-old woman; she is married and the mother of one child. She has been a member of the “Banc Villageois” of GADAPARA for five years. With her loan she will run her small business selling cream, natural fruit juices, ice cream and couscous with milk. She helps support her family.

Translated from French by Robin Clochard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Promote her business

loans.name: P.

texts.en: G. is a 49 year old woman living with her husband and their 3 children.  They live in the Matara district of Sri Lanka on the southern coast of the island.  Her husband is a daily worker in a small hotel and she has a small grocery shop.  Their income is not enough to support their five-member family, so now she wants to increase her business with this loan.  She hopes to be self-sufficient and earn enough money to pay for her children's higher education and improve their livelihood in future.

loans.use: Grocery items such as rice, vegetables, cooking oils, spices, etc.

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en: Brenda L. is from the village of Gimangpang, Initao, Misamis Oriental. She is 35 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Brenda owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Brenda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. Brenda plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family’s income and to support the education of her children. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Seangheng's Group

texts.en: M.. Seangheng C. is 46 years-old. She is the village bank president for a group loan for 12 persons offered by Kiva partner AMK and located in Sampan Kraom village in Kandal province. With the loan, all the members hope to increase their income in order to improve the famiL. lifestyles. M.. Seangheng C. is a laborer who receives a small salary to support her famiL.. Her husband is a motorcycle taxi driver who earns a small income to support the famiL..  M.. Seangheng is requesting a loan of 800,000 Riels to fix up her home. M.. Seangheng is the mother of five children, two of whom stay at home while the other three attend the local school.

loans.use: To fix up her home.

loans.name: Franklin Ariel

texts.es:
Franklin E. A., quien  Labora como Conductor A en la Universidad Nacional Autónoma de Nicaragua UNAN-Managua, el tiene dos hijos a su cargo,  y  estos se encuentra en edad escolar, es casado, ha trabajado dos crédito con CEPRODEL durante dos años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido los crédito en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias al financiamiento otorgados por  CEPRDEL.  
El crédito solicitado es para la compra de materiales de  construcción como: zinc, perlines y clavos para el techo de su casa de de habitación. 
 Todo esto con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Franklin E. A. works as a driver for the National Autonomous University of Nicaragua (UNAN) in Managua. He is married and has two dependent children who are of school age. Franklin has been working with CEPRODEL for two years and during this period received two loans which were designated for making improvements to his home.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy construction materials such as zinc, crossbeams, and nails to repair the roof of his house. His goal is to provide greater security and better living conditions for his children.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to repair the roof of his house

loans.name: Luisa Marina

texts.es: Doña Luisa es una mujer activa, trabaja como conserje desde hace varios años, para una institución de investigación, con españoles, junto con su esposo han logrado hacer su casa, el trabaja como albañil, en donde se ha favorecido en no pagar la mano de obra.  Sus crédito lo ha invertido en las mejoras de su casa el cual se ha beneficiado para estas mejoras. Con este préstamo comprara materiales de construcción y  comenzara a construir otro cuarto el cual lo hará con arranque de piedra y forrado de zinc para suplir la necesidad de tener espacio para su familia, dos hijos  de los cuales siempre están con ellas. Y con el tiempo poder ir mejorando la infraestructura de piedra.
texts.en:
Luisa is an active woman. For several years she has worked as a janitor for a Spanish investigation institution. She and her husband have been able to build their house together. He works as a bricklayer, so they did not have to pay for the labor. Her loans have been invested in making improvements to her house. The improvements have been beneficial. With this loan she will buy construction materials and start building another room. It will be started with blocks, and zinc will be used to cover it. This will be done because the family needs to have more space. They have two children, and they are always with them. In time they will be able to continue improving the block infrastructure.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy block, sand, cement, timber, nails, and zinc to make a room

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en:
Juvy V. is a 29 year old married woman who supports her family by engaging in a general store and agriculture business. She lives in Brgy Kalumbuyan, Bayawan, Negros Oriental with her 30 year old husband Glen, who is a farmer, and their 2 children who are 9 mos old and 6 years old.

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2005 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store and agriculture business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of Php 5,000.

JUVY is now borrowing Php 25,000 so that she could expand her general store and agriculture business. This will be her 12th cycle loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of Php 22,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Juvy aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the “Dungganon” way.  

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital for her general store

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenece al banco comunal “PACAHA ILLARIY”; Nuestra socia vive en la comunidad de Llullucha,  distrito de Ocongate,  provincia de Quispicanchis departamento de Cusco.

Nuestra socia es ella  Sra. Roxana,  ella socia tiene 28 años de edad es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos, Nuestra socia  comparte sus actividades con el comercio minorista, la socia es artesana, realiza trabajos de tejidos en alpaca, oveja y lanas; Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales para que siga realizando sus mantas y diferentes trabajos en tejido.

La socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the "Pacaha Illariy" communal bank. She lives in the community of Llullucha in Ocongate district, Quispicanchis province, Cusco department. Her name is Roxana. She is 28 years old and lives with her boyfriend and two children. She shares her activities with a retailer. She is a retailer, making woven goods with alpaca and sheep wool. She is seeking this loan to buy materials so she can continue making blankets and other woven goods. She is grateful for the support from the loans and is committed to making her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials for woven goods

loans.name: Ismaila

texts.fr: Monsieur Ismaila S. est un retraite de 64 ans qui habite dans le quartier de KIP COCO à Guediawaye. Il est membre de la caisse de Baye Laye depuis février 2005. Il a déjà rembourse 4 crédits antérieurs. Pour mieux  gérer sa retraite il a choisi de s’adonner à l’aviculture pour commercialiser des poulets de chair. Monsieur S. sollicite un crédit de 300 000 frs pour augmenter le nombre de ses sujets afin de parvenir à éviter les ruptures dans la vente et faire face aux pénuries. Ses gains financiers lui permettent de gérer  les conditions de vie de sa famille et d’assurer les frais de scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Ismaila S. is a retired man of 64 years of age, who lives in the neighborhood of KIP COCO in Guediawaye. He is a member of the Baye Laye fund since February 2005. He obtained already four previous loans, all fully repaid. To better live his retirement he chose to get involved in poultry farming and sell broilers. Mr. S. requests a loan of 300,000 francs to increase the number of chickens so they will always be available for sale and he will be able to face sortage. With the profit he will take care of the needs of his family and pay school tuition for his children.

Translated from French by MONICA URBAN, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating funds

loans.name: Simona Del Carmen

texts.es:
Doña Simona es madre de cuatro hijos, vive en el barrio 25 de Febrero, su negocio es la venta de ropa que vende desde hace varios años, el cual inicio con dinero propio, de un tramo que vendió en el mercado Oriental, ya que las ventas estaban bajas.
Y deseaba probar vendiendo ambulante en los departamentos, lo que le ha resultado mejor.

Compra por cantidad de docenas ya que así vende a mejor precio, y va distribuyendo en las diferentes tiendas de los departamentos.
Pues es cansado ya que viaja a kilómetros para lograr el objetivo de vender. Parte de su inversión es propia pero trabaja con financiamiento lo que permite aumentar el volumen de compra y venta es por eso cada vez le resulta favorable a largo plazo. Con este préstamo comprara seis docenas de pantalones para damas y varón  cuatro docenas de camisa de damas y varón, telas variadas para ofertar estilos y colores. Con esto espera mejorar las ventas.
texts.en:
Simona is a mother with four children. She lives in the February 25th district. She sells clothes for a living and has been doing this for several years. She started her business with her own money that she raised by selling her spot in the Oriental Market since sales were few. She has had better results travelling in the departments to sell her merchandise. She purchases by the dozen since this way she can offer better prices and she distributes to the different stores in the departments. She is tired since she has to travel many kilometers to sell her merchandise. Part of the investment is her own, however she uses financing which allows her to buy more and sell more since this is better in the long run. With this loan she will buy six dozen pairs of men's and women's pants and four dozen men's and women's shirts in a variety of fabrics in order to offer different styles and colors. She hopes that this will increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Simona will use the loan to buy larger quantities of clothing, such as pants and shirts for men and women, in order to increase her sales.

loans.name: Elgen

texts.en:
Elgen B. is from the village of Bonbon Catarman   Camiguin. He is 44 years old  and widowed, with 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Elgen  provides taxi services to local community members. Elgen has been engaged in his business for more than 10 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Elgen joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elgen has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. That previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Elgen is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Elgen from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Dourng

texts.en:
Dourng S., 51, is married and lives with her husband and three children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known as the most favorite tourist place in the country. S. sells porridge and noodles, earning an income of USD 6 per day. Her husband is a gardener at a hotel and earns an income of USD 4 per day.

S. is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to expand her food business and to repair her house. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to support her children’s study. This is her third loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To expand her food business and repair her house

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita P. is from the village of Panalsalan. She is 58 years old. Rosita is widowed and has nine adult children. To make a living, Rosita owns & operates a business harvesting & selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Rosita has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rosita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Rosita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Extraction and sale of coconut oil

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en: Milagros M. is from the village of Salawagan, Quezon, Bukidnon. She is 46 years old and is married with seven school-aged children. Milagros owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling clothing and shoe products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Milagros joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Milagros is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 3rd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.
