loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary M. M. is twenty-three years old and single. She has two children aged six years and two years.

Mary’s business is located at a busy estate in Nairobi called Pumwani where she sells such items as shawls, shoes and jewelry to the local people. She has been in this business for the last six years.

Mary says that this business is profitable and the major challenge she has is the fact that there so many other people in the area doing the same kind of business as hers and so customers are spoilt for choice. However, she works hard from early morning to late evening to ensure that her business is doing well.

Mary is using her loan of Kes 20,000 to buy clothes and flower vases to meet the demand of her customers. She hopes to grow her business to a boutique in the next five years. She describes herself as hardworking and determined.

loans.use: To buy clothes and flower vases to sell

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina N. was born in1969, she is married to Thomas Ngang and they are blessed with five children, amongst which two are below the age of fifteen. They live in a house made of five rooms and two persons occupy a room. She lives in Ntangang a quarter in Bamenda North West Region of Cameroon.

Christina N. has faced some challenges in life. The most terrifying thing that happened in her life has been the issue of accidents and death of her family members. Poverty has been her major difficulty in life, and the inability to raise capital for business projects. She plans to invest this loan in a house rental business. With this loan she plans to improve the living standard of her family with the proceeds from the investment. She believes the business will succeed because she has been in the business for a long time. She thinks the pressing needs of housing by inhabitants of the locality and students coming to studying in the locality will be an outstanding factor for the success of the business. The structure will be styled beautifully and hence will attract potential tenants, and subsequently lead to the success of her business. The loan will help her community because they will be able to accommodate families and visitors to the neighborhood.

Christina N. will plough back her profit into her business and use part to care for her family. She also will use the proceeds to expand her business and save for rainy days. She prefers GHAPE because of the training she frequently receives and the low cost in obtaining and paying back a loan.

About GHAPE 
The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To build a house for rental.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita T.'s main source of income comes from providing pedicure and manicure services to local community members.In this services shes doing the cleaning, cutting , and over all make over of the customers nails. She is 34 years old, married and has four school-aged children. They are from the village of Poblacion, Valencia City, Bukidnon. Anita has been in her business for over one year and earns approximately 3,000 (PHP) a month.

In 2010, Anita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. . She is requesting a  loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional materials for her service. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use additional income to improve her living condition and improve her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional materials for the service

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn P. is from the village of Ricoro, Gingoog City. She is 38 years old. Jocelyn is married and has seven school-aged children. To make a living, Jocelyn owns and operates a retail store selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, snacks, sugar, detergents and biscuits. Jocelyn has been engaged in her business for more than two years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Jocelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Jocelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell.

Jocelyn is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional inventory and as working capital for the business. This will be the second loan taken by Jocelyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and as working capital for the business

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios B. is a married woman with five children who are between 22 to 31 years old. She lives in Barangay Tuguis, a part of Hinigaran municipality, Negros Occidental province on the Mindanao islands. She earns her living by operating a general store. Her husband, Francisco B., 55 years old, works as a guard and also helps with his wife's store.

Remedios joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2001 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past fifteen loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Remedios has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 19,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of 8,000 PHP, lifting the family's standard of living.

For this, her sixteenth loan, she is borrowing 21,000 PHP, which she intends to use as additional capital for her general store so that she can continue to save up for future home repairs and savings. Remedios B. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through its alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a dollar a day to achieving realities beyond their dreams. They are on a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon—a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: For additional capital for her store

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “EL AMANECER”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Luis Alberto; el tiene 24 años de edad y es soltero; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de servicio de taxi que hace servicio en las diferentes calles de la ciudad de Cusco, el trabaja desde las 5:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m, el socio quiere mejorar el carro. El  socio solicita el préstamo para el mantenimiento de su carro.

El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member is belongs to the community bank named "The Dawn". The bank is located in the district, province, and region of Cusco. 

His name is Luis Alberto. He is 24 years old and he is single. He has a taxi business, providing service along various streets in the city of Cusco. He works from 5 a.m. to 8 p.m.  He needs to carry out some maintenance to his car and he requests a loan to this end. 

He is very grateful to all of those who have become part of his dream and he is committed to the payment terms established for his loan.

loans.use: To carry out maintenance repairs to his car.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cereals at wholesale.

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred M. is from the town of Banga. She is 38 years old, married and has three children, ages 14, 12 and 11. Mildred's main source of income comes from planting and harvesting rice and corn for sale.

Mildred joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Mildred has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. She is requesting a new loan of 8,000 Philippine pesos which will be used to buy seeds and fertilizers. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay for her children's tuition fees.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Amigos Del  Milenio Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal “Amigos del  Milenio” tiene 13 ciclos D. funcionamiento (cada ciclo son 4 meses),  el banco comunal está conformado por 10 mujeres y 2 varones. Las reuniones del banco comunal son cada treinta días en la oficina central D. la Asociación Arariwa D. la ciudad del Cusco. La mayoría D. los socios viven en los diferentes distritos D. la ciudad del Cusco. 

Los socios son trabajadores y emprendedores que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos.  Las actividades económicas D. algunos D. los socios a las que se dedican son por ejemplo; venta D. verduras, venta D. condimentos, venta D. pasamanería y venta D. comestibles. Otros socios se dedican a brindar servicios D. café D. internet, contabilidad, empleada D. una tienda D. imprenta y analista D. créditos.  

La socia Bertha, tiene 53 años y está casada.  Actualmente,  Bertha  vive junto con su esposo  y sus tres hijos en el populoso distrito D. San Sebastián. Su actividad económica principal D. Bertha es la venta D. comestibles, ella venD. sus productos en su propia tienda que está ubicada en su domicilio, se la pueD. encontrar a la socia en su negocio D. lunes a domingo desD. las 6 D. la mañana hasta las 9 D. la noche. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien.  Bertha va invertir el préstamo en el capital del negocio y desea comprar más mercadería como por ejemplo arroz, fideos, leche, azúcar y muchas cosas más.
texts.en:
The comunal bank, "Amigos del Milenio" (Friends of the Millenium) has 13 working cycles ( each cycle is 4 months); the comunal bank is maD. up of 10 women and 2 males.  The group meets every 30 days at the central offices of the Arariwa Association in the city of Cusco.  Most of the group's members live in the various districts of Cusco.

The members are hard-working and entrepreneurial and are searching for opportunities to get ahead and with their daily efforts be able to proviD. a better future to their children.  As an example, some of the business activites of the members are: selling vegetables, snacks, ornaments, and groceries.  Other members proviD. services such as: internet cafes, accountancy, credit analysts, and an employee at a print shop.

Bertha is a member, she is 53 years old, married and lives with her husband and 3 children in the San Sebastian district.  Bertha's primary business activity is selling groceries and she does so from her own store located at her residence. She has been in the business several years with success and can be found at her place of business, Monday-Sunday from 6AM until 9PM.  Bertha will be utilizing the loan as working capital for the business and wants to purchase goods such as; rice, noodles, milk, sugar, and much more.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise such as: rice, noodles, milk, sugar, and much more.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: The borrower is 63 years old, married, and has two children. He graduated from primary school. He has a mini-market and he will use this loan to purchase supplies and foodstuffs. The borrower has a good reputation in the market due to his age and secondly due to the good quality of the products that he sells. The borrower has a good experience in selling these items to customers; as a result customers do their shopping at his market.

loans.use: For purchasing supplies and fresh fruit

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley is 42 years old, married and supports her family by operating three business ventures: food vending, providing tricycle transportation and selling ready to wear clothing. She lives in E. B. Magalona, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2000 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 4,000. Shirley is borrowing PHP 15,000 to purchase raw materials. This will be her 12th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 13,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Shirley aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for business

loans.name: Zainab C

texts.en:
This is 38 year-old Zainab.  She is married, and has 3 children ages 13, 7 and 3 years old.  She has 3 additional dependents who live with her because they are her nieces and nephew.  

In 2009, Zainab established her pharmacy business.  She began her business because she wants to take care of herself and family.  Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about 1,009,200 SLL every month from this business.  She would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL.  Zainab requires a loan in order to buy additional medicines for her pharmacy.  She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 601,840 SLL.  In the future, Zainab plans to open another outlet.   She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy medical drugs.

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma lives with her husband in Kisauni. They  have five children and live at a rental house. Her business is a retail shop, which she has had for years. She sells basic needs items.

With the Kshs 30,000 loan she is requesting, she will buy more inventory like kitchen utensils like plates, bowls, jugs, mugs and also repair her sales kiosk. Mwanajuma faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of establishing a cafe in the future to stabilize her financial condition. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to raise her standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase plates, bowls, jugs, mugs to sell and repair her sales kiosk.

loans.name: Mugoma Feed The Family Group A In Kyenjojo

texts.en:
K. Yosam is the leader of the Mugoma feed the family group A in Kyenjojo. He is 60 years old and married with 6 children, 4 of whom are still in school. Yosam is a farmer who grows and sells produce such as maize and beans. He operates from Mugoma and works with his wife and eldest two children. He has grocery stores in Kyenjojo and is able to make a weekly profit of 70,000 UGX.

Yosam grew up in a farming household and his first business was growing fresh foods and vegetables 20 years ago, and he still grows them to get more income. His dream is to be able to put up a big store in Kyenjojo with the help of loans. He is happy that the same loans have enabled him to buy more land for agriculture. Yosam needs this loan to buy stock produce.

loans.use: to buy more stock produce such as maize and beans

loans.name: Fabiola De Jesús

texts.es:
Desde pequeña Fabiola ha tenido gran habilidad para las manualidades, arte que convirtió en su forma de ganarse la vida después de separarse de su esposo y quedar a cargo del hogar y de sus 2 hijos, desde entonces se dedicó a realizar manualidades para la venta y así salir adelante como madre cabeza de hogar. 

Aunque actualmente Fabiola realiza sus manualidades desde la comunidad del hogar, esta emprendedora espera ampliar su negocio y ganar reconocimiento para incrementar sus ventas y ofrecerle un mejor futuro a su familia. 

Fabiola necesita de un préstamo para comprar materia prima y ampliar su portafolio de productos para captar más clientes y crecer poco a poco.
texts.en:
Since she was very young, Fabiola has had a great ability for crafting. It is an art form that she developed into her way to earn a living after she separated from her husband and she was left in charge of the household and her two children. Since then she has made crafts for sale, in order to come out ahead as the head of the household.

Although she currently makes her crafts from the comfort of her home this enterprising woman wants to expand her business and to earn recognition for increasing her sales and for providing her family with a better future.

Fabiola needs a loan to purchase materials and to expand her portfolio of products in order to capture more clients and grow incrementally.

loans.use: to purchase crafting materials

loans.name: Blanca Margarita

texts.es:
La Parrilla Paisa es el negocio que creó Blanca Margarita M. A. con la ilusión de ofrecerle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y contribuir a cubrir los gastos del hogar, pues su bajo nivel de escolaridad no le permitía acceder a empleos fácilmente, por ello se dedicó a hacer lo que sabe, comidas. 

Su punto de venta ubicado en el municipio de Girardota en las afueras de Medellín es un espacio en el que además de almuerzos, se puede disfrutar de empanadas, pasteles de pollo y otros productos que normalmente la gente consume. 

Durante algunos años esta emprendedora estuvo ubicada en la Plaza de Mercado, lugar de donde fue reubicada hace algunos días por la administración municipal, por ello, necesita realizar algunas adecuaciones locativas que le permitan realizar su labor cotidiana.
texts.en:
"La Parrilla Paisa" ["The Paisa Grill"] is the business created by Blanca Margarita M. A., with the dream of offering her family a better quality of life and contributing to the household expenses. Her low level of education did not allow her easy access to jobs, so she dedicated herself to working in an area she knows: food. 

Her point of sale, located in the municipality of Girardota outside of Medellín, is a place where in addition to full lunches, one can enjoy empanadas, chicken pies, and other products which the people usually eat.  

For several years, this entrepreneur had her business on the Plaza de Mercado [market square], from which she was relocated several days ago by the city administration. For this reason, she has to make some improvements to her new location which will allow her to carry out her daily labor.

loans.use: to fix up her restaurant.

loans.name: Anvarjon

texts.en:
Anvarjon is married and the young father of one son. He is a singer, he has a band and plays at traditional weddings and other events in his region. His group is very popular in his region and he has many orders for different events. 

Each performance depends on different occasions and makes good memories. That’s why he tries to make his clients happy  in order to give them good memories. For this purpose he requested a loan of 4700 Somoni to purchase a a keyboard. 

Besides this business he is running an animal husbandry business and processing dry fruits at home. This loan will be the fourth loan for Anvarjon from Imon International and he has a good credit history.    

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy a musical instrument

loans.name: Frida

texts.en: Frida is from the village of Isahakyan in the Shirak region of Armenia.  She is married with three children – two daughters (twenty-three and twenty-four years old) and a nineteen-year-old son.  Frida has a high school education and has been farming for the past ten years.  Through a microfinance loan, Frida would like to invest in her business with the goal of increasing both revenues and net profit.  By purchasing fertilizer and feed, she expects the family income to increase by twenty percent.  She likes living in Isahakyan and considers the villagers good people.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and feed

loans.name: Ascencion

texts.es:
Asención  tiene 46 años es soltera cuenta con casa propia la cual está en zona rural ubicada  en el caserío La Curva un anexo a Batangrande, a una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Asención  se dedica a la cría de animales menores, en su mayoría aves como gallinas, pavos, patos, etc. Además ha instalado en sus domicilio una pequeña tienda de abarrotes donde comercializa miel de abejas, con mas de 10 años de experiencia, el caserío, ella a conseguido fidelizar a muchos clientes a su negocio

Asención desea  comprar mas productos (abarrotes), para surtir su negocio y cera para sus colmenas de abejas, d esta manera pueda aumentar su capacidad de adquisición y almacenamiento y que su número de clientes ha ido en aumento, por ello está solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2200  nuevos soles, para poder realizar todo lo que se ha propuesto.

Asención es una mujer bastante trabajadora y que se esfuerza a diario por salir adelante y tener una mejor calidad de vida. Las personas que la conocen le consideran una persona  amable y siempre dispuesta a ayudar a los demás.
texts.en:
Asención is 46 years old, single, and has her own home located in a rural area in the town of La Curva, and annex of Batangrande, about an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo.

Asención raises young animals, mostly birds such as chickens, turkeys, and ducks.  She also has a small grocery store located in her home where she sells honey.  She has more than ten years of experience.  In the village she has been able to maintain many loyal customers.

Asención wants to purchase more products (groceries) to stock her store and wax for her bee colonies.  In this way, she can expand her capacity for purchasing and storage.  Her number of customers has grown, so she is asking for a loan of 2200 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa to do everything she has proposed.

Asención is a hardworking woman who makes an effort every day to get ahead and have a better quality of life.  The people who know her consider her a kind person who is always ready to help others.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to stock her store.

loans.name: Sumeldita

texts.es: Sumeldita de 28 años, es una mujer muy humilde y trabajadora, vive en su propia casa  junto a su pareja Ezequiel de 35 años y sus 02 queridos hijos Renzo de 06 años y Ever de 01 año de edad por quienes se esmera en trabajar muy duro. Ella cuenta, que se levanta muy temprano para preparar los alimentos para los miembros de su familia y luego alista a su mayor hijo para mandarle a su colegio, para así dirigirse tranquilamente a la chacra con su amado esposo. Sumeldita cultiva plantas de cacao, café, y variedad de frutas cítricas, productos importantes que le sirven de sustento para sobre salir y cubrir el gasto de educación. En tiempos de cosecha y deshierbo de malezas necesariamente contrata jornaleros para poder avanzar con mayor celeridad en cuanto a su faena programada. Gracias a las sugerencias de las socias de su banco ella optó en acercarse a MFP para solicitar su crédito ya que ella tiene referencias que nuestra institución presta créditos a las personas mas necesitadas con fines a invertir el dinero en algo útil. Con el apoyo de los financistas llevará acabo sus actividades programadas, por ello requiere el dinero para comprar sacos de abono para mejorar sus tierras  y volverlas muy fructíferas. Posteriormente piensa comprar más espacios de terreno para seguir cultivando. Este será su primer crédito, por ello espera de la colaboración para poder comprar los productos sugeridos, a la vez se compromete en pagar puntualmente sus cronogramas de pago ya que desea acceder a otros préstamos posteriormente. Con los 1,500 nuevos soles comprará sacos de abono ya que le servirán para mejorar sus plantas.
texts.en:
28 year-old Sumeldita is a very unassuming and hard-working woman who lives in her own home together with her partner, 35 year-old Ezequiel, and her two beloved children: 6 year-old Renzo and 1 year-old Ever, for whom she works very hard.

Sumeldita tells us that she gets up very early in the morning to prepare food for the members of her family.  She then gets her eldest son ready for school and heads peacefully to the farm together with her husband who she loves very much.  Sumeldita grows cacao and coffee plants and a variety of citrus fruits.  These are important products which help support her family and cover her children's education expenses.  During harvest and weeding times, she must hire day laborers so that she can advance more quickly in her work.  Thanks to suggestions from the members of her community bank, she decided to come to MFP to request a loan since she was told that our institution provides loans to those who are most in need and who plan to invest their money in something useful.

With the support of lenders, Sumeldita will carry out her planned farming activities.  She needs money to buy sacks of manure so that she can improve her land and make it more productive.  She later plans to buy more land so that she can continue growing her crops.  This will be Sumeldita's first loan and she hopes to receive your cooperation so that she can buy the products she needs.  Sumeldita pledges to make her loan repayments on time as she would like to access other loans in the future.  She will use the 1,500 Peruvian soles to buy sacks of manure which will help her to improve her plants.

loans.use: to buy sacks of organic fertilizer

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok (in the photo) is a rice and vegetable farmer, while her husband is employed full-time in a company delivering pure drinking water. Sok has asked for a Kiva loan. She now is requesting another loan of $1,000 to add to her own money to purchase a Tuk Tuk for her son-in-law to drive Tuk Tuk taxi.

Sok and her husband live in a village on National Road Number 2, about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have five married children. Four live outside the family home and another one still lives in the family home.

loans.use: to add to her own money to purchase a Tuk Tuk for her son-in-law.

loans.name: Ma. Rita

texts.en:
Ma. Rita is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has two children.
 
Ma. Rita has a retail shop that sells canned goods, breads, snacks, bananas and coconuts. She has had this business for five years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks for store expansion & additional foods to sell.

Ma. Rita has been a member of HSPFI since 2006. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks for store expansion & additional foods to sell.

loans.name: Lizzie

texts.en:
Lizzie is a single lady who is 38 years old and the mother of a 13-year-old child. She sells curio items, cereals and different products to her customers. She has been in this business for a period of two years now.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend. With this loan, she plans to buy more curios and cereals. She desires to grow and become a great exporter of curios to other countries.

loans.use: to buy more curio items to sell

loans.name: Armando Jose

texts.es: Armando José posee una moto taxi la cual brinda el servicio de transporte en las zonas alejadas de la ciudad, Armando arquila la moto taxi para que otro señor trabaje y le entregue lo que gana pues él trabaja como maestro de primaria. Armando tuvo que ahorrar para comprarse so moto taxi y poder proporcionarle a su familia más ingresos. El crédito es para la compra de llantas, focos, frenos, y pintar la moto taxi.
texts.en: Armando José has a moto taxi which offers a transport service to the remote zones of the city. Armando rents out the moto taxi so that another person can work and give him what he earns, as Armando works as an elementary school teacher. Armando had to save up to buy himself the moto taxi in order to offer his family more income. This loan is for the purchase of tires, headlights, brakes, and to paint the moto taxi.

loans.use: to purchase tires, headlights, brakes, and to paint the moto taxi.

loans.name: Mavuno Group

texts.en:
Witness, who is in her mid 30s, is married with two children who go to school.  She has been running a business of selling new and second-hand clothes and shoes, which she sells door to door, for two and a half years now.  She works from 7:00 am to 8:00 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be her third loan from from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to increase the stock for her business and also prepared and sold nutritious flour to make baby food (lishe). She has repaid all her loans successfully. She wants a loan to buy more new and second-hand clothes and bags to sell. She will also increase the lishe stock.  Her dream is to one day be able to open a bricks selling business.

She will share this loan with her loan group, "Mavuno," which has a total of 17 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy more new and second-hand clothes and bags to sell and increase stock of lishe.

loans.name: Jean Pierre

texts.en:
Jean Pierre has been an artisan all his life. He had his own crafts workshop in his native Congo before moving to the US as a refugee in 2007. After almost three years of working with a non-profit that produced and commercialized African crafts, he decided to start his own business. Jean Pierre uses his connections with African artisans living in the US to purchase crafts, but he also buys products from Africa whenever he can purchase in bulk. He resells all the crafts at fairs and shows in his area. These shows take place during the weekends, which enables him to keep his full-time job. Certain shows and larger clients require more business formality, which in the industry translates into websites and product portfolios. Jean Pierre hopes to open a big crafts store in the United States some day.

Jean Pierre wants a loan to set up a business website to expand his clientele and to be able to sell during the weekdays. The remainder of the loan proceeds will go to make bulk purchases.

loans.use: To set up a business website and buy more inventory

loans.name: Four Angels Group

texts.en:
Doreen is 30 years old and is married. She lives in Machipisa. Her husband is an electrician and they have two children one of whom attends school. The other is two years old.

She runs a hair salon and employs 2 people. She also sells hair products. Business is going well but can be adversely affected by electricity shortages.

She will spend the money she borrows to buy hairdryers and other consumables.
In the future she looks forward to owning a large salon with more staff.

loans.use: To buy hair dryers and accessories for the salon.

loans.name: Mirsaid

texts.ru: Мирсаид занимается выращиванием сельскохозяйственных культур. В основном он выращивает овощи, такие как лук, морковь, картошка и другие сельхоз культуры. А также он выращивает пшеницу. Мисаид работает усердно и хочет развивать свой бизнес. Он хотел бы получить займ для покупки минеральных удобрений для обработки земли.
texts.en: Mirsaid is involved in growing agricultural crops.  He primarily grows vegetables, such as onions, carrots, potatoes and other agricultural crops.  He also grows wheat.  Mirsaid works diligently and wants to develop his business.  He wants to obtain this loan for the purchase of mineral fertilizers to treat the land.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Zubaidullo

texts.ru: Зубайдулло женат имеет шестерых детей. На воспитание и содержание семьи у него большие расходы. Но эти свои расходы он покрывает работой на земле – выращиванием  сельхозпродуктов. Работа на земле  требует тщательного ухода. Вместе с женой они работают на поле и получают немалые доходы. В последнее время минеральные удобрения подорожали и поэтому для покупки минеральных удобрений Зубайдулло хочет получить займ. Часть займа он также будет потратить для оплаты рабочей силы.
texts.en: Zubaidullo is married and has six children.  His child rearing and family support expenses are very high, but he covers his expenses by working on the land - growing agricultural products.  Work on the land requires diligent care.  Together with his wife, they work on the field and earn a good income.  Lately, mineral fertilizers went up in price and Zubaidullo wants to obtain a loan to purchase mineral fertilizers.  He wants to also use some of the loan funds to pay for labor.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers and also to pay for labor

loans.name: Omari

texts.en:
Omari is a married man with eight children, six of whom are enrolled in school while the other two are adults. His wife is a farmer who contributes to the provision of the family’s basic needs. He owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for his family.

Omari has operated a goat meat selling business for the past 15 years; he sells his products at the market. His biggest challenge is livestock disease and sometimes even death. He dreams of expanding his business. 

With the Kshs 20,000 loan, he wants to purchase more goats for resale. He decided to join Yehu Microfinance because of their favorable terms and conditions.

loans.use: To purchase more goats for resale.

loans.name: Leandro

texts.es: El señor Leandro se dedica a la venta de varios productos de primera necesidad, el tiene una tienda de barrio en su mismo domicilio, es muy dedicado a su negocio y presta una buena atención a sus clientes. Solicito el crédito para el arreglo de su vehículo y la compra de mercadería para poder surtir de productos variados su tienda, ya que tiene clientela por ser la única tienda por la zona, el esta agradecido con la institución por la atención prestada.
texts.en: Leandro's business is selling basic household products.  He has a neighborhood store which is located in his own home.  He is very committed to his business and provides a good service to his customers.  He requested this loan so that he could have his vehicle repaired and buy merchandise so that he can stock his store with a variety of products.  He has customers because his is the only store in his area.  He is grateful to the institution for the way they have treated him.

loans.use: to have his vehicle repaired and to buy merchandise

loans.name: Fortaleza Group

texts.es:
El comité Fortaleza nace mediante la gestión y el apoyo de otro comité que se encontraba trabajando en la zona. Este comité es de la Ciudad de San Lorenzo, las integrantes del comité fijaron como objetivo principal el crecimiento de cada una de ellas no solo en lo económico, sino también en lo personal. Ellas son reconocidas en el lugar como mujeres muy trabajadoras y luchadoras.
La Sra. Maria es la presidenta del grupo tiene 38 años, ella es una mujer muy emprendedora y capaz de liderar un grupo numeroso como lo es este, durante todos estos ciclos ha demostrado ganas de superación y mucha confianza. Ella comenta que tiene una librería bien equipada donde tiene todo tipo de productos.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de cuadernos, bolígrafos, pinceles, libros y demás, con lo cual podrá abastecer su local.
texts.en:
The Fortaleza (“Strength”) Committee was born thanks to the management and support of another Committee that was working in the area of the town of San Lorenzo, where Fortaleza comes from. The members of this committee have set the economic and personal growth of each one of them as their primary goal. They are known in their area as hardworking and tenacious women.
Maria is the president of the group and she is 38 years old. She is a very resourceful woman, and she is very good at leading such a big group as this one. During all of their cycles she has been noted for her desire to grow and for being deeply trustworthy. She says she runs a well-furnished bookshop where she keeps all kinds of products.
She is requesting a loan to buy notepads, pens, paintbrushes, books and other items to stock up her shop.

loans.use: To buy notepads, pens, paintbrushes and books to stock up her shop.

loans.name: Amjad

texts.en:
Amjad is a 24-year-old young man; he is married with one daughter. He has a stall where he sells fruits and vegetables, which is the only source of income for the family. 

Amjad wants to expand his work by purchasing more fruits and vegetables to resell and a refrigerator for frozen food. However, he doesn't have enough money to make these purchases on his own, so he needs to take a loan from FATEN. When Amjad gets the loan, he will be able to purchase what he needs to expand his work and enable him to compete. This will increase his sales, which will increase his income and enable him to provide better living conditions for his family. 

Amjad is photographed next to his stall.

About this loan product:
 FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables to resell and purchase a refrigerator for frozen food.

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta works hard to support her family. Loreta is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Loreta requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to buy a new engine for her fishing boat. Loreta has been in this business for 12 years.

In the future, Loreta would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

loans.name: Tutiniso

texts.ru: Тутинисо более девяти лет занимается продажей женских тканей. Она товар приобретает за пределами страны и старается расширить свой бизнес. Она разведенная и детей не имеет. Она начала свой бизнес с продажи детской обуви и одежды,  торговля детскими вещами приносила ей радость. Она радовалась когда дети радостными уходили приобретя нужную вещь. А потом перешла на продажу женских тканей для того, чтобы получить побольше прибыли. Она хочет получить займ в размере $3000 США для приобретения нового товара  к Новому году. Она хочет пополнить свой ассортимент и получить больше прибыли от торговли под Новый год. Она надеется на вашу помощь и поддержку спасибо!
texts.en:
Tutiniso has worked with selling children's clothing and shoes for more than ten years. She acquires her products outside the country and tries to expand her business. She is divorced, and does not have children, but trading children's clothes and shoes brings her joy. She is happy when children leave happy, having purchased necessary clothing. Then Tutiniso switched to women's clothing trade to achive higher profit margins. 

Tutiniso wants to receive a loan in the amount of 3000 US dollars for the purchase of new inventory for the New Year's celebration. She wants to expand her inventory and supplement her product range to make profits from trade on the New Year's celebration and gift giving season. She hopes to get help and thanks for the support.

loans.use: to buy merchandise supplementing the current product range of women's clothing

loans.name: Sopheab

texts.en:
Sopheab (in the photo), aged 32, is a weaver and she is also a vegetable farmer. She has been married since 2004 and has two young children and has just now given birth to one more baby. Her husband, Vansy, aged 42, is a motor taxi driver. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Sopheab is requesting her first loan of $600 to buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticide for her vegetable farm and to purchase weaving materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticide for her vegetable farm and to purchase weaving materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Coleta

texts.en:
Coleta is 36 years old and is married to Mutunga. They have two children. She has been selling timber and firewood for the past 13 years with a monthly income of Kes 8700.

She is applying for her first loan with KADET ltd of Kes 20, 000. She will use the funds to purchase stock of timber and firewood for her business. With the anticipated profits she will educate her children.

Her hopes and dreams are to offer her customers the best and to take care of her family

loans.use: To purchase stock of timber and firewood

loans.name: Filasteen

texts.en:
Filasteen is a conservative person, so she is unwilling to upload her picture on the Internet. The man in the photo is her husband.

Filasteen is a 22-year-old married woman from Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan. She is the mother of two children.

Filasteen sells cleaning products and she is requesting a loan of 400 JOD to purchase more quantities for trading purposes.

Filasteen is looking to open a shop for her business and to improve her family's life conditions.

Because Filasteen is under 30 years old, her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to purchase cleaning products for trading purposes.

loans.name: Rita

texts.es: Rita quedo huérfana de padre y madre a muy corta edad, su hermano mayor Juan Carlos se hizo cargo del hogar, sin embargo ella a su corta edad vio necesario colaborar con los gastos de su casa, por lo que muy joven comenzó a trabajar, no pudo estudiar mas que la primaria, y tuvo que idearse algún tipo de negocio. En este sentido es que decide comercializar prendas de vestir, inicialmente de forma ambulante, en las ferias y mercados, pero en algunos lugares las vendedoras que tenían puestos le reclamaban por el tipo de venta que ella realizaba indicándole que tenia que asentarse en algún lugar y como las otras pagar un patente,  es así que haciendo un esfuerzo logra conseguir un puesto de venta, desde el cual actualmente vende sus prendas, ahora vende pantalones de tela y pantalones de jeans para dama, haciendo que su cartera de clientes sea bastante cautiva por la variedad de modelos, y exclusividad que tiene en sus prendas. Tiene una pequeña hija de 7 meses,  vive con el papá de la niña, tiene todo el deseo de formar un hogar definitivo, porque ella no pudo tener ese entorno familiar. Por el momento solo desea concentrarse en su negocio para poder darle un futuro bueno a su niña.EL credito que solicita es para la compra de
texts.en:
Rita became an orphan at an early age when she lost her mother and father.  Her older brother Juan Carlos took charge of the household but, even as young as she was, she saw the need to contribute to the household expenses and began working.  She was not able to study beyond primary school because she had to find work.  She decided to sell clothing as a street vendor at fairs and markets.  But some of the vendors who had stalls selling the same type of merchandise complained that she had to stay put somewhere and pay a fee like the others.  So through much effort she acquired a stall where she sells clothing such as women's trousers and jeans.  She has a good customer base because of the variety and exclusivity of her merchandise.

She has a seven-month-old daughter who lives with the child's father.  She wants to establish a stable home because she was unable to have a family environment.  For now she wants to concentrate on her business and give her daughter a good future.  The loan will be used to buy clothing.

loans.use: To increase working capital.

loans.name: Jesselyn

texts.en:
Jesselyn is 20 years old and is the fourth of four children in the family. Her mother "Teofila" supports the family through making and selling peanut butter in the Philippines.


Jesselyn is studying for her Bachelor of Science in Hospitality Management and is currently in the third year of this four-year course.

Jesselyn is borrowing Php 6000 to pay for the tuition fees for the second semester of the school year 2014-2015.

When she graduates, Jesselyn plans to have a stable job in order to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees.

loans.name: Sakhiba

texts.en:
Sakhiba is internally Displaced Person ( IDP ) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan Lachin region Chiragli village. She is 46 years old, has 3 children. She was settled in Absheron region Masazir village. Sakhiba supports to her family herself because she is widow. She borrowed the loan amount of $400 and built the grocery.
Having borrowed a loan amount of $1000 for the second time Sakhiba bought the refrigerator and the foodstuffs. 
She plans to buy the refrigerators and to increase the equipments of the grocery store , therefore she has  applied for a loan of $1500. She is a very hard worker.She wants to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy the refrigerators

loans.name: Josephat

texts.en:
Mr. L. is married with three children. His first son is in college. Mr L. first came to PEMCI with a request of a $429 loan to enable him purchase a new power saw for his business. He successfully repaid the loan and requested a 2nd loan of $714 to stock up his business with raw timber. Kiva funded the second loan which he has been able to clear from the bulk sale of his remaining timber stocks.

He has now requested a loan of US$1200 which will enable him to expand his furniture making business. So far PEMCI has had a very successful relationship with Mr L. and we are proud to be associated with his business growth. He is a determined businessman and is well respected in the community for his honesty and hard work. He is a role model for other upcoming businesses and we need more like him. Through his activities he is able to employ a number of workers and to mentor younger people entering the furniture business. Mr L. is worth the support of Kiva partners in his contribution to alleviating poverty and unemployment in this part of the country.

loans.use: To expand his furniture making business

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario has run her business selling snacks and school supplies for the last 7 years inside a small school near her house. Her opening hours are from 7am to 2pm. Seeing the need for a supply of these products in this educational establishment, she was motivated to start her business, and she has managed to keep it afloat thanks to the constant dedication and good service that Rosario has offered during the business’s development.

Rosario is looking for a loan in order to increase the range of products and offer more variety that is already in full swing during the school year. Thanks to the good quality of her products and the attentive service she provides for her customers, she has been able to increase the number of clients. Rosario wants to take advantage of this opportunity to expand her business.

Rosario is 40 years old and married: her husband works as a driver and in his spare time helps her with the business. They have three children, of whom one is studying. Their house is of mixed construction, the floor is earthen. Her hope is that with the profits from her work she will be able to improve the quality of life for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Rosario tiene su negocio de venta de confites y artículos escolares desde hace 7 años en el interior de una pequeña escuela cerca de su casa. Su horario de atención es de 7 a. m a 2 p.m. Dada a la necesidad de estos productos en este lugar educativo se vio motivada a iniciar este negocio. Lo ha logrado mantener gracias a la constante dedicación y buen servicio que Rosario ha logrado obtener durante el desempeño de este negocio.

Rosario solicita el crédito para incrementar y dar variedad a su negocio ya que se encuentra en pleno desarrollo del año escolar. Dado a la buena calidad de sus productos, a la atención y servicio a sus clientes les ha permitido aumentar el número de ellos. Rosario desea aprovechar esta oportunidad para crecer en su negocio.

Rosario tiene40 años es casada su esposo trabaja como chofer, en su tiempo libre el la ayuda en la atención del negocio. Tienen 3 hijos de los cuales uno estudia. Su vivienda es de construcción mixta, el piso es de tierra. Su deseo es que con el producto de su trabajo mejorar la condición de vida de su familia.

loans.use: Increase range of products

loans.name: Mirzo

texts.en:
Mirzo M. is 48 years old and is a historian. He is married and has got 3 children. Currently, Mirzo is working on a project as a consultant, but he grew up in a village so he is skilled at cattle raising from childhood. He has 1 bull-calf and some land where he grows corn and clover for cattle. This business is an additional source of income.

With this loan of $875, Mirzo is going buy 3 bull-calves to raise and then sell. This loan will allow him to increase the number of cattle he can raise and also give local inhabitants the opportunity buy meat near home at a low price. Mirzo is going to pay off the loan over a period of 10 months.

loans.use: to buy 3 bull-calves to fatten and sell

loans.name: Prihatini

texts.id:
Having a strategic selling place in the harbor is advantageous to Prihatini. Her daily customers are passengers who are waiting for the ship to depart. Having a limited fund of Rp. 500,000 (about $54.5), Prihatini often runs out of merchandise. Everyday Prihatini starts to sell from 10am until 11pm and her profit is Rp. 30,000 (about $3 ) per night. She wants to increase her quality of life by adding more merchandise to sell. Using the loan from Dinari, Prihatini has bought several kinds of beverages, cigarettes, and some other snacks. After increasing the quantity of the merchandise, Prihatini can double her profit to Rp. 60,000 (about $6.5) per night. This profit can make her family’s life better because her husband just works as a tukang ojek (a motorcycle driver who gets paid for sending people to their destination; usually travels in shorter distance compared to a taxi driver).

Translated from Indonesian by Kustini Lim, Kiva volunteer.

Menempati posisi yang strategis di pelabuhan untuk berjualan sangat menguntungkan Prihatini. Setiap harinya Prihatini melayani para pembeli yang merupakan penumpang kapal laut yang sedang menunggu kapal laut berlabuh. Dengan dana yang terbatas, yakni sebesar Rp. 500.000.-, Prihatini sering kewalahan bahkan kehabisan barang dagangannya. Setiap hari Prihatini mulai berjualan pukul 10.00 sampai dengan pukul 23.00 malam dan per malam keuntungan yang diperoleh sebesar Rp. 30.000.- Prihatini ingin meningkatkan kwalitas hidupnya dengan menambah barang dagangannya. Dengan pinjaman dari Dinari, Prihatini sudah membeli berbagai jenis minuman ringan, rokok dan makanan ringan lainnya. Setelah jumlah dagangannya bertambah, Prihatini bisa meningkatkan keuntungan itu menjadi dua kali lipat yaitu Rp. 60.000.- per malam. Keuntungan itu bisa menambah kesejahteraan keluarganya, karena suaminya hanya bekerja sebagai tukang ojek.

loans.use: To purchase various kind of snacks and beverages for more merchandise

loans.name: Sokmeng

texts.en:
Miss. Sokmeng Path is single and currently living with her father. She learned to weave silk from her elder sister in 1998 and started her silk production in the same year. She also trained her younger sister who is living in the same house to weave as well. Her mother now sews clothes in their home which she sells to people in her community. Sokmeng Path's father is a farmer. He  currently grows rice and other food crops to sell in the village. He would like to increase the family's income by running a horse and cart business, which will transport people and their goods to the market. 

This is the first time Sokmeng Path has applied for a loan with MAXIMA. She has asked for this $500 in order to purchase one horse so that her father can run the transportation service.

loans.use: to purchase one horse for her father so that he can run a business

loans.name: Chiara Group

texts.es:
The Chiara Community Bank was founded 6 months ago and has 16 partners.

Chiara is the name of the district where all the members come from and it is situated 1 hour away from the city of Ayacucho. Most of its population works on agriculture and their lands produce potatoes, corn, beans, wheat and vegetables.

Moreover, the members of the Community Bank breed small animals and cattle and at the Community Bank they are learning to be responsible, punctual and how to educate their children.

The women partners have different business like a groceries store, livestock breeding, dressmaking and selling meat and agricultural products. For instance, Maura, one of the partners, tailors regional clothes like aprons, white petticoats and tablecloth.

The women partners need different loan amounts, some are of 300 soles (100 usd), 600 soles (200 usd) or 900 soles (300usd), totaling 7500 soles (2500 usd) for the Chiara Community Bank as a whole.

The money will be invested purchasing rice, noodles, sugar cane, cigars, meat, cloth, animals and animal food.

The dreams of the partners are to have bigger business and to give their kids a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

El Banco Comunal Chiara se inició hace 6 meses y tiene 16 socias, lleva el nombre del distrito D. donD. son todos los socios.

Chiara en un distrito que está a una hora D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho donD. la población se dedica a la agricultura y sus tierras producen papa, maíz, haba, trigo y verduras. Además los socias y socias D. este banco comunal se dedican a la crianza D. animales menores y ganado.

En el Banco Comunal están aprendiendo a ser responsables, puntuales y a cómo educar a los hijos.

Las socias tienen diferentes negocios como tienda D. abarrotes, crianza D. animales, venta D. carne, agricultura, confección D. prendas D. vestir, engorD. D. vacuno. Como es el caso D. Maura que confecciona prendas D. vestir D. la zona como mandiles, fustanes y manteles.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. préstamos, algunos montos son D. 300 soles, 600 soles, 900 soles, haciendo un total D. 7500 soles D. préstamos para el Banco Comunal Chiara, los cuales serán invertidos en la compra D. arroz, fideo, caña, cigarro, carne, alimento para sus animales, telas, animales que benefician y venden.

Los sueños D. los socios es tener un negocio más granD. y dar una buena educación a sus hijos.

loans.use: The 16 partners of the Chiara Community Bank need different loan amounts of $100, $200 or $300, totaling $2500. The money will be invested purchasing rice, noodles, sugar cane, cigars, meat, cloth, livestock and animal food.

loans.name: Makprang

texts.en:
Mrs. K. Makprang (age 37) and her husband have been married since 1987. They have five daughters. One of her daughters weaves silk at home, three are studying in a local school, and the youngest one stays at home. Makprang and her family are living on an island off the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. She is in the business of weaving silk and raising pigs.  She learned to weave silk from her neighbor and started her silk production in 1985. Her husband works for a local company and sometimes helps her in raising pigs.

She has borrowed money from MAXIMA five times already. Now she is requesting another loan for $600 which she will use to purchase silk materials, sewing thread, fees for selecting and preparing silk on the loom and to buy baby pigs for raising.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials, sewing thread, fees for selecting and preparing silk on the loom and buy baby pig

loans.name: Mohammad Reza

texts.en: Mohammad Reza lives in district 6 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He lives with his nuclear family and has a carpentry shop. He has good experience in carpentry. He has been working at this trade since he was small boy. He opened a carpentry shop where he works independently, so he wants to take an individual loan to complete his stock and make a good monthly income to support his family. He is happy that he can further his business in this way.

loans.use: To complete his stock

loans.name: Ndiouthe

texts.fr:
Mrs. Ndouthe Sene is 30 years old, married and has been a reliable member of the Ngollar Village Bank for five and a half years. In order to help with the upkeep of her household, she would like to build her cattle and sheep business. She is requesting a 12th loan, which will be for a six-month term with a one-time repayment.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Mme Ndouthe SENE , 30 ans, mariée est une bonne membre du Banc villageois de Ngollar depuis cinq ans et demie . Afin d'aider à l'entretien de son foyer, elle souhaite renforcer son activité d'embouche bovine et ovine. Elle sollicite un 12ème prêt qui sera d'une durée de 6 mois avec une seule échéance.

loans.use: To buy animals and feed

loans.name: Fatma's Tusichukiane Group

texts.en:
Fatma is 40 years old and is a widow with 2 children, ages 25 and 22 years old. Fatma has been selling charcoal and fish since 2007. Every day, she works from 4m to 7pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.

Fatma now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who also have small businesses.The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Mehida

texts.es:
Each day Mehida's wish is to improve her economic situation, so she decided to do two things: firstly to sell propane filled balloons, and secondly to sell cosmetics. Mehida started doing these two things 6 years ago and her dream is to be able to improve the infraestructure of her house so that she can open up an adecuate area to sell her indespensible products from, as many housewives from the local area buy them from her.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Mehida, en sus deseos de mejorar cada día su situación económica decidió dedicarse a dos actividades: la principal es la venta de balones con gas propano y la segunda a la cosmetología.Son 6 años que Mehida realiza estas labores y su sueño es poder mejorar la infraestructura de su casa e implementar un local adecuado para ofertar desde este espacio el indispensable combustible para muchas amas de casa de su localidad.

loans.use: An injection of capital to make a suitable space to sell things from her house/Inyección de capital para implementar en su hogar un espacio adecuado de ventas.

loans.name: Oun

texts.en: Mrs. Oun P. lives in Keo Lart Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is a dessert seller in the village. Her husband, Mr. Saroeurn Bil, is a motorbike-taxi driver in the village. They have four children, two of whom are employed as their father in the same business activity. The two remaining are studying in a state school. Although the family members work, the family condition is still in poor. Additionally, they live in an old house, and the roof always leak during rainy season. In order to fix the roof, Mrs. Oun P. needed to access a loan to buy zinc to fix the roof. Her husband is on the right of the picture.

loans.use: To access a loan to buy zinc to fix the roof.

loans.name: Hang Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Hang Thi N. has been a TYM partner since 2005. She has 3 small children; therefore at the moment, she stays home to look after them and a family-based live-stock farm. She has been using loans to invest in her farming projects, and thanks to her experiences in farming, these projects have been bringing in revenues of approximately 7,000,000 Vietnamese Dong per year. Her husband is a bronze-smith worker, whose income is about 1,800,000 Vietnamese Dong per month. She plans to use the next loan of 6,000,000 Vietnamese Dong to renovate the farm and buy more pigs. Family’s frequent income is about 2,500,000 Vietnamese Dong per month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duc Tran, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Hằng tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương năm 2005. .Gia đình chị có 3 con còn nhỏ vì thế hiện tại chị đang ở nhà chăn nuôi và chăm sóc con cái.Từ khi tham gia vào Quỹ chị đều vay vốn để đầu tư vào các dự án chăn nuôi. Do có kinh nghiệm trong chăn nuôi nên các dự án này sau khi kết thúc đều cho thu nhập khoảng 7.000.000/ năm. Chồng chị hàng ngày đi đúc đồng thuê cho các xưởng đúc cho thu nhập 1.800.000đ/ tháng. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 6.000.000đ để sửa sang chuồng trại và mua thêm lợn về nuôi.

Thu nhập 2.500.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: invest in live-stock farm

loans.name: Yawa Kafui

texts.fr:
Born on October 13, 1982 in Agou Nyogbo, a village situated 110km from Lomé, Miss Yawa Kafui A. is single with one child in her care. She is trained as a nurse but has become a salesperson of hardware supplies in the neighborhood of Adidogomé in Lomé. She gets her supplies at the large stores of the Adawlato market and displays hardware items in her store. This first loan that she is requesting will allow her to buy 7 boxes of paint cans, 10 packets of nails and the rest of the loan will help her arrange her store.

Translated from French by Erin Johnson, Kiva Volunteer.

Née le 13 octobre 1982 à Agou Nyogbo, village situé à 110 Km de la ville de Lomé, Demoiselle A. Yawa Kafui est célibataire avec un enfant en charge. Elle est infirmière de formation mais est devenu revendeuse des articles de quincaillerie dans le quartier d’Adidogomé à Lomé. Elle s’approvisionne auprès des grands magasins du marché d’Adawlato et expose des articles de quincaillerie dans son magasin. Ce premier crédit qu’il sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 7 cartons de boite de peinture, 10 sachets de cloues et le reste du crédit lui permettra d’aménager son magasin.

loans.use: Purchase of hardware supplies

loans.name: Ayeba Komgba

texts.fr:
Dame B. Ayeba Komgba est née le 31 décembre 1966 à Kpangalan au nord du Togo. Elle est veuve et a trois enfants à charge. Depuis 1988, elle a commencé le commerce de produits génériques à Lomé. Actuellement son souci est de trouver les moyens pour pouvoir subvenir aux besoins scolaires de ses enfants. 
A cet effet, elle sollicite ce second crédit pour refaire son stock afin de pouvoir bien vendre et  dégager des revenus avant la rentrée  scolaire prochaine.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ayeba Komgba B. was born on December 31, 1966 in Kpangalan in the north of Togo. She is a widow and is raising three children. Back in 1988, she began selling generic products in Lomé. Presently, her worry is to find sufficient means to pay the school expenses for her children.

With this in mind, she is requesting this second loan to complete her stock so that she can make a lot of sales and have higher earnings before the beginning of the new school year.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of generic products for re-sale

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: Francisco se dedica a la labor de la jardinería, oficio que realiza de forma ambulante en algunas casas del municipio de Tipitapa en donde éste habita, y también otras veces viaja a Managua en busca de trabajo. Francisco tiene 35 años de edad, es soltero y no tiene hijos, el dinero ganado es para su sustento y ayuda a su familia. El préstamo será usado para comprar materiales de construcción y reparar ciertas partes de la vivienda de su familia que están en mal estado y ahora está siendo afectado por las lluvias.
texts.en:
Francisco is a gardener. He works for many houses in the Tipitapa municipality where he lives and other times he travels to Managua looking for work. Francisco is 35 years old, single and has no children. The money he makes is for his own sustenance and to help out his family. The loan will be used to buy construction materials and to fix those parts of his family's house that are in disrepair, as they have been affected by the heavy rainfalls.

Translated from Spanish by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials to repair his house

loans.name: Jacqueline Del Rosario

texts.es: Jacqueline tiene 26 años de edad, habita en el barrio Los Martinez del municipio de Ticuantepe, es casada y tiene tres hijos menores que están estudiando la primaria. Su esposo trabaja como enderezador y pintor de automóviles y está pendiente de las necesidades de su familia. Jacqueline trabaja en una empresa de zona franca como operaria de telas. Oficio en el que permanece casi todo el día y tiene que hacer doble esfuerzo para poder atender a su familia. Actualmente el techo de su vivienda está en mu mal estado, y el préstamo solicitado será para cambiar algunas partes del techo y así evitar un poco las dificultades que trae la lluvia. Espera poder seguir accediendo a estos créditos y así terminar de construir su vivienda.
texts.en:
Jacqueline, 26, lives in the Los Martinez neighborhood in Ticuantepe. She is married and has three young children who attend elementary school. Her husband does auto body repair and paint jobs, and he is always making sure that his family's needs are met. Jacqueline works in a free zone factory as a textile operator. Her job keeps her away from home the entire day, and she must double her efforts to also care of her family. The roof in Jacqueline's home is in very bad shape. The loan she is requesting will be used to replace portions of the roof, and fend off some of the difficulties that rains bring. Jacqueline hopes to finish building her home with the help of more loans in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Replacing portions of the home's roof

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy rice and sugar

loans.name: Diana

texts.es: La Sra. Diana tiene 42 años de edad, habita en el barrio Laureles Norte, estado civil casada, tiene dos hijos de 4 y 16 años de edad. Sus planes para su familia es construir  una parte de la casa que requiere mejoras y después construirla parcialmente la casa. Doña Diana se desempeña como conserje una empresa de transporte desde hace siete años sus labores es limpiar, hacer los mandados, servicios de café, entre otros, cuando sale del trabajo tiene que tomar la ruta para llegar a su casa, lo cual es una rutina cansada, y gana poco por eso en el ámbito laboral es cambiar de trabajo que posee a uno mejor con mayores ingresos para ofrecerles a sus hijos un patrimonio. Gracias a los préstamos de Afodenic lograr comprar materiales de construcción como: Cemento, hierro, bloque y ladrillo, ofreciéndole a su familia seguridad y protección, y sobre todo una vivienda digna
texts.en:
Diana is 42 and lives in the district of Laurales Norte. She is married and has two children, 4 and 16. Her plan is to work on the part of her house that needs repairs, and then to partially improve her house. Diana has worked as a caretaker for a transportation company for seven years. Her job involves cleaning, shopping, and serving coffee, among other tasks, and after work she has to go home, a routine she is tired of. She does not earn much, so her goal is to find a new job that pays more so she can provide for her children’s future. Thanks to the loans from AFODENIC, she will be able to buy construction materials such as cement, iron, blocks, and bricks, so she can offer her family security and protection, and above all, a decent home.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials to repair her home

loans.name: Hout

texts.en:
Hout K. is 41 years old and is a true entrepreneur. She has her own business catching and selling fish and making hammocks to sell in the market. She is able to make $2.50 a day while her husband Sa Lann, 45 years old, has a business catching fish. He makes about $3 a day. They have seven children, two are students and four are fisherman. 

Mrs. Hout K. is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase more fishing tools to catch more fish.

loans.use: To purchase more fishing tools.
